story:
Necessity Really is the Mother of Invention!

 Swabbies was developed out of necessity.  As a single mother of three children, I experienced years of diaper changings and wrangling squirming babies, often which go hand in hand.  Desperately wishing I had a free hand and a clean hand at the end of it, I was inspired to create a better diaper rash formula combined with an effective, no mess, one-handed method for administering. 

 

  

 

   The design of the applicator is such that it can be applied with one hand.  Not only will Swabbies allow for one hand to remain free, but its design also reduces and almost eliminates any messy applications.  Because the foam applicator is a part of the original design, the person administering the treatment will not need to put any of the cream on their hands, unlike all other diaper creams on the market.  This aspect of the product is most appealing when in a rush, when traveling when concerned about sanitary purposes or ON-THE-GO!

Athletes and a caretaker of an elderly patient will also appreciate the design not only for sanitary reasons, but or the efficiency of applying the cream.

 

 

 

 

 

 

  

 

 

Swabbies Features:

  • Formula allows skin to "breathe"
  • Hypo Allergenic
  • No Phalates, Parabens, or Mineral Oil
  • Doctor Recommended
  • Starts working immediately
  • Many rashes relieved within 24-48 hours
  • Prevents, protects, and soothes
  • No messy hands

Product Benefits:

  • Helps to stop redness, and soreness
  • Relieves irritation and chafing
  • Soothes and softens skin
  • Allows skin to "breathe" while protecting from wetness and bacterial contamination
  • Sanitary with no skin to skin contact
  • BPA Free recyclable plastic applicator with a Latex Free sponge

 

    

 

 

 

Herbal Cream Ingredients:

Vitis vinifera (Grapeseed) Oil, Zinc Oxide(, Apis mellifera (Yellow Beeswax), Lavandula spp. (Lavender 40/42) Essential Oil, Tocopherol (Vitamin E), Limmnanthes alba (Meadowfoam) Oil (Refined), Melaleuca alternifolia (Tea Tree) Essential Oil, Anthemis nobilis (Chamomile Roman) Essential Oil, Sodium Bicarbonate, Rosa mosqueta (Rosehip) Seed Oil, Butyrospermun parkii (Shea) Oil, Simmondsia chinensis (Jojoba) Oil, Matricaria chamomilla (German Chamomile) Essential Oil, Allantoin (5-ureidohydantoin) , Calendula officinalis (Calendula) Extract in Olea europaea (Organic Olive) Oil

Our cream is manufactured, filled, and packaged in the USA @ GMP & FDA approved facilities. There are lot numbers and expiration dates on each tube. We want only the best for you!

 

 

 

 

Why Is This Important To Consumers:

 

 

 

Great For Travel!! Just Throw Into Bag or A Purse. No More Large Sticky Messy Tubes Or Hands. A One Shot Application With A High % Of Zinc Oxide For Safe Rapid Relief!  Sanitary & Easy!

 

 

Swabbies Is For Anyone Who Wants To Keep There Fingers Clean From Diaper Cream!

 

  • Busy Parents

  • Care Takers

  • Travelers

  • Athletes

  • Health Conscious

  • Hospitals

  • Nursing Homes

 

How You Can Help:

We are seeking your contributions by pre-ordering Swabbies! Be the first to receive this innovative product. Check out our great perk packages that include special gifts!

 

Funding Will Be Used To Complete The Manufacturing

 

The Present Situation….

Currently we have 30,000 printed tubes & 30,000 latex free sponges ready to be filled, assembled, & packaged.

We will use your contributions to manufacture the herbal cream, fill the tubes, assemble & then package the finished Swabbs for distribution.

 

Our Intellectual Property:

The Patent has been allowed by the USPTO and will be issued before August 2015

The logo name Swabbies® is a registered trademark

The logos, artwork, and website are all copyrighted

    Task and Challenges

    Keeping up with demand after the initial round of production. We anticipate rapid growth and worldwide demand for our Swabbs, as more buyers are interested and orders come in.

     

     

    SO GO SHARE & SPREAD THE WORD!!!

story:
Television for Laramie WY

There are only 2 over-the-air Television broadcast stations in the entire state of Wyoming.  Most of the state is not represented in TV.  Since technology has now made it possible to produce a TV show and broadcast it over the Internet, we are changing the paradigm with a smaller station in a smaller community.  Laramie is on the cutting edge of technology.

  • The station and show are already up and running.  Check us out at http://Laramie247.com
  • We've already published the most comprehensive EVENTS CALENDAR for Laramie.  There's always something to do in Laramie!  We want to keep the calendar growing.
  • Technology has advanced enough to make this possible.  But don't be fooled.  Just because we are not broadcasting "over the air" doesn't mean we can take shortcuts.  We have to work just as hard to get the story and produce a quality show.  This funding will help us add some needed equipment and bring on new staff.  
  • Viewing is easy on virtually any device: TV, computer, tablet, or phone.  We'll show you how to "cut" the cable.  It's not limited to just Laramie either.  Anyone with Internet access can watch the shows.  You'll be able to tell your out-of-town friends how to find out about Laramie.
  • This campaign will provide us with the funds needed to produce a new show EVERY DAY with fresh content.  We'll keep you informed all day long.
  • Every dollar contributed makes the community richer with a news outlet that will soon be the primary media outlet for Laramie.

It's your town!  Let's tell everyone what Laramie has to offer.

What We Need & What You Get

Hopefully, it is obvious.  This campaign is just to get the funding we need to continue our start up of the TV station.  Sponsors will keep the show alive and well.  Here is the full plan:

  • We are seeking $10,000.  We need more staff and a little more equipment.  With this, we'll be able to cover all of Laramie including the sports from the schools, the entertainment, and the news.
  • 75% of the funds will go to salaries for the staff and to add additional staff needed to produce the show daily.  25% of the funds will be used to purchase additional equipment (cameras, microphones, studio equipment).
  • You'll get an easy to view program that is available on-demand 24 hours per day, 7 days a week.  
  • We'll work hard to keep you informed of everything that's happening in Laramie and the surrounding areas.
  • We'll also provide you with local breaking news, something Laramie is missing.

Risks & Challenges

Folks, it's really simple here.  If we don't get funding, we go out of business and Laramie doesn't get a great show and TV station.  We are truly excited about all the great content we have in store for you.  Our audience is growing quickly and the feedback has been incredible.  Help us get this show into full production right now.

Other Ways You Can Help

It's easy to help even if you can't contribute financially:

  • First, watch the shows.  http://Laramie247.com
  • Help spread the word about the new TV station in Laramie.  Tell your friends and family.
  • Like us and share on Facebook.  http://www.facebook.com/Laramie247
  • Use the events calendar.
  • Post your events to the events calendar.  It's free!
  • Volunteer as a staff member.  Help with a location shoot or with production of a television commercial.  Volunteer as a hometown journalist and send us your photos/videos and stories.
  • Tell us about events that we need to cover.  There is so much we miss because we just don't know.  Let's get a TV crew out there to record your event.

We're ready.

story:
In order to salvage our donations and continue on with our mission to alleviate poverty in Nicaragua, we need your help to repair our warehouses. You can donate as little as $1. 

ANF works with a network of over 1,200 governmental, religious, and nonprofit entities — schools, rural clinics, orphanages, elderly homes, hospitals, etc. — to ensure the delivery of humanitarian aid to the most vulnerable communities in poverty-stricken Nicaragua. Since 1992, ANF has distributed over $1.6 billion worth of aid across the country.

In 2014, we distributed 378 ocean-freight containers of aid, all stored in our 3 warehouses, which together have the surface area of a US football field. After 20 years of wear and tear, these warehouses are in danger of collapsing.

Nicaragua’s poor are at risk of losing 36,000 meals per day, medicine and supplies for 140 medical centers, and educational materials for 75,000 children and 600 schools. Will you help us prevent this potential catastrophe?

Nicaragua's rainy season starts in June. Heavy rainfall and strong tropical winds put our entire operation at risk. We need your help.

As Nicaragua’s 2nd largest importer and 1st largest relief and development organization, ANF depends on its worn-down warehouses to store donated aid.

What will you be safeguarding with your donations? Items include:

  • Medicine and medical equipment
  • Wheelchairs and mobility assistive devices
  • School supplies
  • Classroom furniture
  • Household items and construction materials
  • Food such as vitamin-fortified soy blends, rice, beans, milk, cereals, etc.

ANF operates to achieve maximum impact for every donation. Of every $1 received, only $0.02 is spent on administrative expenses, maximizing what can be contributed to those who need it most: Nicaragua’s poor. This leaves our organization with very limited resources for extraordinary expenses such as the one we are facing now with our warehouses.

The total cost of the roof repairs is quoted at $164,153 (roughly $2.50/ft2), an out-of-pocket expense that can no longer be avoided. (After a lengthy proposal process involving 5 contractors, we chose the winning vendor based on costs, transparency, and experience.)

Funding covers the following costs:

  • 1 month of construction workers’ labor
  • 2 full roof placements
  • 1 roof repair
  • Lateral structural repairs
  • Roof insulation
  • Fixtures for harnesses and other safety measures
  • All materials required
  • 10-year guarantee

Hundreds of impoverished communities depend on us. Let's not let them down.

Please help us keep our commitment to Nicaragua’s poorest communities and ensure the delivery of these much-needed donations. On behalf of the thousands of people we serve, the ANF family thanks you for your generosity and support.

story:
UPDATE 30/07/2015

We know we are still far from our goal in our last 3 days, but don't worry, we re-evaluated our plan and our goals and we have plan B! The village is still happening and its actually looking better every day! Few days after the end of the campaign, knowing exactly how much we've raised we will inform you on where your money will be going exactly :) Still, who knows, people may just go crazy in last 2 hours and we can do it! You never know :)

Hello! Welcome to 



In a beautiful Koh Lanta island, Thailand


We are a group of 3 people, a couple and a friend and we share 3 big passions: art, ecology and fire dance. In March this year we came across this amazing land (2400 sq m) with a house and a huge front room on Koh Lanta island in Thailand. We've decided to rent it and start a venture called Eco Art Village.







What we want the Eco Art Village to be ? 

We want to create a small, artistic and peaceful community where people can just visit for an hour or stay for a month. A place for travelers, tourist, backpackers and locals. 

  • We want the village to be a small guest house, which we build ourselves with help of international volunteers, created mainly by means of natural building, drift wood, old jungle wood, shells, stones, creative recycling and up-cycling. 
    Guest house where our guests will be encouraged to join us in artistic activities.
  • We are already running Fire/Circus School. It is a school where people can learn how to dance with fire with various props and how to walk the slackline.
  •  We will educate visitors about environment and ecology and promote sustainable and natural ways of living. We are already working with Trash Hero Koh Lipe organization and in near future we will be big part of Trash Hero Koh Lanta
  •  We will hold various artistic workshops (creative recycling, jewelery making, natural building and more).
  • We will hold daily, donation based, yoga classes.
  • We will grow our own food. 
  • We will have a daytime bar with healthy, homemade drinks and food (Thai and Western).
  •  We will have a Happy Hippy shop with handmade jewelery, clothing, accessories and home decorations (open to artist/travelers to display and sell their work without commission.) .
  • We will teach English for free to local children and get our guests and volunteers involved.

 The Village is located by the road which cuts through the island, connecting West and East side. We are surrounded by nature and jungle, but only 1,2 km away from beautiful, 4 km long beach with amazing sunsets almost every day. The nearest bars and restaurants are 1 km away which makes this place quiet and peaceful at night. Our next door neighbor are: Elephant Safari Camp, Butterfly farm, Orchid Farm and Fruit Farm

Let me introduce the team to those who don't know who we are:

Kat is 26 years old traveler, artist and fire performer from Poland. She's been living abroad and traveling for over 7 years. Before coming to the village, she lived in and managed another art community/backpacker hostel for 14 months. She is a hard working dreamer who knows how to be realistic and organize work and resources, she is a problem solver, 20 years yoga practitioner, artist, jewelery maker and fire dancer. She also knows how to build things, using power tools and natural resources. She can speak 3 languages and now she is studying Thai. 

Noi is one of the most diversely talented Thai people you will probably meet and he's been living on Koh Lanta for 11 years. He is 40 and he can dance with fire (almost every kind of prop), cook, make jewelery, design and build (house, toilet, furniture, bar, rabbit cage - you name it), mix cocktails, paint masterpieces, tattoo, make beautiful things out of trash picked up from the sea, dance, do landscaping and gardening... And he is amazing at all of those skills!  He's super handyman and speaks 2 languages.

Ronny is half Thai, half Swedish, incredible fire performer (Poi and staff) and great teacher, traveler and also very creative soul. He is 28 years old and when he isn't traveling, he's living in Sweden. He speaks 3 languages. Ronny will be joining us around September/October and staying for all high season. He will help with the building and artistic part, but mostly, he will be teaching in the fire school and make play props (poi, sticks, etc) for the Happy Hippy shop. 


We are now in what's called Low Season (May till November) when there is a lot of rain and there is very little tourism on the island. Therefore, this is our time to work, to be ready to welcome people to our community in November! 
The strong rain and frequent storms bring all sorts of things to the beach that we can re-use like ropes, fisherman equipment that can be turned into various useful/artistic projects, hangers, lighters (we make lamps and installations) and most important for us - lots and lots of beautiful, unique and strong drift wood, our main building material that we can make almost anything with - tables, chairs, outdoor shower, garden set up, chilling platforms and more... All reclaimed and re-used wood, often very unique because of the sea shaping.


What We Need & What You Get

We already paid a rent for one year and invested some money into painting, renovating and making it a home for us and other wanderers.


But in order to make it to the functional and thriving community we are dreaming of -  we need your help.

Here is the list of the projects that need financial support and estimated cost (please note we pay for almost everything in Thai Baht thats why we give rough US dollar price):


  • Bamboo hut for visitors to stay. We plan to have 6 for start(we have one already), although we have enough space for about 8 or 9 and if we go over with our goal we will buy more. Cost of one fairly basic hut is 350$ so 5 huts will be - around 1750$
  • Electric supplies to connect huts to power - around 125$
  • Outdoor shower  - around 80$
  • Outdoor compost toilet - around 95$
  • Manure compost bin  - around 65$
  • More sophisticated and cleaner rain water collection system ( we have one already, but very very basic, a funnel at the edge of roof with 50 gallon/200 l container below, which we fill daily in rain season) - around 65$
  • Running water system (we use bucket system at the moment)  - around 160$
  • Set of 6 colors acrylic paint cans for our guests and us  - around 65$
  • Sewing machine to create beautiful unique designs for our Happy Hippy Shop (We have lots and lots beautiful, mostly re-claimed fabric)  - around 95$
  • Dremel machine to help us create amazing handmade jewelery - around 50$
  • Fridge with a freezer (we live without one at the moment) - around 300$ for new one but we will try to get a second hand
  • 2nd hand pillows and sheets and mosquito nets for our huts - around 80$
  • 4 double mattresses for the huts (we have 2 already) - around 150$
  • 3 fans for the huts (we have 3 already) - around 40$
  • Installation of the Internet  - around 80$
  • Cement platform (decorated with bottles, shells, sea glass and broken tiles) for circus and yoga workshops and palm leaf roof - around 150$
  • Lawn mower (it's ridiculous how fast the grass grow here and with 2400 sq m it's not easy to manage) - around 150$ for a new one but we will try to get a second hand 
  • Palm leaf fence to separate us from Elephant Camp and Banana Farm - around 95$
  • Soil and seed, garden tools and equipment  - around 90$
  • Alminium pipes, tenis balls, socks etc to make more training props - around 40$
  • 7 Yoga mats - around 70$

In case we don't reach our full goal... We cannot exactly tell you now which of projects we will chose to go on with. It all depend on the funds we will raise. After the campaign finishes and we know how much money we've raised we will make a detailed plan and share it with you!  

If we are lucky to raise more money than our goal there is so much more we can do! We would buy 1 or 2 more of the huts to allow more people to stay in the community. We would buy a TV or with more money - a projector, as we are dreaming of having a sleep over movie nights and documentary watching evenings. We would buy more paint. We would buy a tattoo gun for Noi, so we can open alongside a tattoo shop (a little dream of Noi). We would also buy more hammocks ;)  

For your generous contributions, you will have our eternal gratitude, facebook thank yous, skype calls, invitations to stay with us as VIP guests and...

we just added few new handmade perks:

One and only unique lamp, made entirely out of lighters and plastic that was picked up from the sea in low season. It took Noi 2 months to pick up the lighters (about 1500) and one month of work to create it! 

Hand made coconut and shells gratitude "bells"

And hand wrapped various beautiful shells from Andaman sea.... Made into pendants that can be either used to make a necklace or key ring. With or without macrame necklace cords.


The Impact


  • This project is an amazing opportunity for us to create something really unique on Koh Lanta - peaceful and relaxed community without the distractions of loud music and bars, yet civilized enough for most levels of comfort (and with a wi-fi!). Only 1 km away from busy seaside village, where travelers can go out and enjoy the vibrant island night life, but be able to return to the quiet village for a peaceful night sleep. Place with so little light pollution that enables incredible night sky view, place where they will wake up to birds chirrups, where you will open  your doors to elephants and horses


    Place where you can learn how to re-use something you thought of as garbage, to turn it into something useful or decorative. Place where you can learn about natural medicines and natural beauty. We are also working with Trash Hero Koh Lipe and helping to start Trash Hero Koh Lanta.We will be hosting weekly free English lessons for the local Thai children
  • We believe in our success as we are all experienced in many areas relevant to the project: 

    Kat  before moving to the village managed another well known  community/backpacker hostel for 14 months, where she gained experience in natural building (clay, bamboo, drift wood), organizing a life and finances for the community, volunteer management and much more. She is also a very creative artist, DIY person, creative "recycler", yoga practitioner with 18 years experience and a fire performer, with teacher level for majority of her skills. You can watch the video of her giving a tour of her last project in the Extras.
    Noi is experienced builder and handyman, he helped to build, create and run many bars and shops in Thailand. He is super creative artist, creative "recycler", DIY person, amazing cook, fantastic fire performer and very good teacher for all the skills he posses.
    Ronny owned and run a beach bar before, he is amazing fire performer with great teaching skills and also a handyman with a lot of super creative ideas.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risk in any kind of business or venture. But we believe we are qualified and ready to overcome any as they come, as we are all extremely passionate about what we are doing!

 It's not just a business, those are our passions (art, ecology and environment, building, creations, communal living style,  yoga, fire dancing) which we turn in to way of living and earning our living. By sharing our passions with the world, and at the same time, promote sustainable living and help the health of our planet. Plus we are best friends and have good network of amazing people around us, ready to support us.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone has a few (or a lot) dollars to spare but you can still help us!
Please help us to make some noise about our campaign, by sharing it with your friends and family, who knows, maybe in your friends circle there will be folks who will get super excited about our project.
Please don't be shy to use the sharing tools! :) 


THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR THE TIME YOU TOOK TO READ ABOUT OUR PROJECT, WE HOPE YOU ARE HAPPY TO SUPPORT US AND WE WILL SEE YOU IN OUR ECO ART VILLAGE ONE DAY :)
story_txt:
UPDATE 30/07/2015
We know we are still far from our goal in our last 3 days, but don't worry, we re-evaluated our plan and our goals and we have plan B! The village is still happening and its actually looking better every day! Few days after the end of the campaign, knowing exactly how much we've raised we will inform you on where your money will be going exactly :) Still, who knows, people may just go crazy in last 2 hours and we can do it! You never know :)

Hello! Welcome to 




In a beautiful Koh Lanta island, Thailand




We are a group of 3 people, a couple and a friend and we share 3 big passions: art, ecology and fire dance. In March this year we came across this amazing land (2400 sq m) with a house and a huge front room on Koh Lanta island in Thailand. We've decided to rent it and start a venture called Eco Art Village.














What we want the Eco Art Village to be ? 
We want to create a small, artistic and peaceful community where people can just visit for an hour or stay for a month. A place for travelers, tourist, backpackers and locals. 


We want the village to be a small guest house, which we build ourselves with help of international volunteers, created mainly by means of natural building, drift wood, old jungle wood, shells, stones, creative recycling and up-cycling. Guest house where our guests will be encouraged to join us in artistic activities.
We are already running Fire/Circus School. It is a school where people can learn how to dance with fire with various props and how to walk the slackline.


 We will educate visitors about environment and ecology and promote sustainable and natural ways of living. We are already working with Trash Hero Koh Lipe organization and in near future we will be big part of Trash Hero Koh Lanta

 We will hold various artistic workshops (creative recycling, jewelery making, natural building and more).

We will hold daily, donation based, yoga classes.


We will grow our own food. 


We will have a daytime bar with healthy, homemade drinks and food (Thai and Western).

 We will have a Happy Hippy shop with handmade jewelery, clothing, accessories and home decorations (open to artist/travelers to display and sell their work without commission.) .
We will teach English for free to local children and get our guests and volunteers involved.

 The Village is located by the road which cuts through the island, connecting West and East side. We are surrounded by nature and jungle, but only 1,2 km away from beautiful, 4 km long beach with amazing sunsets almost every day. The nearest bars and restaurants are 1 km away which makes this place quiet and peaceful at night. Our next door neighbor are: Elephant Safari Camp, Butterfly farm, Orchid Farm and Fruit Farm
Let me introduce the team to those who don't know who we are:
Kat is 26 years old traveler, artist and fire performer from Poland. She's been living abroad and traveling for over 7 years. Before coming to the village, she lived in and managed another art community/backpacker hostel for 14 months. She is a hard working dreamer who knows how to be realistic and organize work and resources, she is a problem solver, 20 years yoga practitioner, artist, jewelery maker and fire dancer. She also knows how to build things, using power tools and natural resources. She can speak 3 languages and now she is studying Thai. 


Noi is one of the most diversely talented Thai people you will probably meet and he's been living on Koh Lanta for 11 years. He is 40 and he can dance with fire (almost every kind of prop), cook, make jewelery, design and build (house, toilet, furniture, bar, rabbit cage - you name it), mix cocktails, paint masterpieces, tattoo, make beautiful things out of trash picked up from the sea, dance, do landscaping and gardening... And he is amazing at all of those skills!  He's super handyman and speaks 2 languages.

Ronny is half Thai, half Swedish, incredible fire performer (Poi and staff) and great teacher, traveler and also very creative soul. He is 28 years old and when he isn't traveling, he's living in Sweden. He speaks 3 languages. Ronny will be joining us around September/October and staying for all high season. He will help with the building and artistic part, but mostly, he will be teaching in the fire school and make play props (poi, sticks, etc) for the Happy Hippy shop. 


   
We are now in what's called Low Season (May till November) when there is a lot of rain and there is very little tourism on the island. Therefore, this is our time to work, to be ready to welcome people to our community in November! 
The strong rain and frequent storms bring all sorts of things to the beach that we can re-use like ropes, fisherman equipment that can be turned into various useful/artistic projects, hangers, lighters (we make lamps and installations) and most important for us - lots and lots of beautiful, unique and strong drift wood, our main building material that we can make almost anything with - tables, chairs, outdoor shower, garden set up, chilling platforms and more... All reclaimed and re-used wood, often very unique because of the sea shaping.





What We Need & What You Get We already paid a rent for one year and invested some money into painting, renovating and making it a home for us and other wanderers.







But in order to make it to the functional and thriving community we are dreaming of -  we need your help.
Here is the list of the projects that need financial support and estimated cost (please note we pay for almost everything in Thai Baht thats why we give rough US dollar price):




Bamboo hut for visitors to stay. We plan to have 6 for start(we have one already), although we have enough space for about 8 or 9 and if we go over with our goal we will buy more. Cost of one fairly basic hut is 350$ so 5 huts will be - around 1750$

Electric supplies to connect huts to power - around 125$
Outdoor shower  - around 80$


Outdoor compost toilet - around 95$

Manure compost bin  - around 65$
More sophisticated and cleaner rain water collection system ( we have one already, but very very basic, a funnel at the edge of roof with 50 gallon/200 l container below, which we fill daily in rain season) - around 65$

Running water system (we use bucket system at the moment)  - around 160$

Set of 6 colors acrylic paint cans for our guests and us  - around 65$

Sewing machine to create beautiful unique designs for our Happy Hippy Shop (We have lots and lots beautiful, mostly re-claimed fabric)  - around 95$

Dremel machine to help us create amazing handmade jewelery - around 50$

Fridge with a freezer (we live without one at the moment) - around 300$ for new one but we will try to get a second hand

2nd hand pillows and sheets and mosquito nets for our huts - around 80$

4 double mattresses for the huts (we have 2 already) - around 150$

3 fans for the huts (we have 3 already) - around 40$

Installation of the Internet  - around 80$

Cement platform (decorated with bottles, shells, sea glass and broken tiles) for circus and yoga workshops and palm leaf roof - around 150$

Lawn mower (it's ridiculous how fast the grass grow here and with 2400 sq m it's not easy to manage) - around 150$ for a new one but we will try to get a second hand 

Palm leaf fence to separate us from Elephant Camp and Banana Farm - around 95$

Soil and seed, garden tools and equipment  - around 90$

Alminium pipes, tenis balls, socks etc to make more training props - around 40$

7 Yoga mats - around 70$



In case we don't reach our full goal... We cannot exactly tell you now which of projects we will chose to go on with. It all depend on the funds we will raise. After the campaign finishes and we know how much money we've raised we will make a detailed plan and share it with you!  


If we are lucky to raise more money than our goal there is so much more we can do! We would buy 1 or 2 more of the huts to allow more people to stay in the community. We would buy a TV or with more money - a projector, as we are dreaming of having a sleep over movie nights and documentary watching evenings. We would buy more paint. We would buy a tattoo gun for Noi, so we can open alongside a tattoo shop (a little dream of Noi). We would also buy more hammocks ;)  


For your generous contributions, you will have our eternal gratitude, facebook thank yous, skype calls, invitations to stay with us as VIP guests and...

we just added few new handmade perks:

One and only unique lamp, made entirely out of lighters and plastic that was picked up from the sea in low season. It took Noi 2 months to pick up the lighters (about 1500) and one month of work to create it! 


Hand made coconut and shells gratitude "bells"


And hand wrapped various beautiful shells from Andaman sea.... Made into pendants that can be either used to make a necklace or key ring. With or without macrame necklace cords.





The Impact

   This project is an amazing opportunity for us to create something really unique on Koh Lanta - peaceful and relaxed community without the distractions of loud music and bars, yet civilized enough for most levels of comfort (and with a wi-fi!). Only 1 km away from busy seaside village, where travelers can go out and enjoy the vibrant island night life, but be able to return to the quiet village for a peaceful night sleep. Place with so little light pollution that enables incredible night sky view, place where they will wake up to birds chirrups, where you will open  your doors to elephants and horsesPlace where you can learn how to re-use something you thought of as garbage, to turn it into something useful or decorative. Place where you can learn about natural medicines and natural beauty. We are also working with Trash Hero Koh Lipe and helping to start Trash Hero Koh Lanta.We will be hosting weekly free English lessons for the local Thai children



We believe in our success as we are all experienced in many areas relevant to the project: Kat  before moving to the village managed another well known  community/backpacker hostel for 14 months, where she gained experience in natural building (clay, bamboo, drift wood), organizing a life and finances for the community, volunteer management and much more. She is also a very creative artist, DIY person, creative "recycler", yoga practitioner with 18 years experience and a fire performer, with teacher level for majority of her skills. You can watch the video of her giving a tour of her last project in the Extras.Noi is experienced builder and handyman, he helped to build, create and run many bars and shops in Thailand. He is super creative artist, creative "recycler", DIY person, amazing cook, fantastic fire performer and very good teacher for all the skills he posses.Ronny owned and run a beach bar before, he is amazing fire performer with great teaching skills and also a handyman with a lot of super creative ideas.
 
   Risks & Challenges There are always risk in any kind of business or venture. But we believe we are qualified and ready to overcome any as they come, as we are all extremely passionate about what we are doing!
 It's not just a business, those are our passions (art, ecology and environment, building, creations, communal living style,  yoga, fire dancing) which we turn in to way of living and earning our living. By sharing our passions with the world, and at the same time, promote sustainable living and help the health of our planet. Plus we are best friends and have good network of amazing people around us, ready to support us.



    Other Ways You Can Help We know that not everyone has a few (or a lot) dollars to spare but you can still help us! Please help us to make some noise about our campaign, by sharing it with your friends and family, who knows, maybe in your friends circle there will be folks who will get super excited about our project.Please don't be shy to use the sharing tools! :) 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR THE TIME YOU TOOK TO READ ABOUT OUR PROJECT, WE HOPE YOU ARE HAPPY TO SUPPORT US AND WE WILL SEE YOU IN OUR ECO ART VILLAGE ONE DAY :)

story:
Short Summary

Hello, My name is Alexander Gilbert and I am 9 years old.  Last spring my parents told me that  I should start to earn some of my spending money (I love Lego!).  My parents gave me some ideas like delivering newspapers or cutting lawns or they offered $100 to start my own business.   I took the $100 and with my parents help, thought about what I liked to do, like playing  with my dog, Bruno  (that's his picture on the logo) and fooling around in the kitchen when the idea for Big Guy Biscuits was born. 

I currently sell door-to-door and at local festivals with the help of my crew - Mom is my head baker,  Dad is the finance guy and my buddies are my sales team.

My success so far has been pretty cool.  I have a number of standing weekly orders from regular customers and festival organizers are starting to call me to see if I want to participate in their event.   The popularity of Big Guy Biscuits is growing!

With your help I would like to expand my business by creating an online shopping site, getting my product into speciality stores and participate in more festivals in Ontario Canada.   My goal is take my brand national and to be one of the youngest successful business owners in history!


What We Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise $10,000.00
The first $5000 will go to professional services required to design and host my online store.
$3000 will go to marketing the website and fees related to participating in  festivals
The final $2000 will go to purchasing professional-grade smallwares that will make the production of my biscuits more efficient.
If I am not able to raise enough capital to finance my webpage,  I will use the funds for local marketing (in community newspapers)  to increase my sales and eventually pay for my on-line store.

The Impact

As an all-round animal lover,  I would like my business to have an impact on the quality of life for animals, starting with dogs. 
I currently donate 10% of my sales to local dog-related charities and plan to continue to do this.
I also plan to continue to include my buddies in more of the business as it grows.  So you will be helping the next generation learn the value of earning our own money, of working hard to achieve a goal and of paying for our university education.
 

Risks & Challenges

There is always the risk that my product does not achieve national success but I'm young with lots of energy so I'm ready to keep working hard to take Big Guy Biscuits as far as I can!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute I would be very thankful if you could share my campaign with your friends.

story:
Dream Star is a brand new children's book with a universal message about finding your purpose and shining your own light.

Dream Star is a little star who is sad because his light doesn't shine as brightly as all the other stars. The story shares with you his journey as he finds out why and learns the power of his purpose in the heavens.

Candy Barone, the Founder and CEO, of You Empowered Strong, LLC, and the author of Dream Star, believes that a beautiful light lives within each of us. Her purpose and the mission of her company is to provide others with the means and tools to empower themselves for greatness.

As such, being able to take this story to children who unfortunately find themselves hospitalized is an opportunity to serve the larger community and bring some happiness and hope to their faces.

This campaign is to provide the funds to take an entire kit that includes the children's book itself, a matching coloring book (with crayons), and a hand-crafted Dream Star plush pillow for them to snuggle with. Candy's intention is to start her efforts with Texas Children's Hospital and expand from there.

In addition to bringing a Dream Star story kit for each child at the hospital, Candy also will be scheduling readings to share the story with the kids, as well.

Background on Dream Star: This is a story I created when I was about 12 years old. My parents were going through an ugly divorce and things were a bit unsettling on the home front. My younger sister, Crystal, was really upset one night and asked me to tell her a story. So, I climbed into bed with her to tell her a story ... and, Dream Star was born!

story:
Help Pintrasonne start his bar/restaurant and campsite ‘ The Leopard Spot’ in Milange, Mozambique


Pintrasonne Naisonne      


Pintrasonne (50) born and bred in Milange wants to start a bar/restaurant and camping site 1km outside the small border town of Milange, Zambezia province in Northern Mozambique. He needs 3000 USD to get the place up and running. ‘The Leopard Spot’ as the campsite has been named, is a beautiful site with wildlife (hence the name), rivers and streams with stunning views over neighboring Malawian tea plantations.


 

View from The Leopard Spot 

Pintrasonne started working on the campsite in 2008 when it was developed by a charity. He helped  build the restaurant and restore the ruined (17m-long) swimming pool, kitchen, toilets and a pizza oven. He is a skilled builder and a local leader and he is passionate about helping the local community. As for many Mozambicans, life is a struggle but by starting his own restaurant/campsite he hopes to provide many jobs for his family and the community. When the charity moved earlier this year, Pintrasonne was given the use of the future campsite as a reward for his hard work and loyalty. With 6 children of his own, he and his wife have also adopted his 8 orphaned nephews and nieces. Paulinho, his eldest son is an ace student and as the family member who speaks most English, it is he who appeals on video on behalf of his dad.

                                           Pintrasonne with his family 


Because Mozambican banks don’t lend money to workers to start a project like this, Pintrasonne needs help. His family forms a perfect team and with a small injection of cash - your help  - he can transform the tourism scene in town, ensuring local ownership, sustainability...and some great times for travellers!!

Every donation really helps. Every infrastructure improvement we can make will lead to the next one. Pintrasonne wants to work and is very sad that he has come that far in creating the first buildings but still cannot offer guest more than the stunning view. He wants to sell them drinks and pizza and he wants to offer accommodation. He only needs a few things done before he can officially open. 


                                       Restoration of the 17m-long swimming pool 


Before Pintrasonne can open 'The Leopard Spot' he needs

Electricity connected

500 USD

18603.29 MTS

Freezer

350 USD

13022.30 MTS

Government license

450 USD

16742.96 MTS

Plates, cups, glasses etc

160 USD

 5953.05 MTS

Cutlery

  80 USD

 2976.53 MTS

Pots and pans

  80 USD

 2976.53 MTS

Grill

  30 USD

 1116.20 MTS

4 Tables & 16 Chairs

250 USD

 9301.64 MTS

Watertank

300 USD

11161.97 MTS

New roof

400 USD

14882.63 MTS

Furniture

200 USD

 7441.31 MTS

Tents

200 USD

 7441.31 MTS

Total

3000 USD

  111619.72 MTS


                                   The Leopard Spot under construction


About Milange

A small bustling Mozambican town on the border with Malawi. It is full of businessmen, truck drivers, local government employees, farmers and staff from its 4 schools and 2 hospitals. The city Blantyre in Malawi is just one hour and 15 minutes away. The busy market town of Mulanje is just over the border. Milange has no tourist facilities outside of town and those inside provide basic food and drinks sometimes (if you are lucky). Pintrassone’s ‘Leopard Spot’ is well needed for travelers to and from Malawi and Mozambique. It is already a favoured picnic spot at weekends. The countryside is stunning with steep hills, waterfalls and gorgeous flowers.


Other Ways You Can Help

Wanna help but can't contribute? Don't worry, there are lots of things you can do! Get the word out for us and spread our campaign on the internet by using the Indiegogo share tools. Check our Facebook page for more pictures,


                                                       First brochure for The Leopard Spot

story:
First Off: Who Are We And What Do We Do?

We, Flyboys Delivery, are a third party food delivery system focused on connecting the Ogden community to their favorite foods. Making your life easier by bringing the best Ogden has to offer right to your home or office. 

What We Need & What You Get

Let's break it down for you :)

  • We need $35,000. That goes a long way into making your life the easiest we can. 
  • This helps us hire more drivers, improving our website, and finishing our amazing app.
  • We also want to be able to expand our hours and boundaries, and that takes some funds!

The Impact

Why should you contribute and why should you care?

  • An expanded delivery service means we can help more people.
  • As we expand, we can partner with more local restaurants.
  • In the end, you have more time and a delicious meal. It's a win-win.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, we get it. Times are tough. Not everyone can afford to contribute. Even a dollar helps, but if you can't spare it, you can do something below:

  • Share this with your friends and family. Bring up the hype!
  • Get in touch with us to offer a special talent you have!

story:
Background

Founder Althea Dyce, grew up in some of Toronto's low income areas.  Nutrition and Food security was an economic issue for many families in her neighbourhood.  And today, the insecurity of food in many communities throughout Canada is still factual for thousands of children.

"I remember growing up, and seeing tons of kids stopping at the recreation room on the first floor of my apartment building having breakfast before school.  I didn’t know it then, but I now realize, that 'people loving' organizations were the ones helping children and their parents by providing breakfast".

At 17, Althea would make and sell custom printed tee shirts from spray paint and stencils, as she started to begin her own path of independence.

Community Experience

In her early 20's she was a Youth Counsellor working for TCHC and Toronto Parks and Recreation, in various inner city neighbourhoods including Rexdale, Regent Park, and Jane and Finch.  She worked closely with several teens, and children making a difference by being a mentor to kids at risk, the way she was.  

After her job was suddenly cut, Althea decided to go back to school to learn more about graphic and web design.

Education

Ambitiously she graduated from College in 2012 as an over-achiever, with a plan in mind to become an social entrepreneur.  Merging her love for t-shirt design, her passion to help children and youth, with her new acquired skills from Humber's Multi Media program,  Althea aims to build a brand that gives back to children where nutrition and education is promoted.  

"I mean, without food, how can kids learn? Breakfast programs helped many of us have better school days".

History of Tees That Feed


The concept of Tees That Feed began to stir in 2013 as just a project. Facing many barriers, Althea was resilient and determined to see this dream come to life.  At first she tried to help children in developing countries. However, there were many barriers that made it difficult to do so.  Barriers like: Communication, transportation costs, and reliability.  After doing her homework and research, Althea was shocked to find 1 out of 6 children in Canada go hungry everyday.  As the light bulb turned on in her head, she knew this was the right path for her to begin her to impact Canadian young lives!  As her mind went back to elementary days, she understood what her brand would be about; Helping Kids!

In December 2014 Althea independently created and sold 80+ tees to benefit children in her community. This soft launch supported children with dinner at The Falstaff Community Centre's Year End Celebration.  Althea and her team prepared and served meals, while the City of Toronto donated the space, and CHUM radio donated super cool toys for the kids.

After much success at that Christmas event, Althea took on the challenge in becoming community engaged and a full time socially  responsible clothing brand.

After further examination, Althea began to notice the amount of children that wouldn't go to school because they were disengaged.  Food insecurity, and a lack of nutrition and support, discourage students from attending class.  With 13% of Canadian students dropping out of school, Althea knew Nutrition + Education will be the two main focuses that need to overlap each other.  

"Feeding children is not our goal", Althea says, " we need to get these kids excited about learning.  But, without proper nutrition in the morning, that'll be tough.  So, we will provide a great tasting and nutritious breakfast, where all students can eat together, while they prepare to take on a full day of school".

Her aim is to provide breakfast meals on a consistent basis starting with Canadian children and then multiplying this vision across to the African countries, Caribbean, and South America.

Partnership

Althea reached out to Breakfast Clubs of Canada, knowing she needed a partner who represented transparency, reliability, and to ensure the nutrition value of every meal would always be prominent.  Gracefully, Breakfast Clubs of Canada took on Tees That Feed as a start up, helping them to understand their expectations,  and executing milestones as a social business.

"Partnering with Breakfast Clubs of Canada has been one of TTF's biggest accomplishments in 2015.  Through BCC, Tees That Feed will share our profit from purchases, which go directly to breakfast meals to children across Canada".

A Call to Action

Tees That Feed needs your help to secure breakfast meals for the upcoming school year for Canadian school children.  We are pre-selling our branded tees in order to do this.  By harnessing the power of the consumer to benefit girls and boys, tees are connected to individualized fixed donations. For every tee pre-purchased 5 breakfast meals will be secured for the 2015/2016 school year.

Your financial support will also help our start up grow and become sustainable.  The additional funds raised will be used for work space, screen print supplies, utilities, and furniture.  

We eventually want to provide jobs for passionate graduates who want be a part of our growing social enterprise. Our long term goal is to build meaningful relationships with overseas Fair Trade Manufactures where we can be free to design garments, and be trendy/fashion forward within the clothing industry.  

Our apparel  is packaged in  100% Eco-Friendly and Recyclable material  to ensure the safety of workers, and our planet, practicing ethical fashion.  Our social responsibility in giving back to children is as equally important as the safety of the workers that help make our brand wearable.

For further information please email us we'd love to hear from you:

info.teesthatfeed@gmail.com

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Our Mission Statement:

TAC is a community of heathens from all walks of life, who have joined together with a unified goal: To bring heathenry into the modern age. We are the meeting place for those of like mind to gather and discuss issues that matter. TAC brings together resources to help strengthen and grow both the online and local community by providing the tools to make finding locals easier. 

TAC is a safe place that allows all heathens to freely express their ideas without fear. We do not tolerate racism or hatred of any kind, making TAC the place for those who feel that the Holy Powers accept all who come to learn. Joining TAC is easy and free! Simply, fill out an application form. So, why not take this moment to become a member of our community, and build with us.

We need the support of any who will give it so that we can provide our members with the best benefits possible. We need financial support to gain official non-profit status, host, and sponsor Asatru related events around the world. 


What We Need & What You Get

Update: We also need to raise funds for official non profit status. 

We need the help of the world, to help spread diversity, to help spread culture, and religious freedom, not just for ourselves, but for all peoples. If we can show the world that heathens can be good, kind hearted, completely non racist people, it will be better for all minority religions. 

Very simply, we need money. Our organization is completely free to join, and free to partake in. We charge for nothing (save items we may sell) It is difficult to fund events, and our members without membership dues etc. But we do not want to charge our members money. We will only do what we can. That is why we need your help! We need help to provide for our members, in many ways:

What we would use the money for:

Community strengthening events and gatherings 

Website maintenance (Websites arn't free!) 

Our Community Outreach program where we help support the less fortunate 

Magazine production

Student Programs and Scholarships 

The furtherance of Asatru, and our place in the world. 

The Impact

 The Asatru Community is not like other Asatru organizations that you may be a part of, or have heard of. While I cannot, and would not dare claim that TAC is perfect, or better, but we do strive to be different than what the world currently offers.

Before we get any farther, I think it is important to define what Asatru is: 

So what do we do? What are we for? Well, that all depends on why you are a part of TAC. We are not a “single use” organization, as a matter of fact, you may not even want to call us an organization. We are more of a network; connecting kindreds and individuals around the world so that they can provide each other, through TAC, knowledge, teachings, and aide when possible. Our goal at TAC is to try and unify as many heathens as possible to create a network of knowledge and wisdom that all members can tap into. We want to provide the tools needed to grow already existing kindreds, and help create new ones. We want to help those who wish to stay individuals with the resources that they need to learn and grow in the way that they want to.

TAC is not a church, and nor do we want it to be. TAC is not a physical organization, it is an idea. An idea that heathens of various belief systems can come together in a safe, free environment to share, spread, and gain knowledge from their fellows. An idea that events can be hosted around the world by various individuals and kindreds to help support their local communities.  We understand that ideas will vary greatly, and we support, and hope that they do. There can be no free thought without varying ideas. This is how we learn, and experience the real world, how it was intended to be experienced.

So what makes The Asatru Community different? Well there are a few ways in which The Asatru Community differs from other organizations. Are we better? Well that is for you to decide, but we do try to be different. We do not have any membership fees. It is free to join, and you shall never be asked to pay in order to be part of TAC. A few other ways that we are different include:

  • We strictly abide by our By-Laws, which we have created and feel are fair. 

  • While some groups cater to kindreds, or to individuals, we put both on the same level, and honor, and provide our services to both equally. An individual is just as important to us as a large kindred.

  • TAC is not led by an individual, but The Board of Directors, and they only manages affairs, that are strictly TAC related issues, not you, or your kindred.

  • You do not have to compromise, or change your ideals to join TAC, or participate. There will be many varying ideas.

  • You are still you, not something or someone else.

  • Those are just some of the differences between us and some of the other Asatru or Heathen organizations.

So what will TAC offer? Think of it this way, you, or your kindred is an individual village. You run things the way you want to, you are isolated, and do things the way you want. You have your own rules, you have your own ways to honor the holy powers, and you take care of your own the way that your own community needs to. But here and there you travel to the market place to trade, gather news, hear stories, partake in raids (we will not be doing this) and join in some greater community events outside of your own village’s. That is exactly what TAC is! TAC is the market place you go to! You come bringing your goods to trade, (knowledge, the want to host events, services that you can provide, members, ideas, wisdom, your own networks etc.) and you get those things back in return from others around the world who have come to that marketplace, that network to trade. Do the traders present tell you what to do, or how to do something? No! So where does The Council come in then if they do not tell you what to do? Why, they would be the market guards! They stand at the side and watch. They do not tell you what to do, however If there is a fight, or a thief in the market they kick them out of the marketplace in order to keep the peaceful trading going! It is the same! The marketplace has some basic rules, which the traders and villagers have to follow in order to keep the piece, but not to control them. Are you starting to see what TAC is?

 TAC is the tools and the network, but you are still the providers and the people that will make TAC grow, and become what we know it can be! Unlike other organizations, we are not all unified under one way of doing something or thinking. All of our members are free to do as they please (as long as they abide by our COC). Unlike other organizations and groups, we allow you to practice, and do things the way that you want to do them. We are a growing organization, both in the real world, and in the virtual one. But it all depends on you, and your needs.

So why should you join TAC? Well TAC is not for everyone. If you want a network, with anchors in real people and real communities, that is safe and free of racism, a place where you can have access to growing “libraries” of information, a place where you can reach out to others similar to you, a place where there is a true sense of community, then The Asatru Community is right for you.

If you would like to learn more, please send an email to theasatrucommunity@outlook.com, with an appropriate subject please. Thank you!

If we are able to have funds, our goals can be reached, our reach can be unlimited. The heathen community would never be the same. 

Heathens could get that much farther in finding their proper place in the world. We stand not only for the freedom of heathens, but of all people. Equality. That is what it is all about. And we need your help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't Contribute? That's fine! There are many ways in which you can help! You can become a charter member of TAC, spread the word about out mission statement and goals, and just help show the world what being a heathen truly is!

story:
KEEP YOUR BEVERAGES FRESH AND ALWAYS SERVE IN STYLE AT THE PROPER TEMPERATURE!          

                 


 INTRODUCING: 

     

Attractive design. The Vinesso has a thermostat control dial for maintaining a perfect temperature for red, white or rose wines.  Insulated cooling compartment keeps chamber cool up to 3 hours after shut off.  Convenient, retractable drip tray keeps the area clean.

The Vinesso will hold most 1.5 - 3 liter bag-in-box products or two - 750ml bottles, or insert the reservoir tank to chill your personal favorites! 

    

Great for COMMERCIAL ESTABLISHMENTS. 

Single glass pours become cost effective - keep product fresh, economical B-I-B, ecologically friendly, less waste.

Includes a 12 volt adapter - perfect for tailgating, the RV, camper or boat. 

       

The Vinesso cooler from Beviamo Products was featured at the International Housewares Show in Chicago, March, 2015. 

                         "Gadget of the Month"

From Kitchen News & Housewares Review, March 2015


  WHAT DAMAGES WINE THE MOST? 

Answer: Temperature and Oxygen!

(The Vinesso chills beverages to perfect temperature every time)


THE PROBLEMS:

  • Serving wine  at an improper temperature (too hot or too cold) destroys flavor and bouquet.
  • Serving guests from a cardboard box - is that really appropriate? 
  • Vacuum pumps are not very effective for preserving wine properly. Vacuum pumping your wine, just as in some food products, can affect and destroy flavor.
  • Spray cans are not that effective either! There are many blends and types of  spray canisters of Nitrogen, Argon and CO2. They will all work - to a point. The problem lies in the application itself. You simply lay a "blanket" of nitrogen over the wine replacing the oxygen. Perfect... until you force the cork back in. That pressure alone causes a  remix of the nitrogen and oxygen thereby limiting its effectiveness. Residual oxygen also creeps back in when reaching for the cork. Plus - the straw always seems to fall out into the bottle.

                             


            How do wine producers keep wine fresh? 

(Hint: They don't use a vacuum pump!)

The "head-space" in the bottle is back-flushed with nitrogen removing damaging oxygen from being in contact with the wine.  Approximately 78% of the air we breathe is nitrogen. 100% safe, effective and natural.



THE SOLUTION:

_____________________________________________________________________________

The blanketing process utilizing the Duckit is more   effective than anything available on the market! 


Keep your wine fresh, the way the producers do. 


The Duckit is a patent pending, two way silicone rubber duckbill (like a sippy cup) inserted into a specially formed and vented silicone rubber bottle stopper. 



   THIS IS THE PERFECT SOLUTION FOR KEEPING                                    WINE FRESH!


Use in conjunction with canister of Natural Preserve. 100% safe and effective, food grade nitrogen with a fold-down STAINLESS STEEL STRAW. No other preserver on the market has this unique feature!


Straw will not fall out into the bottle - like so many others and... the Stainless Steel Straw helps reduce cross-contamination. 





What will the funds be used for? 

Here is a detail of our funding:

  • Tooling for stoppers
  • Tooling for duckbills
  • Inventory
  • Assembly
  • Retail ready packaging
  • Graphic Design artwork for box
  • Shipping 
  • Re-design, die-cut and print initial inventory label instruction card (insert) for the front face of the Vinesso cooler (as shown below).

     

        


Great marketing, licensing and co-branding opportunities. 

Label your favorite beverage, place company name or logo, use as corporate gift - incentive program, place wedding pictures/invitations or other special occasions... a world of possibilities!


 Come on, join me and the millions        of wine drinkers out there. 

Keep your beverages fresh! Serve them chilled properly and always present your beverages in style... wherever you are, wherever you go!


                                  

                                                   Don't be these guys. 
            When is it really appropriate to serve guests from a cardboard box?

       

                   


We understand that not everyone can afford to contribute. So... here are other ways you can help.

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about Beviamo Products
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Pass this on to friends, family or anyone else who might have an interest in helping or being the first to have a Vinesso Cooler or the Duckit Bottle Stopper

                                                           THANK YOU! 

              WE CERTAINLY APPRECIATE YOU AND ALL THAT CAN HELP !!!

THE PROBLEMS:


Serving wine  at an improper temperature (too hot or too cold) destroys flavor and bouquet.


Serving guests from a cardboard box - is that really appropriate? 


Vacuum pumps are not very effective for preserving wine properly. Vacuum pumping your wine, just as in some food products, can affect and destroy flavor.


Spray cans are not that effective either! There are many blends and types of  spray canisters of Nitrogen, Argon and CO2. They will all work - to a point. The problem lies in the application itself. You simply lay a "blanket" of nitrogen over the wine replacing the oxygen. Perfect... until you force the cork back in. That pressure alone causes a  remix of the nitrogen and oxygen thereby limiting its effectiveness. Residual oxygen also creeps back in when reaching for the cork. Plus - the straw always seems to fall out into the bottle.





                             



            How do wine producers keep wine fresh? 

(Hint: They don't use a vacuum pump!)

The "head-space" in the bottle is back-flushed with nitrogen removing damaging oxygen from being in contact with the wine.  Approximately 78% of the air we breathe is nitrogen. 100% safe, effective and natural.





THE SOLUTION:



_____________________________________________________________________________



The blanketing process utilizing the Duckit is more   effective than anything available on the market! 

Keep your wine fresh, the way the producers do. 

The Duckit is a patent pending, two way silicone rubber duckbill (like a sippy cup) inserted into a specially formed and vented silicone rubber bottle stopper. 





   THIS IS THE PERFECT SOLUTION FOR KEEPING                                    WINE FRESH!



Use in conjunction with canister of Natural Preserve. 100% safe and effective, food grade nitrogen with a fold-down STAINLESS STEEL STRAW. No other preserver on the market has this unique feature!

Straw will not fall out into the bottle - like so many others and... the Stainless Steel Straw helps reduce cross-contamination. 





What will the funds be used for? 
Here is a detail of our funding:



Tooling for stoppers
Tooling for duckbills
Inventory
Assembly
Retail ready packaging
Graphic Design artwork for box
Shipping 
Re-design, die-cut and print initial inventory label instruction card (insert) for the front face of the Vinesso cooler (as shown below).


  

     

        

Great marketing, licensing and co-branding opportunities. 

Label your favorite beverage, place company name or logo, use as corporate gift - incentive program, place wedding pictures/invitations or other special occasions... a world of possibilities!




 Come on, join me and the millions        of wine drinkers out there. 
Keep your beverages fresh! Serve them chilled properly and always present your beverages in style... wherever you are, wherever you go!



                                  
                                                   Don't be these guys. 

            When is it really appropriate to serve guests from a cardboard box?



       
                   


    We understand that not everyone can afford to contribute. So... here are other ways you can help.  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about Beviamo Products Use the Indiegogo share tools
Pass this on to friends, family or anyone else who might have an interest in helping or being the first to have a Vinesso Cooler or the Duckit Bottle Stopper                                                              THANK YOU!               WE CERTAINLY APPRECIATE YOU AND ALL THAT CAN HELP !!!

story:
Short Summary

With an increasing amount of media content being made available to children everyday, it has become difficult for parents to navigate through it all. Our goal is to provide parents with a single recognizable brand for safe, engaging, educational multimedia content. 

My name is Krishna Ramnath. My love for animated storytelling began way back while watching segments on Sesame Street and School House Rock. Today I have three daughters and it has been my goal to produce creative animation projects that will serve as similar inspiration to a new generation. With 20 years of animation/video production and project management experience under my belt, and a network of talented creative collaborators I feel that we are well equipped to reach our goals.

The funds raised through this campaign will go directly toward building a library of assets that will be re-usable on multiple projects across multiple channels including books, apps and tv shows created to support and grow our Little Starship Network web portal and app network.

We are currently in production on our self-funded first project, The 'Alligator in the Elevator:Learn to Count' educational iOS and Android app for preschoolers. 

Rick Charette has been writing and performing for children for 30 years. His first collection of songs, "Bubblegum" was published in 1983 and was followed in 1985 by "Alligator in the Elevator." The success of these early collections launched a full-time career of writing and performing for young audiences. The simple, fun nature of Rick's music is contagious and is reminiscent of the early Sesame Street and Schoolhouse Rock animated segments that drew me in as a kid.

I now have three daughters and I would like to bring Rick's music to a new medium and produce the type of creative interactive animation projects that will encourage exploration, and inspire imagination and creativity among today's generation of kids. 'Alligator in the Elevator: Learn to Count' is the first of these projects and why I formed Little Starship Productions. 


We are also in the early development stages of a preschool children's television series...


We have had requests for info on the series from major broadcasters and co-production partners in the U.S., Canada, Germany, Spain and Australia. 


What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised through this campaign will go directly toward building a library of assets that will be re-usable on multiple projects across multiple channels including books, apps and tv shows created to support and grow our Little Starship Network web portal and app network.

For your support you will receive some great perks including...

If you have ideas for additional perks please let us know and we will see if we can accommodate them.


The Impact

Your support will help us create the building blocks needed to create The Little Starship Network. 

We want parents to rest assured and trust that when they see the Little Starship logo, what will follow will be safe for their children, engaging, educational and fun for entire family. We are in the process of building a web portal and app network to provide parents with a single location to access quality content for their children that will help stimulate their imagination and foster their love for learning.

Risks & Challenges

Krishna Ramnath

With 20 years of animation/video production and project management experience under my belt, and a network of talented creative collaborators I feel that we are well equipped to tackle any risks associated with this project. My expertise encompasses all aspects of the digital production spectrum from creative idea generation  through technical production, post production final delivery as well as marketing and advertising. I have run a successful design firm in the past and I have the experience and knowledge to grow this business.

We are presently on target to complete production on 'The Alligator in the Elevator:Learn to Count' app by the end of April 2015.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even the smallest donation is extremely helpful and appreciated. If you are unable to support our efforts financially I would be extremely grateful if you would spread the word about our company by sharing this page with your friends and family who might be interested on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or simply by word of mouth.

The 'Alligator in the Elevator: Learn to Count' app will contain an animated cartoon video for the song "Alligator in the Elevator" along with simple interactive learning activities targeted for preschool-age children that will extend the themes and situations explored in the cartoon and will follow an educational curriculum that includes basic counting skills. Subsequent apps in the series will cover letters, shapes, memory skills, art and music appreciation as well as social awareness.

To assist with character development and art direction I have enlisted the help of Brian Main, creator of the highly-acclaimed lil'Red storybook app.
http://www.lilredapp.com/ 



"Simply delightful" - Best Apps for Kids
"Breathtakingly original with a universal appeal" - Smart Apps for Kids
"...the most wonderful Little Red Riding Hood interpretation we have ever laid eyes and fingers on" - Apps4kids
"In a sea of interactive homogeny, this is a rare gem" - Kirkus Reviews
"A definite must have for your iPad library" - Tech Tools 4 Mom 
"...stands out in a sea of other storybooks" - GiggleApps


Jennifer Dumlao is a Yale graduate with 12 years of integrated experience in: advertising, marketing, promotions, social media, mobile & emerging platforms, music and entertainment industries. She received her bachelor’s degree in Sociology with a focus on Media, Education and Psychology. For the last 2 years Jennifer acted as Administrator and Teacher for the Brooklyn Saplings Co-Operative Play School she founded in 2012 for our 2 and 3-year-old daughters along with 8 of their peers in our Prospect Heights neighborhood in Brooklyn, NY. Additionally she has 15 years of performance and club DJ experience all over NYC and the globe, 9 years of long-form improv comedy and acting training/performance, and occasional freelance non-fiction writing and copywriting. Jennifer will be working to establish an educational curriculum for each project that is age appropriate for our target audience and will ensure that we present the material in creative ways that remain challenging, fun and engaging.



We are also in the early development stages of a preschool children's television series...


We have had requests for info on the series from major broadcasters and co-production partners in the U.S., Canada, Germany, Spain and Australia.

story:
Premier Elder Solutions is an electronic vault created by a husband and wife team experienced in the difficulties of managing care for a parent while also maintaining their jobs.  We know the difficulties you encounter trying to share communications from providers with each family member on a daily basis.  That task alone can be tedious and is often one of the most stressful aspects of caring for a loved one.

Go check out our beta:  https://PremierElderSolutions.com

The growth in the number of people turning 65 daily tells us there is an increasing need for tools that enable families to share and store conversations or information about the care of their loved ones. Today, there are 35 million people over the age of 65.  By the year 2020 we will have over 80 million people older than 65 in the United States. 

Premier Elder Solutions allows the family lead to efficiently share conversations, information, documents and activities associated with providing the best care for their loved ones.  We strive to save families stress, time, and money to allow them to focus on the best solutions possible.  Our mission is to give families the tools needed to effectively manage care.


Why contribute to Premier Elder Solutions?

By contributing to our Indiegogo campaign, you are helping us build a better way for families to create a network of care around their loved ones.  Your contribution will allow us to fully provide the benefits you see listed below. 

Company Goals and Objectives:

When you create an account with Premier Elder Solutions, you have the ability to manage information, documents, and activities all in the same place, for multiple loved ones.  We allow you to create a separate profile for each loved one you are caring for and invite friends, family, and service providers into that profile to assist in managing care.

Premier Elder Solutions will be the single source in the industry that allows friends, families, and providers to connect and create an end-to-end elder life care plan that is HIPAA Compliant and SSL secure.  Ensuring everyone gets the same message at the same time.

Below you can see some of the types of information that can be stored and shared within your Premier Elder Solutions Profile.  You will be able to control who can see sensitive information.

Within each profile you will be able to assign a task, utilize a calendar, and search providers, instead of having to call everyone in the family each time something needs to be done or there is an update.  Simply utilize your Premier Elder Solutions Profile to send a message, schedule an appointment, share provider information, or assign a task.  

All your users receive the same message at the same time.  All users have the ability to input and reply to messages within the profiles they have been invited into.  You no longer have to be alone in providing care for your loved ones.  You can create a network around your loved one to help support both you and them on your journey.


Where we are in the process:

  • Premier Elder Solutions concept finalized
  • Premier Elder Solutions Beta site currently in testing
  • Development costs established for completion of site functionality
  • Advisory Board established - includes professional nurse case managers, doctors, product manufacturers, financial advisors, and executive mentors

Where you can help:

  • Seeking funding to complete site and launch with consumers

Where does my contribution go?

Goal:   $10,000 – This money will be used to complete development of the site to support the consumer launch.

Stretch Goal:  $20,000 - 30,000 – Launch additional functionality, consumer promotion to gain 1,500 users.

Super Stretch Goal:  $40,000+ - Begin expansion from online to full marketing campaign


Q:  How many profiles can I have within my account?

A:  With an account membership you will be allowed to house as many profiles as you need.

Q:  Is there a limit to the number of friends and family I can share a profile with?

A:  No.  You will have the ability to share each profile separately with friends, family, or providers of your choosing.  You will be able to change those people as often as you like.

Q:  What kinds of information will be stored about my loved ones in their profile?

A:  The types of information that could be housed are:  general health information, existing physicians' names, addresses, and phone numbers, medications, instructions for medications, health insurance, life insurance, end of life plans, financial, and legal, etc.

Q: Will everyone I invite as a user be able to see the information that is stored in a profile?

A:  No.  You, as the account owner, will be able to select who can see each piece of information.

Q:  How safe is the information I store in my account and profile?

A:  Our site is HIPAA compliant and SSL encrypted.  As we grow our membership, we will continue to perform external HIPAA audits and raise our level of encryption to ensure your information, conversations, and documents are securely stored.


Who are we?

Susan Tyrrell, CEO – “Problem Solver”

I have been around technology for 20+ years in Corporate America. My favorite thing to do is solve problems for people; it’s what I do at work. I like to think of things that my own life easier and then share the idea. I was raised by serial entrepreneurs, and have always had the "bug" for it, but never had the right opportunity. Premier Elder Solutions is the right opportunity. I am extremely passionate about this idea and the process of building a product that allows the user a say in what it will be when it grows up. 

Mark Tyrrell, President & CSO – “Relationship Builder”

Professional experience: Business Development / Sales Executive and Entrepreneur focused on web-based businesses providing solutions. I have worked in the Health Care and Workers Compensation markets for 20+ years developing networks and ancillary product lines. In addition, I have developed contracts to expand portfolios as well as negotiated rates and/or discounts. I enjoy creating new methodologies for expanding business to the consumer (via SEO, Social Media) provider, advertiser, and Broker community.
