story:
Are you tired of calorie counting? You have no time to decide what kind of food to eat, or you just don't know? 

Let us help.  


So you sell falafels, right? 

Err, no. 

We in Diske Inc. thought that a decent nutrition and diet plan data should be free for everyone so we decided to create Fudbot, a food engine that creates diet plans from basic user data. The software creates a diet plan with a plate/hand model of meals by determining, inter alia, your body type, activity level and activity type. Fudbot currently supports two languages (Finnish and English) and data can be processed both metric and US customary units. 

Fudbot is nutritional health software that can be used by anyone, whether you were a housewife, personal trainer or a doctor. Our team members have university degrees in pharmacy, exercise medicine and nutrition as well as a high level of experience in the general field of nutrition and strength coaching. 

So we know what we do. 

 

Why we need money? 

We have a partially working yet limited beta version demo available, but, it still needs further development, especially the PRO version. 

30k USD along with bucket-loads of caffeine should provide enough boost for our coders to complete their work without resorting to slave labor. The actual coding should take approximately 3-4 months with everything going well, and in case we don't reach our funding goal, well, it will just take a little longer to accomplish. Kid as we may, we are committed and dead serious about making it happen.

Here’s what we still want to achieve i.e. the features that are still missing - and hopefully to be completed by the power of YOU: 

FREE BASIC VERSION

  • two or three diets, one voted for by the users
  • a rainbow diet representation (Fudbot will tell you if you eat enough ”right” colors)
  • printable shopping lists

PRO VERSION(S) 

  • several diets
  • more sliders/settings to calculate fat percent and body type
  • 6 different body types for both genders
  • real-time charts to represent health, nutrition and energy status
  • possibility to factor common medical conditions including DM1, DM2, MBO and many more
  • possibility to select common food allergies and restrictions including GLUTEN FREE, LACTOSE FREE, FODMAP and DAIRY FREE
  • possibility to create separate breakfast
  • possibility to create salad meals
  • possibility to scale energy and change the foods before printing a diet plan
  • possibility to select goals 
  • possibility to change colors, add your own logo etc.
  • possibility to create diet plan up to 7 days
  • possibility to print a diet plan to PDF
  • possibility to translate the UI
  • possibility to select the amount of training days
  • caloric and macronutrient cycling
  • meals with recipes and pre-installed instructions 
  • …and many more functions to be announced

CUSTOM PRO 

  • all of the above + 1 custom slider/feature of your choice

Simply by employing the perks on the left, you can support our troops of coders as well as hordes of coffee makers to fulfill our destinies in the future of nutrition and meal planning. 

Pro version will cost 199 USD / year, but if you pre-order now you pay only 100 USD + you get a shirt. 

Also, if you contribute with 5 USD or 30 USD PERK you will get a personal account and some extra features to the free basic version. This account can be purchased only during this crowdfunding, so don't miss your opportunity!



Why we are doing this? 

We actually do WANT to SAVE THE WORLD! How? By the power of food. There is a good reason why the basic version is and will be free; we wish for everyone to have access to some proper nutritional information and a possibility to create healthy diets with ease.  

Seriously, youcan benefit from using Fudbot no matter what your level of success or occupation is. With the free version you can fix your diet to be a better one, without any required knowledge of nutritional science. With the pro version, whether you are a personal trainer, a doctor, a nurse or a guru of everything, you can help others to make even more complex diet plans.

Could there BE any challenges? 

Well, yes. The ethnical and culinary diversity in the world is vast, so there must be a huge food database to cover the different needs of various countries and continents with their unique natural sources and farming products. There will be a tool for everyone to use and add foods to the database. This is probably the easiest way to globalize the food database, so our Japanese friends won't need to wonder about Finnish traditional pastries and so on. However, we will moderate everything that will be added to database, so you will not find anything like lembas or chocolate salty balls in there. 

No cash? 

So you are running short of everything but still want to help? No worries! Just use Indiegogo’s share tools and let the world know of Fudbot. 

Healthy nutrition data should belong to everyone. Help us to achieve this! 
Thank you! 

Diske Inc. reserves the right to make changes and alterations in the contents of program versions without notice. Fudbot is not a medical device or software and therefore may and can not be used to diagnose medical conditions.
story_txt:
Are you tired of calorie counting? You have no time to decide what kind of food to eat, or you just don't know? Let us help.  

So you sell falafels, right?  Err, no. 
We in Diske Inc. thought that a decent nutrition and diet plan data should be free for everyone so we decided to create Fudbot, a food engine that creates diet plans from basic user data. The software creates a diet plan with a plate/hand model of meals by determining, inter alia, your body type, activity level and activity type. Fudbot currently supports two languages (Finnish and English) and data can be processed both metric and US customary units. 

Fudbot is nutritional health software that can be used by
anyone, whether you were a housewife, personal trainer or a doctor. Our
team members have university degrees in pharmacy, exercise medicine and
nutrition as well as a high level of experience in the general field of
nutrition and strength coaching. 
So we know what we do. 
 


   Why we need money?  We have a partially working yet limited beta version demo available, 
but, it still needs further development, especially
the PRO version. 

30k USD along with bucket-loads of caffeine should provide enough
boost for our coders to complete their work without resorting to slave
labor. The actual coding should take approximately 3-4 months with everything
going well, and in case we don't reach our funding goal, well, it will just
take a little longer to accomplish. Kid as we may, we are committed and dead
serious about making it happen.


Here’s what we still want to achieve i.e. the features that are still
missing - and hopefully to be completed by the power of YOU: 

FREE BASIC VERSION




two or three diets, one voted for by the users


a rainbow diet representation (Fudbot will tell you if you eat enough ”right” colors)

printable shopping lists



PRO VERSION(S) 




several diets


more sliders/settings to calculate fat percent and body type


6 different body types for both genders


real-time charts to represent health, nutrition and energy status


possibility to factor common medical conditions including DM1, DM2, MBO and many more


possibility to select common food allergies and restrictions including GLUTEN FREE, LACTOSE FREE, FODMAP and DAIRY FREE


possibility to create separate breakfast


possibility to create salad meals


possibility to scale energy and change the foods before printing a diet plan


possibility to select goals 


possibility to change colors, add your own logo etc.


possibility to create diet plan up to 7 days


possibility to print a diet plan to PDF


possibility to translate the UI


possibility to select the amount of training days


caloric and macronutrient cycling


meals with recipes and pre-installed instructions 


…and many more functions to be announced



CUSTOM PRO 


all of the above + 1 custom slider/feature of your choice



Simply by employing the perks on the left, you can support our troops of coders as well as hordes of coffee
makers to fulfill our destinies in the future of nutrition and meal planning. 
Pro version will cost 199 USD / year, but if you pre-order now you pay only 100 USD + you get a shirt. 
Also, if you contribute with 5 USD or 30 USD PERK you will get a personal account and some extra features to the free basic version. This account can be purchased only during this crowdfunding, so don't miss your opportunity!







Why we are doing this? 
We actually do WANT to SAVE THE WORLD! How? By the
power of food. There is a good reason why the basic version is and will be
free; we wish for everyone to have access to some proper nutritional information
and a possibility to create healthy diets with ease.  


Seriously, youcan benefit from using Fudbot no matter what your
level of success or occupation is. With the free version you can fix your diet
to be a better one, without any required knowledge of nutritional science. With
the pro version, whether you are a personal trainer, a doctor, a nurse or a guru
of everything, you can help others to make even more complex diet plans.

Could there BE any challenges? 
Well, yes. The ethnical and culinary diversity in the world is vast,
so there must be a huge food database to cover the different needs of various
countries and continents with their unique natural sources and farming
products. There will be a tool for everyone to use and add foods to the
database. This is probably the easiest way to globalize the food database, so
our Japanese friends won't need to wonder about Finnish traditional pastries
and so on. However, we will moderate everything that will be added to database,
so you will not find anything like lembas or chocolate salty balls in there. 

No cash? 
So you are running short of everything but still want to help?
No worries! Just use Indiegogo’s share tools and let the world know of
Fudbot. 

Healthy nutrition data should belong to everyone. Help us to achieve this! Thank you! 
Diske Inc. reserves the right to make changes and alterations in the contents of program versions without notice. Fudbot is not a medical device or software and therefore may and can not be used to diagnose medical conditions.

story:
Adoption of Sage

Babies are surprising in many ways. Sometimes they are a surprise to the parents in there arrival and that just how little Sage made his appearance into our lives. But not with the usual surprise pregnancy but instead with a very good friend giving me a very special gift. The gift of our precious son Sage.

 One week before Sage was born his birth mom and dad made the decision that they wanted us to be Sage's new parents. And although it was quite a surprise we had already made the decision that we wanted to add to our family someday. And that someday was going to be in seven days. So I flew into action getting everything Sage needed clothes, diapers, bassinet and more. I researched private adoption and printed and edited page after page of documents staying up late into the early morning. 

I'm no lawyer but we all hoped to do this with minimal fuss. We knew it wasn't going to be easy but we are all very patient, especially me and Pierre because we wanted this little man very much and even though the process of making him ours would take awhile we are in it for the long haul. All 18 years+++.

So less then 7 days later I flew to Florida and supported birth mom through the process and watched Sage's brother while birth mom and dad ushered my precious little man Sage into this world via c-section. And 2 hours later I got to hold Sage for the first time, and he has been ours ever since. When Sage was 4 days old we flew home to NY and to meet your papa for the first time and we've been here ever since. Starting the long process to make him ours. 

And the process has been hard and complicated and the minimal fuss has gone out the window with lots of legal red tape. But Sage is here and we love him very much and now we need your help because all though we have the money to provide for his basics like food and clothing and toys. We need some help in the legal part of things so we can keep Sage here safe, secure and permanently. 

So as we have opened our hearts to our precious Sage, We are hoping people will open there hearts to us and help us with our legal process to keep our little Sage. We have estimated our total legal costs including lawyer, transportation and travel expenses at $20,000. 

Expense break down:

$6,000 Lawyer fees NY State

$6,000 Lawyer fees Florida 

$3,000 Estimated Travel Expenses 

$ 5,000 Living expenses for Florida

Because Sage's birth parents were living in Florida at the time of his birth, We have to work with both Florida and New York courts and this may mean having to stay in Florida for a short duration until the adoption is finalized which could be as long as 6 months.

story:
Short Summary

Keegan rose to prominence in 2015 after completing a solo bicycle expedition across Africa from Cairo to Cape Town. On 2 March 2015 he arrived at the V&A Waterfront in Cape Town in a time of 59 days, 8 hours and 30 minutes, and became the Guinness Record holder for the fastest man ever to cross the continent on Bicycle. Months after arriving home he realized that Africa was so close to his heart and that he wanted to start an NGO that used volunteers and their talents to go into every African country in Africa and educate them about health and fitness and sport as a means to break a poverty cycle.
I will attempt to cycle across Morocco and Europe unsupported and solo to raise funds for the start up of the NGO. There are incredibly high risks in a solo cycle all of which will be worth raising the money to help other people. 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The funding will go to buying a 4x4, equipping it with training equipment for CrossFit and other health and fitness activities and paying for the first expedition into Africa.
  • If you contribute we will offer a signed copy of the first photograph of the expedition as the team leaves the V and A Waterfront 
  • If not all the funds are raised, the money will be put into the NGO's account until all the money has been raised

The Impact

Africa is a forgotten continent that lacks skills, love and passionate individuals. The time of dropping food off along with blankets and supplies and disappearing is over. We want to create a health and fitness conscious youth that are prepared to train and step into athletics teams and sports team. Sports is a means to break the poverty cycle, we need people to dream and believe that. 


Risks & Challenges

I will attempt to cycle across..... (not yet announced, keep watching this space...) to raise money for the NGO Launch. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are always in need of:

- Sports equipment

- footballs and hockey sticks 

- sports clothing and sports jerseys

story:
Summary

(Al final puedes ver la versión en español)

These 12 Chilean small entrepreneurs have different desires, but they share the same qualities: they are innovative, passionate, persevering and optimistic, and they need our help to be able to  overcome obstacles and enlarge their business.

In Smartrip (www.smartrip.cl), a travel agency with social focus , we have worked with this group of small entrepreneurs before through several social programs:  Balloon Chile in alliance with the B Corp, Emprediem ( six programs in different destinations, + 800 entrepreneurs supported, www.balloonchile.com) and "Más Artesanía Local" in alliance with TKO consultores (www.turistiko.cl two programs in different destinations + 30 craftsmen supported).

For this crowdfunding campaign we have selected the people we know from our social programs. We have witnessed their commitment and the tremendous potential they have. We know that additional support is required in order to make it possible to fulfill their dreams, and to be able to continue rescuing their culture and local identity through their work.

Smartrip - About Us

We are a travel agency with a social focus, and we aim to finance social projects in major tourist destinations in Chile. We have partnerships with a group of leading hotels (https://www.smartrip.cl/paginas/hoteles) that gives us special conditions to sell their available rooms, to support this social purpose.

+ 50 hotels partners committed with local development

Smartrip offers the best hotels in Chile with up to 50% discount in www.smartrip.cl. The profits made are invested in different social programs that help to develop local communities surrounding these hotels. The financiering is made through Smartrip Foundation, which owns 80 % of the company.



About this campaign

For this crowdfunding - campaign, our partner hotels have donated free nights in their rooms as a reward for those who make their contributions to the campaign. In addition to the hotel nights and the unique products that our small entrepreneurs produce, Smartrip is donating also hundreds of Travel Gift Cards. These prizes make it even more interesting for the people who not only want to help the local small entrepreneurs in need, but also want to travel with sustainability.


All the profits that we are going to raise with this campaign will be divided among the entrepreneurs, depending on their needs which were surveyed on a detailed diagnosis for  each of them. If we exceed our goal, we can support more entrepreneurs from other tourist destinations in Chile. 


Meet the entrepreneurs

Check out the full stories at: https://www.smartrip.cl/noticias/index/principales-proyectos


Fernanda Gutierrez: Fernanda is a young small entrepreneur who is producing leather products. She interested in leather in a very difficult time in her life when she was a single mother and had to take care of her daughter alone. With much effort and courage she managed to boost her entrepreneurship as a saddler and thereby she was able to  overcome the difficulties she had, and with this, provide her daughter with an education. Fernanda was one of the winners in the social program supported by Smartrip and executed by Emprediem: Balloon 2014 Colchagua Valley Chile, that had the support of our partners Hotel Santa Cruz, Lapostolle Residence and Viña La Playa. She currently sells belts, wallets, pinches and purses, among other leather products.

What she needs?: a better workshop with more space to be able to work better and to provide job for other women too.

"My dream is to build my own workshop, in order to provide jobs for other single mothers who need a hand with raising their children. I also want to be able to produce more products."

                                

   


Iris Arevalo: Iris is a small entrepreneur from Colchagua Valley. She created a brand called Kuyen. She sells different soaps, massage oils, salts and bubble bath products, all made from goat's milk. She started it in 2000 as a hobby, but eventually she grew her business bigger and formed an enterprise. Iris was part of  the social program supported by Smartrip and executed by Emprediem: Balloon 2014 Colchagua Valley Chile, that had the support of our partners Hotel Santa Cruz, Lapostolle Residence and Viña La Playa.

What she needs?: legal changes to her business and a designer for a better graphical presentation.

"My dream is to get into the market and in that way generate a stable and secure job for my family, who have supported me unconditionally. I also want to benefit the community where I grew up. My dream is that my brand is known and recognized, and with that  have the needed income to have a calm and stable life situation. "


                           



Egidio & Eliana: Eliana and Egidio are a Mapuche couple; Egidio is know for his "storytelling" and Eliana is a retired teacher. Together they created Pichi Wenu, a restaurant where traditional Mapuche food is accompanied with a poem recited by Eliana, while her husband is dressed in traditional clothing, welcoming tourists and telling them local stories. The restaurant’s main purpose is to rescue their traditional gastronomy and pass it along to next generations. Eliana and Egidio participated in the first social program that Smartrip and Emprediem made in 2012 with the entrepreneurs in Huilo Huilo, with the support of Huilo Huilo Hotels.

What they need?: a new bathroom, so they can host the tourists better.

"My dream is that we can be sure that our culture is not lost, and that we can help the welfare of our community."


Juana Quintoman: Juana, an small entrepreneur from Neltume (Huilo Huilo Natural Reserve), is practicing the ancient mapuche technique of weaving. Her work is done by her own hands and all the materials are natural. Juana got  first place in the first social program that Smartrip and Emprediem made in 2012 with the entrepreneurs in Huilo Huilo, with the support of Huilo Huilo Hotels.

What she needs?: enlarge her workshop and build a bathroom in order to work better and in peace.

 "My dream is to get more sales so my children can finish school"

   

   


Luis & Caterina Manriquez: In the area of Huilo Huilo there was no possibility of canyoning until Luis Manriquez came up with the idea. Together with his sister Caterina, they are offering this sport that includes descending down by rivers, waterfalls and others, for the tourists who want to experience an adrenaline-filled activity. Luis and Caterina were one of the winners in the first social program that Smartrip and Emprediem made in 2012 with the entrepreneurs in Huilo Huilo, with the support of Huilo Huilo Hotels.

What they need?: increase their equipment (suits, helmets, vests, harnesses, carabineers, etc.) to serve a greater number of customers.

"My dream is to grow my company, be better known nationally and internationally. I want that tourists know our incredible adrenaline-filled activity. We also need more staff in order to provide more trips and thus give more work to the people in our town. "

            


Veronica Quintonahuel: Verónica is a small entrepreneur that a few years ago started to explore the Sollipulli volcano. She was so impressed with the landscapes that she started to give touristic tours there. What is unique about this tour is that  not only she takes her passengers to unknown and exclusive routes (since Veronica is the only one who has access to those by being  niece of the lonko of Reigolil), but also invites tourists to learn about the Mapuche culture through a local experience.  Verónica was one of the winners in the social program supported by Smartrip and Antumalal Hotel, and executed by Emprediem: Balloon 2014 Pucón & Curarrehue Chile.

What she needs?: complete her emergency equipment (first aid kit, helmets, radio to communicate) to provide better conditions for the tourists.

 "My dream is to grow my entrepreneurship, have more amenities, and have basic things that I’m currently missing in order to have a stable, secure life (potable water, for example)"

           


Jamil Samur: Jamil, a former master carpenter who lost his job, sought an alternative to succeed. He is now dedicated to collect all the remaining wood in different places to do crafts. This craftsman participated in the social program supported by Smartrip and Antumalal Hotel, Balloon Chile Pucon Curarehue, and won one of the prizes awarded at the Closing Ceremony.

What he needs?: tools for wood (huincha saw, miter saw and router wood) in order to work more efficiently and produce faster.

"I dream that my products are known throughout Chile so that my business can grow "

          


Juana Becerra: Juanita Becerra is specialized in Mapuche textile handicraft. She has been offered to bring her products to Pucon, but she refuses. She prefers to stay in Curarrehue as she wants to show everyone who visits the city, the whole process of making her traditional handicraft. She learned the technique when she was really young, forced to work by her grandfather and mother, to whom she’s ever grateful. Juanita participated in the social program sopported by Smartrip and Antumalal Hotel, Balloon Chile 2014 Pucón & Curarrehue Chile.

Juanita exposes her looms, cushions, hats and much more with two other local craftsmen in a place called Art Expo.

What she needs?: build a place where she can work and exhibit her products.

"My dream, together with the other craftsmen, is to have a place where we can work better. We also need more advertising to make us known widely"

  


Javier Arias: Javier is an adventure guide whose passion is rafting and kayaking. He loves his job so much that not even an accident that left him a paraplegic few years ago prevented him from doing it. This young man, with a constant smile on his face, is now working in the enterprise that he established over 2 years ago with his colleagues. The entrepreneurship  is called "Tourism Limayco", were they  offer family rides in a ducky (inflatable kayak) in the calm waters. This local entrepreneur participated in the social program supported by Smartrip and Antumalal Hotel, Balloon Chile Pucón & Curarehue, and won one of the prizes awarded at the Closing Ceremony.

What he needs?: increase his equipment (raft, life jackets, suits, boots and paddles) in order to serve all the tourists that are willing to come to tours.

"My dream is to succeed. I want to be able to work all year round, have an office and all the necessary equipment"

            


Gladys Soto: Gladys has been working with sheep wool for more than 25 years. She starts with collecting the chilota wool fleeces, which are then washed, dyed, spun and finally woven in order to create bed covers, murals, sweaters and vests. Her work stands out, above all, because of its natural elements. Gladys participate in the social program "More Local Crafts Chiloé Island" developed by Smartrip in alliance with TKO consultants and Parque Quilquico Hotel.

What she needs?: her own workshop

"My dream is to have a piece of land in order to work there and organize different events (birthdays, new year eve’s parties)"

   

   


Yessenia Mansilla: Yessenia learned her talent from her parents and for a while she has been a skilled craftsman in basket-making and sheep wool fabrics. With her products she aims to rescue chilota mythology throughout 10 different figures, including Trauco and Pincoya. The baskets are made of manila and quiscal, vegetable fibers. They are gathered in the Llingua Island and then are classified, dried and woven. Yessenia participate in the social program "More Local Crafts Chiloé Island" developed by Smartrip in alliance with TKO consultants and Parque Quilquico Hotel.

What she needs?: her own workplace. Yessenia does not have a dedicated place to store her materials and because of that  they spoil easily.

"My dream is to have my own heated workplace, where my material can dry out well and doesn’t get spoiled"


Olivia Ulloa: Oliva is an expert artisan of sheep wool fabrics. She is also an expert in the weaving, crochet and loom techniques (chilote and indigenous Mapuche loom). Her main products are sweaters, jackets and vests, all made by her own hands and dyed with natural elements. Oliva participate in the social program "More Local Crafts Chiloé Island" developed by Smartrip in alliance with TKO consultants and Parque Quilquico Hotel.

What she needs?: more materials to increase her productivity. And like Yessenia, she needs a heater to keep the materials in good condition.

"My dream is to have a heater in my workshop"


Resumen en español

12 micro emprendedores rurales chilenos necesitan tu ayuda para cumplir sus sueños y así seguir rescatando la cultura e identidad local a través de sus trabajos.

Estos 12 micro-emprendedores chilenos tienen distintos anhelos, pero los unen las mismas cualidades: son innovadores, apasionados, luchadores, perseverantes y optimistas,  y  necesitan de nuestra ayuda para sacar adelante sus emprendimientos.

En Smartrip (www.smartrip.cl), agencia de viajes con sentido social, hemos trabajado con  este grupo de micro emprendedores en varios programas sociales apoyados por Smartrip: Balloon Chile en alianza con la empresa B, Emprediem (6 programas en destinos distintos, + de 800 emprendedores apoyados www.balloonchile.com) y Más Artesanía Local, desarrollado en alianza con TKO consultores www.turistiko.cl (2 programas en destinos distintos + de 30 artesanos apoyados).

Los hemos seleccionados para esta campaña de crowdfunding  por que los conocemos, hemos sido testigos de su compromiso y del tremendo potencial que tienen y sabemos que necesitan de un apoyo adicional para poder acercarlos a cumplir sus sueños y que puedan a través de sus trabajos seguir rescatando la cultura e identidad local.

Smartrip – Quiénes somos

Somos una agencia de viajes con foco social, cuyo objetivo es financiar proyectos sociales en los principales destinos turísticos de Chile, a través de alianzas con un grupo de hoteles líderes (https://www.smartrip.cl/paginas/hoteles), quienes nos entregan condiciones especiales para la venta de sus habitaciones, para apoyar este propósito social.

Es así como Smartrip ofrece los mejores hoteles de Chile con hasta 50% de descuento en www.smartrip.cl y sus utilidades se invierten en desarrollar programas sociales para las comunidades locales aledañas a esos hoteles, a través de la Fundación Smartrip, propietaria del 80% de la empresa.

Sobre esta campaña

Para esta campaña de crowdfunding, los hoteles que nos apoyan han donado noches de hotel para que sean entregadas como recompensas entre quienes hagan sus aportes a la campaña.  Esto, sumado a productos únicos que los mismos micro emprendedores han aportado y a cientos de Travel Gift Cards que Smartrip está aportando para que los que aporten puedan viajar a través de Smartrip, constituyen recompensas muy atractivas para que quienes aporten no solo estén contribuyendo a cumplir los sueños de estos micro emprendedores sino que también puedan vivir la experiencia de viajar con sentido.


Lo que logremos recaudar en esta campaña  será dividido entre los emprendedores, en función de sus necesidades, las que fueron recogidas en base a un diagnóstico detallado que le realizamos a cada uno de ellos. Si logramos superar la meta podremos apoyar a más emprendedores de otros destinos turísticos de Chile

Conoce a los emprendedores

Revisa las historias completas en: https://www.smartrip.cl/noticias/index/principales-proyectos

Fernanda Gutiérrez: Fernanda es una joven micro-emprendedora que trabaja el cuero. Un oficio que llamó su atención justo en un momento muy difícil de su vida en que era madre soltera y tenía que sacar sola a su hija adelante. Con mucho esfuerzo y valentía Fernanda logró potenciar su emprendimiento como talabartera y con eso superar las dificultades y permitir que su hija fuera al colegio. Fernanda fue una de las ganadoras del programa social apoyado por Smartrip y ejecutado por Emprediem: Balloon Chile Valle de Colchagua 2014.  Actualmente vende cinturones, carteras, pinches, monederos, entre otros, de cuero.

Qué necesita: un taller para trabajar mejor, con más espacio y poder transmitir su oficio a otras mujeres.

"Mi sueño es poder construir mi taller, para así poder dar trabajo a madres solteras que necesitan una mano para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Y también poder producir más." 

Iris Arévalo: Iris es una micro-emprendedora de Colchagua que creó Kuyen, marca de jabones, aceite para masajes, sales y espuma de baño. Todo elaborado a partir de la leche de cabra. Ella comenzó esto el año 2000 como un hobbie, pero con el tiempo fue formalizándolo hasta lograr hacer de él un emprendimiento.

Qué necesita: hacer cambios legales en su negocio y una diseñadora para tener una mejor presentación gráfica.

“Mi sueño es posesionarme en el mercado y de esta forma generar trabajo estable y seguro a mi familia—ya que ellos me han apoyado de manera incondicional—y también beneficiar a la comunidad donde crecí. Mi sueño es que mi marca sea conocida y reconocida, y que de esta forma me genere lo ingresos necesarios para estar tranquila y estable."

Eliana & Egidio: Eliana y Egidio son un matrimonio mapuche; él conocido como el “cuenta cuentos” y ella, profesora jubilada. Juntos crearon Pichi Wenu un restaurant donde rescatan la gastronomía mapuche y donde la tradicional comida viene acompañada por una poesía declamada por la misma señora Eliana, mientras que su marido, vestido con ropa típica de la cultura, da la bienvenida con la trutruca y relata cuentos a los turistas. 

Qué necesitan: un baño nuevo para poder recibir de mejor manera a los turistas.

"Mi sueño es que nos conozcan para que no se pierda la cultura y para ayudar al bienestar de la comunidad." 

Juana Quintoman: Juana, emprendedora de Neltume, rescata la antigua técnica del tejido mapuche en telar. Su trabajo es realizado a mano y sus materiales son naturales. Juana obtuvo el primer lugar en el primer programa social que realizó Smartrip y Emprediem el 2012 a los emprendedores de Huilo Huilo.

Qué necesita: agrandar su taller y construir un baño para poder trabajar mejor y más tranquila.

"Mi sueño es lograr obtener más ventas para que mi hijos puedan terminar de estudiar"

Luis & Caterina Manríquez: En la zona de Huilo Huilo no existía el canyoning hasta que a Luis Manríquez se le ocurrió implementarlo. Junto a su hermana Caterina, ofrecen este deporte que incluye descender en rapel por ríos, cascadas y otros, a turistas que quieren experimentar una actividad con adrenalina.

Qué necesitan: aumentar su equipamiento (trajes, cascos, chalecos, arnés, mosquetones, etc.) para atender a una mayor cantidad de clientes.

"Mi sueño es poder crecer como empresa, ser más conocidos a nivel nacional e internacional. Que los turistas conozcan nuestra increíble actividad llena de adrenalina y así puedan disfrutar de esta. También tener más equipamiento para así contar con más horarios y de esta manera darle más trabajo a más personas de nuestra localidad."

Verónica Quintonahuel: Verónica es una micro-emprendedora que hace unos años empezó a incursionar el volcán Sollipulli. Quedó tan impresionada con los paisajes que a partir de ese momento comenzó a ofrecer la ruta a los turistas. Lo particular de esta excursión, es que no sólo lleva a sus viajeros por rutas desconocidas y exclusivas (pues sólo Verónica tiene acceso a ella por ser sobrina del lonko de Reigolil), sino que además invita a los turistas a conocer de cerca la cultura mapuche a través de una experiencia local.

Qué necesita: completar su equipamiento de emergencia (botiquín, cascos, radio para comunicarse) para ofrecer un servicio en mejores condiciones.

 "Mi sueño es crecer más como emprendimiento, tener más comodidades, tener cosas básicas que me faltan para poder estar tranquila (agua potable, por ejemplo)" 

Jamil Samur: Jamil, un ex maestro carpintero que quedó sin trabajo, buscó una alternativa para salir adelante, y ahora se dedica a recolectar toda la madera que sobra y que encuentra en distintos lugares para hacerlo artesanía. Este artesano participó en el programa social apoyado por Smartrip, Balloon Pucón y Curarehue, y ganó uno de los premios entregados en la Ceremonia de Cierre.

Qué necesita: herramientas para madera (sierra de huincha, sierra ingletadora y router para madera) para poder trabajar de una manera más eficiente y producir más rápido.

"Sueño con que mis productos sean conocidos en todo Chile y así hacer crecer mi negocio" 

Juana Becerra: Juanita Becerra es artesana textil mapuche y le apasiona. Le han ofrecido llevar sus productos a Pucón, pero ella se niega, pues prefiere quedarse en Curarrehue y mostrarle a quienes la visiten todo el proceso de lo que hace. Aprendió el oficio de pequeña, obligada por su abuelo y su madre y dice agradecerlo hasta el día de hoy.

Juanita expone sus telares, cojines, gorros y más junto a otros dos artesanos de la zona en un lugar que llaman Expo Arte.

Qué necesita: construir un domo para poder trabajar y exponer sus productos.

"Mi sueño, con los otros artesanos, es tener un domo y así poder trabajar bien. También tener más publicidad y hacernos más conocidos"

Javier Arias: Javier es guía de turismo aventura y su pasión es el rafting y el kayaking. Tanto así, que ni si quiera el accidente que lo dejó parapléjico hace unos años, le impidió seguir en ello. Este joven, de constante sonrisa en su rostro, sigue trabajando en el emprendimiento que comenzó con otros compañeros hace más de 2 años. Se trata de “Turismo Limayco”, donde ofrecen paseos familiares en ducky (kayak inflable) por aguas tranquilas.

Qué necesita: aumentar su equipamiento (balsa, chalecos, trajes, botas y remos) para poder atender a todos los turistas que se acercan.

"Mi sueño es salir adelante. Poder trabajar todo el año, tener una oficina y todo el equipo necesario"

Gladys Soto: Gladys trabaja la lana de oveja hace más de 25 años. Comienza por obtener los vellones de lana chilota, que luego lava, tiñe, hila y teje para crear pieceras, murales, chombas y chalecos.  Su trabajo destaca, sobre todo, por integrar elementos naturales del campo.

Qué necesita:

"Mi sueño es poder tener un pedacito de terreno (un local) para poder hacer eventos (cumpleaños, eventos a fin de año) y usarlo también para trabajar"

Yessenia Mansilla: Yessenia heredó el oficio de sus padres y lleva un tiempo como artesana experta en cestería y tejidos con lana de oveja. Sus productos destacan por rescatar la mitología chilota a través de 10 figuras diferentes, entre ellas el Trauco y la Pincoya. Además, son realizados en base a manila y quiscal, fibras vegetales que recolecta en la Isla Llingua y que luego clasifica, seca y teje.

Qué necesita: un local propio. Yessenia no tiene un lugar especializado para guardar sus materiales, por lo tanto se echan a perder fácilmente.

"Mi sueño es tener un local propio, calefaccionado donde se puedan secar bien mis materiales y que así no se echen a perder"

Oliva Ulloa: Oliva es artesana experta en tejidos de lana de oveja y en técnicas propias del palillo, crochet y telar en quelgo (telar indígena chilote y mapuche). Sus principales productos son sweaters, chaquetas y chalecos, todos hechos por sus propias manos y teñidos con elementos naturales.

Qué necesita: más materiales para aumentar su productividad. Y al igual que Yessenia, necesita un calentador para mantener sus materiales en buenas condiciones.

"Mi sueño es poder tener un calentador para mi taller"
story_txt:
Summary(Al final puedes ver la versión en español)These 12 Chilean small entrepreneurs have different desires, but they share the same qualities:
they are innovative, passionate, persevering and optimistic, and they need our
help to be able to  overcome obstacles
and enlarge their business.
In Smartrip
(www.smartrip.cl), a travel agency with social focus ,
we have worked with this group of small entrepreneurs before through several social
programs:  Balloon Chile in alliance with the B Corp, Emprediem ( six programs
in different destinations, + 800 entrepreneurs supported, www.balloonchile.com) and "Más Artesanía Local" in alliance with TKO consultores (www.turistiko.cl two programs in different destinations + 30
craftsmen supported).
For this crowdfunding
campaign we have selected the people we know from our social programs. We have
witnessed their commitment and the tremendous potential they have. We know that
additional support is required in order to make it possible to fulfill their
dreams, and to be able to continue rescuing their culture and local identity
through their work.
Smartrip - About UsWe are a
travel agency with a social focus, and we aim to finance social projects in
major tourist destinations in Chile. We have partnerships with a group of
leading hotels (https://www.smartrip.cl/paginas/hoteles) that gives us special conditions to sell their available rooms,
to support this social purpose. + 50 hotels partners committed with local
developmentSmartrip
offers the best hotels in Chile with up to 50% discount in www.smartrip.cl. The
profits made are invested in different social programs that help to develop
local communities surrounding these hotels. The financiering is made through
Smartrip Foundation, which owns 80 % of the company.
About this campaign

For this crowdfunding
- campaign, our partner hotels have donated free nights in their rooms as a
reward for those who make their contributions to the campaign. In addition to
the hotel nights and the unique products that our small entrepreneurs produce,
Smartrip is donating also hundreds of Travel Gift Cards. These prizes make it
even more interesting for the people who not only want to help the local small entrepreneurs
in need, but also want to travel with sustainability.All the
profits that we are going to raise with this campaign will be divided among the
entrepreneurs, depending on their needs which were surveyed on a detailed
diagnosis for  each of them. If we exceed
our goal, we can support more entrepreneurs from other tourist destinations in
Chile.  
Meet the entrepreneurs
Check out
the full stories at: https://www.smartrip.cl/noticias/index/principales-proyectos
Fernanda Gutierrez: Fernanda is a young small entrepreneur who is
producing leather products. She interested in leather in a very difficult time
in her life when she was a single mother and had to take care of her daughter
alone. With much effort and courage she managed to boost her entrepreneurship
as a saddler and thereby she was able to  overcome the difficulties she had, and with
this, provide her daughter with an education. Fernanda was one of the winners
in the social program supported by Smartrip and executed by Emprediem: Balloon 2014 Colchagua Valley Chile, that had the support of our partners Hotel Santa Cruz, Lapostolle Residence and Viña La Playa. She currently sells belts, wallets, pinches and
purses, among other leather products. 
What she needs?: a better workshop with more space to be able
to work better and to provide job for other women too.
"My
dream is to build my own workshop, in order to provide jobs for other single
mothers who need a hand with raising their children. I also want to be able to produce
more products."                                   Iris Arevalo: Iris is a small entrepreneur from Colchagua Valley.
She created a brand called Kuyen. She sells different soaps, massage oils,
salts and bubble bath products, all made from goat's milk. She started it in
2000 as a hobby, but eventually she grew her business bigger and formed an
enterprise. Iris was part of  the social program supported by Smartrip and executed by Emprediem: Balloon 2014 Colchagua Valley Chile, that had the support of our partners Hotel Santa Cruz, Lapostolle Residence and Viña La Playa.
What she needs?: legal changes to her business and a designer
for a better graphical presentation.
"My
dream is to get into the market and in that way generate a stable and secure job
for my family, who have supported me unconditionally. I also want to benefit
the community where I grew up. My dream is that my brand is known and recognized,
and with that  have the needed income to
have a calm and stable life situation. "
                           



Egidio & Eliana: Eliana and Egidio are a Mapuche
couple; Egidio is know for his "storytelling" and Eliana is a retired
teacher. Together they created Pichi Wenu, a restaurant where traditional
Mapuche food is accompanied with a poem recited by Eliana, while her husband is
dressed in traditional clothing, welcoming tourists and telling them local
stories. The restaurant’s main purpose is to rescue their traditional
gastronomy and pass it along to next generations. Eliana and Egidio participated in the first social program that Smartrip and Emprediem made in 2012 with the entrepreneurs in Huilo Huilo, with the support of Huilo Huilo Hotels.
What they need?: a new bathroom, so they can host the tourists
better.
"My
dream is that we can be sure that our culture is not lost, and that we can help
the welfare of our community."




Juana Quintoman: Juana, an small entrepreneur from Neltume (Huilo Huilo Natural Reserve), is
practicing the ancient mapuche technique of weaving. Her work is done by her
own hands and all the materials are natural. Juana got  first place in the first social program that Smartrip and Emprediem made in 2012 with the entrepreneurs in Huilo Huilo, with the support of Huilo Huilo Hotels.
What she needs?: enlarge her workshop and build a bathroom in
order to work better and in peace.
 "My
dream is to get more sales so my children can finish school"

   

   


Luis & Caterina Manriquez: In the area of Huilo Huilo there
was no possibility of canyoning until Luis Manriquez came up with the idea.
Together with his sister Caterina, they are offering this sport that includes descending
down by rivers, waterfalls and others, for the tourists who want to experience
an adrenaline-filled activity. Luis and Caterina were one of the winners in the first social program that Smartrip and Emprediem made in 2012 with the entrepreneurs in Huilo Huilo, with the support of Huilo Huilo Hotels.
What they need?: increase their equipment (suits, helmets,
vests, harnesses, carabineers, etc.) to serve a greater number of customers.
"My
dream is to grow my company, be better known nationally and internationally. I
want that tourists know our incredible adrenaline-filled activity. We also need
more staff in order to provide more trips and thus give more work to the people
in our town. "

            




Veronica Quintonahuel: Verónica is a small entrepreneur
that a few years ago started to explore the Sollipulli volcano. She was so
impressed with the landscapes that she started to give touristic tours there. What
is unique about this tour is that  not
only she takes her passengers to unknown and exclusive routes (since Veronica is
the only one who has access to those by being  niece of the lonko of Reigolil), but also
invites tourists to learn about the Mapuche culture through a local experience.  Verónica was one of the winners in the social program supported by Smartrip and Antumalal Hotel, and executed by Emprediem: Balloon 2014 Pucón & Curarrehue Chile.
What she needs?: complete her emergency equipment (first aid
kit, helmets, radio to communicate) to provide better conditions for the
tourists.
 "My
dream is to grow my entrepreneurship, have more amenities, and have basic
things that I’m currently missing in order to have a stable, secure life (potable
water, for example)"



           




Jamil Samur: Jamil, a former master carpenter who lost his
job, sought an alternative to succeed. He is now dedicated to collect all the
remaining wood in different places to do crafts. This craftsman participated in
the social program supported by Smartrip and Antumalal Hotel, Balloon Chile Pucon Curarehue, and
won one of the prizes awarded at the Closing Ceremony.
What he needs?: tools for wood (huincha saw, miter saw and
router wood) in order to work more efficiently and produce faster.
"I
dream that my products are known throughout Chile so that my business can grow "

          



Juana Becerra: Juanita Becerra is specialized in Mapuche
textile handicraft. She has been offered to bring her products to Pucon, but
she refuses. She prefers to stay in Curarrehue as she wants to show everyone
who visits the city, the whole process of making her traditional handicraft. She
learned the technique when she was really young, forced to work by her
grandfather and mother, to whom she’s ever grateful. Juanita participated in the social program sopported by Smartrip and Antumalal Hotel, Balloon Chile 2014 Pucón & Curarrehue Chile.
Juanita
exposes her looms, cushions, hats and much more with two other local craftsmen
in a place called Art Expo.
What she needs?: build a place where she can work and exhibit her
products.
"My
dream, together with the other craftsmen, is to have a place where we can work better.
We also need more advertising to make us known widely"

  


Javier Arias: Javier is an adventure guide whose passion is
rafting and kayaking. He loves his job so much that not even an accident that
left him a paraplegic few years ago prevented him from doing it. This young
man, with a constant smile on his face, is now working in the enterprise that he
established over 2 years ago with his colleagues. The entrepreneurship  is called "Tourism Limayco", were
they  offer family rides in a ducky
(inflatable kayak) in the calm waters. This local entrepreneur participated in the social program supported by Smartrip and Antumalal Hotel, Balloon Chile Pucón & Curarehue, and won one of the prizes awarded at the Closing Ceremony.
What he needs?: increase his equipment (raft, life jackets,
suits, boots and paddles) in order to serve all the tourists that are willing
to come to tours. 
"My
dream is to succeed. I want to be able to work all year round, have an office
and all the necessary equipment"

            



Gladys Soto: Gladys has been working with sheep wool for more
than 25 years. She starts with collecting the chilota wool fleeces, which are
then washed, dyed, spun and finally woven in order to create bed covers, murals,
sweaters and vests. Her work stands out, above all, because of its natural
elements. Gladys participate in the social program "More Local Crafts Chiloé Island" developed by Smartrip in alliance with TKO consultants and Parque Quilquico Hotel.

What she needs?: her own workshop

"My
dream is to have a piece of land in order to work there and organize different events
(birthdays, new year eve’s parties)"



   
   



Yessenia Mansilla: Yessenia learned her talent from her parents
and for a while she has been a skilled craftsman in basket-making and sheep
wool fabrics. With her products she aims to rescue chilota mythology throughout
10 different figures, including Trauco and Pincoya. The baskets are made of
manila and quiscal, vegetable fibers. They are gathered in the Llingua Island and
then are classified, dried and woven. Yessenia participate in the social program "More Local Crafts Chiloé Island" developed by Smartrip in alliance with TKO consultants and Parque Quilquico Hotel.
What she needs?: her own workplace. Yessenia does not have a
dedicated place to store her materials and because of that  they spoil easily.
"My
dream is to have my own heated workplace, where my material can dry out well
and doesn’t get spoiled"





Olivia Ulloa: Oliva is an expert artisan of sheep wool
fabrics. She is also an expert in the weaving, crochet and loom techniques (chilote
and indigenous Mapuche loom). Her main products are sweaters, jackets and
vests, all made by her own hands and dyed with natural elements. Oliva participate in the social program "More Local Crafts Chiloé Island" developed by Smartrip in alliance with TKO consultants and Parque Quilquico Hotel.
What she needs?: more materials to increase her productivity.
And like Yessenia, she needs a heater to keep the materials in good condition.
"My
dream is to have a heater in my workshop"





Resumen en español

12 micro
emprendedores rurales chilenos necesitan tu ayuda para cumplir sus sueños y así
seguir rescatando la cultura e identidad local a través de sus trabajos.


Estos
12 micro-emprendedores chilenos tienen distintos anhelos, pero los unen las mismas cualidades: son innovadores,
apasionados, luchadores, perseverantes y optimistas,  y  necesitan
de nuestra ayuda para sacar adelante sus emprendimientos.
En Smartrip (www.smartrip.cl), agencia de viajes con sentido social, hemos trabajado con  este grupo de micro emprendedores en varios programas sociales apoyados por Smartrip: Balloon Chile en alianza con la empresa B, Emprediem (6 programas en
destinos distintos, + de 800 emprendedores apoyados www.balloonchile.com) y Más Artesanía Local, desarrollado en alianza con TKO consultores www.turistiko.cl (2 programas en destinos distintos + de 30 artesanos apoyados).
Los hemos seleccionados
para esta campaña de crowdfunding  por
que los conocemos, hemos sido testigos de su compromiso y del tremendo
potencial que tienen y sabemos que necesitan de un apoyo adicional para poder
acercarlos a cumplir sus sueños y que puedan a través de sus trabajos seguir
rescatando la cultura e identidad local.
Smartrip – Quiénes somos 
Somos una
agencia de viajes con foco social, cuyo objetivo es financiar proyectos
sociales en los principales destinos turísticos de Chile, a través de alianzas
con un grupo de hoteles líderes (https://www.smartrip.cl/paginas/hoteles), quienes nos entregan condiciones especiales para
la venta de sus habitaciones, para apoyar este propósito social.
Es así como
Smartrip ofrece los mejores hoteles de Chile con hasta 50% de descuento en www.smartrip.cl y sus utilidades se invierten en desarrollar programas sociales para
las comunidades locales aledañas a esos hoteles, a través de la Fundación
Smartrip, propietaria del 80% de la empresa. 
Sobre esta campaña
Para esta
campaña de crowdfunding, los hoteles que nos apoyan han donado noches de hotel
para que sean entregadas como recompensas entre quienes hagan sus aportes a la
campaña.  Esto, sumado a productos únicos
que los mismos micro emprendedores han aportado y a cientos de Travel Gift Cards
que Smartrip está aportando para que los que aporten puedan viajar a través de
Smartrip, constituyen recompensas muy atractivas para que quienes aporten no
solo estén contribuyendo a cumplir los sueños de estos micro emprendedores sino
que también puedan vivir la experiencia de viajar con sentido.



Lo que
logremos recaudar en esta campaña  será
dividido entre los emprendedores, en función de sus necesidades, las que fueron
recogidas en base a un diagnóstico detallado que le realizamos a cada uno de
ellos. Si logramos superar la meta podremos apoyar a más emprendedores de otros
destinos turísticos de Chile

Conoce a los
emprendedores 
Revisa las
historias completas en: https://www.smartrip.cl/noticias/index/principales-proyectos
Fernanda Gutiérrez: Fernanda es una joven micro-emprendedora que trabaja
el cuero. Un oficio que llamó su atención justo en un momento muy difícil de su
vida en que era madre soltera y tenía que sacar sola a su hija adelante. Con
mucho esfuerzo y valentía Fernanda logró potenciar su emprendimiento como
talabartera y con eso superar las dificultades y permitir que su hija fuera al
colegio. Fernanda fue una de las ganadoras del programa social apoyado por Smartrip y
ejecutado por Emprediem: Balloon Chile Valle de Colchagua 2014.  Actualmente vende cinturones, carteras, pinches,
monederos, entre otros, de cuero. 
Qué necesita: un taller para trabajar mejor, con más espacio y poder transmitir su
oficio a otras mujeres. 
"Mi
sueño es poder construir mi taller, para así poder dar trabajo a madres
solteras que necesitan una mano para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Y también
poder producir más." 
Iris Arévalo: Iris es una micro-emprendedora de Colchagua que creó
Kuyen, marca de jabones, aceite para masajes, sales y espuma de baño. Todo
elaborado a partir de la leche de cabra. Ella comenzó esto el año 2000 como un
hobbie, pero con el tiempo fue formalizándolo hasta lograr hacer de él un
emprendimiento. 
Qué necesita: hacer cambios legales en su negocio y una diseñadora para tener una
mejor presentación gráfica.
“Mi sueño es posesionarme
en el mercado y de esta forma generar trabajo estable y seguro a mi familia—ya
que ellos me han apoyado de manera incondicional—y también beneficiar a la
comunidad donde crecí. Mi sueño es que mi marca sea conocida y reconocida, y
que de esta forma me genere lo ingresos necesarios para estar tranquila y
estable."

cuentos” y ella, profesora jubilada. Juntos crearon Pichi Wenu un restaurant donde

cuentos a los turistas. 
Qué necesitan: un baño nuevo para poder recibir de mejor manera a los turistas. 
"Mi
sueño es que nos conozcan para que no se pierda la cultura y para ayudar al
bienestar de la comunidad."

Neltume, rescata la antigua técnica del tejido mapuche en telar. Su trabajo es
realizado a mano y sus materiales son naturales. Juana obtuvo el primer lugar
en el primer programa social que realizó Smartrip y Emprediem el 2012 a los emprendedores
de Huilo Huilo. 
Qué necesita: agrandar su taller y construir un baño para poder trabajar mejor y más tranquila.
"Mi
sueño es lograr obtener más ventas para que mi hijos puedan terminar de
estudiar"
Luis & Caterina
Manríquez: En la zona de Huilo Huilo no existía el
canyoning hasta que a Luis Manríquez se le ocurrió implementarlo. Junto a su
hermana Caterina, ofrecen este deporte que incluye descender en rapel por ríos,
cascadas y otros, a turistas que quieren experimentar una actividad con
adrenalina. 
Qué necesitan: aumentar su equipamiento (trajes, cascos, chalecos, arnés, mosquetones,
etc.) para atender a una mayor cantidad de clientes. 
"Mi
sueño es poder crecer como empresa, ser más conocidos a nivel nacional e
internacional. Que los turistas conozcan nuestra increíble actividad llena de
adrenalina y así puedan disfrutar de esta. También tener más equipamiento para
así contar con más horarios y de esta manera darle más trabajo a más personas
de nuestra localidad."

particular de esta excursión, es que no sólo lleva a sus viajeros por rutas

Qué necesita:
completar su equipamiento de
emergencia (botiquín, cascos, radio para comunicarse) para ofrecer un servicio
en mejores condiciones. 
 "Mi sueño es crecer más como
emprendimiento, tener más comodidades, tener cosas básicas que me faltan para
poder estar tranquila (agua potable, por ejemplo)" 
Jamil Samur: Jamil, un ex maestro carpintero que quedó sin trabajo, buscó una
alternativa para salir adelante, y ahora se dedica a recolectar toda la madera
que sobra y que encuentra en distintos lugares para hacerlo artesanía. Este
artesano participó en el programa social apoyado por Smartrip, Balloon Pucón y
Curarehue, y ganó uno de los premios entregados en la Ceremonia de Cierre. 
Qué necesita: herramientas para madera (sierra de huincha, sierra ingletadora y router
para madera) para poder trabajar de una manera más eficiente y producir más
rápido. 
"Sueño
con que mis productos sean conocidos en todo Chile y así hacer crecer mi
negocio" 
Juana Becerra: Juanita Becerra
es artesana textil mapuche y le apasiona. Le han ofrecido llevar sus productos
a Pucón, pero ella se niega, pues prefiere quedarse en Curarrehue y mostrarle a
quienes la visiten todo el proceso de lo que hace. Aprendió el oficio de pequeña,
obligada por su abuelo y su madre y dice agradecerlo hasta el día de hoy. 
Juanita expone sus telares, cojines, gorros y más junto a otros dos
artesanos de la zona en un lugar que llaman Expo Arte. 

Qué necesita: construir un domo para
poder trabajar y exponer sus productos.
"Mi
sueño, con los otros artesanos, es tener un domo y así poder trabajar bien.
También tener más publicidad y hacernos más conocidos"
Javier Arias: Javier es guía de
turismo aventura y su pasión es el rafting y el kayaking. Tanto así, que ni si
quiera el accidente que lo dejó parapléjico hace unos años, le impidió seguir
en ello. Este joven, de constante sonrisa en su rostro, sigue trabajando en el
emprendimiento que comenzó con otros compañeros hace más de 2 años. Se trata de
“Turismo Limayco”, donde ofrecen paseos familiares en ducky (kayak inflable) por
aguas tranquilas. 
Qué necesita: aumentar su equipamiento (balsa, chalecos, trajes, botas y remos) para
poder atender a todos los turistas que se acercan. 
"Mi
sueño es salir adelante. Poder trabajar todo el año, tener una oficina y todo
el equipo necesario"
Gladys Soto: Gladys trabaja la lana de
oveja hace más de 25 años. Comienza por obtener los vellones de lana chilota,
que luego lava, tiñe, hila y teje para crear pieceras, murales, chombas y
chalecos.  Su trabajo destaca, sobre todo, por
integrar elementos naturales del campo.
Qué necesita:
"Mi
sueño es poder tener un pedacito de terreno (un local) para poder hacer eventos
(cumpleaños, eventos a fin de año) y usarlo también para trabajar"
Yessenia Mansilla: Yessenia heredó el
oficio de sus padres y lleva un tiempo como artesana experta en cestería y
tejidos con lana de oveja. Sus productos destacan por rescatar la mitología
chilota a través de 10 figuras diferentes, entre ellas el Trauco y la Pincoya.
Además, son realizados en base a manila y quiscal, fibras vegetales que
recolecta en la Isla Llingua y que luego clasifica, seca y teje. 
Qué necesita: un local propio.
Yessenia no tiene un lugar especializado para guardar sus materiales, por lo
tanto se echan a perder fácilmente. 
"Mi
sueño es tener un local propio, calefaccionado donde se puedan secar bien mis
materiales y que así no se echen a perder"
Oliva Ulloa: Oliva es artesana
experta en tejidos de lana de oveja y en técnicas propias del palillo, crochet
y telar en quelgo (telar indígena chilote y mapuche). Sus principales productos
son sweaters, chaquetas y chalecos, todos hechos por sus propias manos y teñidos
con elementos naturales. 
Qué necesita: más materiales para aumentar su productividad. Y al igual que Yessenia,
necesita un calentador para mantener sus materiales en buenas condiciones. 
"Mi
sueño es poder tener un calentador para mi taller"

story:
Alpha Cup Cafe in Nicaragua
We are starting a coffee shop in Nicaragua, and we want you to be part of it. The purpose behind this coffee shop is to advance higher level education in Nicaragua by providing training, part time work and to support college students currently studying in Nicaragua.

About Us
Nadia Garcia, is from Nicaragua and has a degree and Economics and an MBA at Thomas More university. After being in the market place for 2 years  and getting trained at UMD university in Minnesota she pioneered a campus based organization called Chi Alpha in Nicaragua and has been the director for the past 10 years. Her other work includes Habitat for Humanity, the Ministry of Statistics and Census in Nicaragua, and procurement for Vapensa- Serquimsa. She is passionate about working with college students and assisting them in their personal and professional lives.

Slavik Melnik has a Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management and he is a Certified Associate in Project Management. He is passionate about creating positive social change with small business enterprises. He joined the team when he first visited Nicaragua for a 3 month volunteering trip  to work with university students for teaching English and volunteering with Chi Alpha. While serving in Nicaragua he clearly saw the need to create opportunities for the students and wanted to work on this project to make it a reality.

The Impact
Through the past 10 years of experience working with students Nadia has seen many challenges that students face in order to stay in college. On rare occasions a student may be able to find a full time job to support themselves or help support their family. But for most students that is not a feasible option and part time work is currently non-existent across Nicaragua. Often times when family is not able to pay for education the students have no option but to drop out of the university. This challenge can be overcome with a simple part time job that would allow a student to earn an income while they continue to go to the university.

This is where Alpha Cup Cafe comes in with your help. Our intent is to structure the business so that it is a self sustaining cafe that will employ 10-15 part time baristas. By partnering with us you will help many students to complete their degrees successfully. There will also be opportunities for students from US and around the world to experience a different culture and volunteer for short term trips in Nicaragua. This is Alpha Cup Cafe’s first location and it is a big step to making a positive impact in the community.

What We Need
We need an estimated of $120,000 to open this coffee shop. $30,000 for the equipment, $30,000 for remodeling (will vary based on the final location selection) $20,000 for furniture, $45,000 for first three months of operating expenses and salaries and $5,000 for startup inventory. Currently we already have $45,000 from direct investments and we are looking to fundraise $75,000 more through crowdfunding (after the cost of  the products).

The Risks and Challenges
If anyone has run a coffee shop they know that it can be challenging to break even with operating expense in this industry. After surveying the industry in Nicaragua we have noticed that many improvements can be made in this industry that will enable us to be competitive because the market is not yet saturated as in United States. Furthermore, 3 months of operating expenses will provide us with enough time to refine our business and operations for profitability. The second challenge is location. Coffee shop owners know that it is all about location. The plan is to open Alpha Cup Cafe in a location nearby a university and visible from a busy intersection and shopping center in Managua with a great amount of foot traffic. Recently there is an influx of over a million tourists coming through Nicaragua every year. By opening near a busy area and developing center in Managua we will be able to ensure future growth and success. We have received great advice and feedback from coffee shop and restaurant owners from United States as well as in Nicaragua. And with many insights and suggestions from our advisors we are confident we can overcome all of theses challenges.

Our Vision
Our vision is to partner with college students to make a positive influence in the community and in the business sector. We see Alpha Cup Cafe eventually going outside of the walls of the coffee shop to partner with other organizations such as Chi Alpha to nurture better community and establishing other development projects in our area. Furthermore we also hope that other businesses will begin to replicate our model and also begin to provide part time work to college students. 

Support Us Today!
Help us reach our goal of $100,000 on Indiegogo by partnering with us at one of the levels. You can also your support by sharing this page with your friends and family and on Facebook. You will provide us with enough funding to position Alpha Cup Cafe as the leader in the industry for quality of coffee and service, fair wages, social change, and part time job opportunities.

Biggest Thank You and Many Blessings,

Alpha Cup Cafe Team


Contact us at: alphacupcafe@gmail.com

Also follow us on Facebook :-)

Some of the paintings available are pictured below:

story:
it started with some real unhappy skin... 

The inspiration started with a child.  Agatha came into the world in 2008, and while she was a super chill baby, her skin was definitely throwing temper tantrums.  All the normal, gentle, "skin friendly", "earth friendly" options were exhausted and so was Megan Elizabeth, Agatha's mom.  The final attempt was to make things at home and see how they worked.  The results were amazing and led Megan Elizabeth and her best friend, Traci, to look into other things they could make themselves. 

Over the years, an idea began to form.  Megan Elizabeth and Traci read more labels, listened to many people have similar complaints about products in the mainstream market, and shared unique experiences with people that wanted to make things themselves.  "If only" seems to be the phrase that started out many people's wish list for a product... and the ladies thought, "Well, maybe we can make 'if only' a reality." 

Thus, the Narwhal and the Manatee was born. Offering a unique, personalized experience, this bath boutique gives each and every customer the ability to create their very own bath products. 

The shop caters exclusively to the community it is in, and is just as much about building a strong community as it is in creating a marvelous product. 

five ways we are different

  1. We offer pre-made products that you can come in and purchase anytime.
  2. We offer you the opportunity to create your own custom products in the shop!
  3. We will take your special request and make it especially for you!
  4. We are experts in skin-care, drawing from our own research and (more importantly) our own experiences.
  5. We are awesome.

five reasons you should choose us

  1. You get to make YOUR OWN PRODUCT!
  2. You love fun (because we love fun and you might feel weird in our shop if you don't like fun).
  3. You like to party (because we will help you have a party...in our shop...where you make YOUR OWN PRODUCT!).
  4. You are concerned about your skin. We will do our best to help your skin by using healthy, responsible ingredients. 
  5. You are concerned about the environment. We choose ingredients that are Earth-friendly because we like living here and we assume you do, too. 

five reasons we started N&M

  1. We get things done. So we are taking the opportunity to be together, to be geniuses at what we do and to responsibly provide for our families. 
  2.  We have answers...or we will find the answer...to skin problems. 
  3. Our community. The people around us keep us going and we want to be a big part of making our community stronger, culturally advanced and healthy.
  4. People like to create things, but don't want to deal with the mess. We're willing to deal with the mess...you do the creating. 
  5. Passion. We love what we do and it shows. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $50,000 to start our business. We are also applying for grants and loans, but we still have families to care for! 
  • Here's the deal...if you donate, we will send you some of our products! You can choose: Bubble Cookies, Bath Fizzies or Shower Refreshers. We will even customize to your liking!
  • Our plan is to open a store front in March 2016. Through this campaign, grants and loans, we fully anticipate being able to reach that goal. However, if for some crazy reason we don't, this money will be donated to support educational opportunities for women and girls in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Because...we really do like to spread the love.

The Impact

  • Working in both the corporate world and for nonprofits, Megan Elizabeth fully believes that the world needs responsible businesses that build community and empower employees and customers alike. This business plan is built on a strong moral foundation that strives to create new leaders and a safe environment for everyone involved. 
  • This business is designed to help people find what they need to live healthier lives. It's done in a bright, fun way, but when we get down to it we want to help people be more comfortable in their own skin. Literally.
  • Already we have hosted workshops and are currently making special orders for Holiday shoppers. We've had our products go through a special "test subject" group to refine each and every product. So far...everyone is in love. We are already solving skin problems for not just our family members, but our friends and our friend's friends!

Risks & Challenges

We are confident! Megan Elizabeth and Traci have enough combined experience to overcome any risks and challenges!

  • The truth is, we've put our lives on the line here. We want to support our families and we knew we had to be 100% sure we could do this. And we are. 
  • In the face of challenges (which we know there will be some), we have created an amazing team of people. Mentors include a small business owner, financial planner, a doctor and an accountant. We are partnered with the Innovation Center in Fort Wayne, IN to receive professional help from other small business owners. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand...you love this idea, but don't have the cash. Believe us, we totally understand. BUT...we can still use your help! Here's how:

  • Check out our website: thenarwhalandthemanatee.com
  • Encourage friends/family to do some special ordering :)
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
