story:
It's true:
You need a bit of courage to be one of the first couple of dozen backers.
It takes a certain leap of faith - we get that! 



Do you want regular people to be able to change the world?


Regular people, everywhere.

Your world and your neighborhood.


How many great things don’t get done because dreamers, builders, and community leaders don’t have something like Syntention to help them?

.


Since the beginning,

people have yearned 

for a way

to make things better.



People everywhere have always wanted to make decisions that work best for them. Governments, dictators, multi-nationals, and the political establishment have rarely had your best interests at heart. (Is that putting it mildly?)



.




So how about if anyone or any group could propose a change, or an improvement to their local community, or the world as a whole? Gather support, get together, plan how to get it done, and do it?


Syntention lets us do that.



Syntention is

once and for all

how people everywhere will choose their future

and actually make it happen.

Locally and globally.


People want to improve the world, or their local community, or both. The words people use to describe how they feel are very powerful. Often, those words boil down to fear and hope...  

People who want something better really care about it.


It could be a global issue, like improving how countries treat refugees, or ending poverty, as UN Leader Ban Ki-moon's T-shirt says in the pic above.

But it doesn’t have to be earth-shaking to be important.

Need more daycare spaces in your community? Is there a dead space in your neighborhood that could be transformed into a park? Or maybe you wish a company would offer an additional service (breakfast all day at your favorite fast food place!!). Maybe you want to build a path through the wilderness:


We expect local Missions will be more numerous than global Missions.



Syntention is the place for action...

...beyond petitions, which can feel like begging at the feet of the powerful.

Plan how to gather support, and from where. Then together, plan how to get it done. Build a budget. Fund it. Assign tasks. Track progress. Celebrate success. All in one place.



Here's a quote from Rahul Gandhi: 

"Give a government all the power you want. Give it everything. It cannot solve the problems of a billion people. Give a billion people the power to solve their problems and it will be done immediately." 


Team Members

Syntention’s founders are Warrick Harrison - that's me! - and Preethi Ram. Preethi has the business education to hold everything together and the passion to drive it. She's also a pretty good presenter, which will soon be vital. Fun fact: she also speaks 5 languages, so you should be able to chat with her! We both have an HR background, which will be a huge help. 

I have a dozen years of experience as a professional leader of Volunteers, so I know: 


Dedicated people get amazing things done. 


I helped develop a couple of organizations from scratch. I also built a web-based platform (ClientPlaza), so you know I can bring a tech enterprise to launch. 

Here's ClientPlaza's logo, just for fun:


.



Growing up on the Canadian prairies, I saw informal community leaders get things done.

Two examples:

1)  A small group of regular people got an indoor swimming pool built in a tiny rural community. At first, no one thought it was a good idea, but after many meetings and phone calls, the community rallied behind it.

2)  Another small group saw a need to bring awareness and support to the many people who came from around the world to help build Canada. This was in a small farming town where people didn’t really love immigrants much (okay there was rampant racism). After many community meetings, lots of phone calls, posters, a formal proposal to the County, the Stony Plain Multicultural Heritage Centre became a reality ("Centre" is the Canadian spelling) . 

Here's a "before" pic:

And today:


It was amazing. 

And it was really hard to do, mostly because the tools to communicate and rally support and make a plan just weren’t there. That was 40 years ago, and the Stony Plain Multicultural Centre is still going strong today. If that small group had had Syntention, they would have had an easier time. They would have been able to do more.


We wonder:

How many great things don’t get done because dreamers, builders, and community leaders don’t have something like Syntention to help them?

How many times have you seen something appalling or disheartening, and wished you could actually do something about it? How many times has everyone around the world wished they could actually do something?

It’s uncountable.

All the lost opportunities; the unnecessary suffering around the world; the strife that we didn’t have to go through – it all makes us shiver. We know... you, too.



Let’s do something about it.

Now that we all have the ability to develop Syntention together, shouldn’t we? So that once and for all we all have the ability to do what needs doing.

Whatever comes up, almost anywhere around the world – we can make things better.

We can make a decision, make a plan to get it done, budget it, fund it, assign tasks, track progress, and celebrate success. All of that in one place.



Your Indiegogo contribution

will build Syntention's

permanent platform


We created a demo.

Here is Syntention 

This demo isn't robust. Nor does it allow for the proper development of a proposal through discussion. It doesn't allow for enough collaboration. For example, proposals ("Missions") need to be adjustable until they are satisfactory. Also, the Mission Project section needs to be easier to use. 

All of this needs a team of real programmers. 

The programmers have been chosen. Warrick worked with them before (on ClientPlaza) and they had great results together. They are ready for "Go!" Let's gather the resources to make it happen. Timeline to live is 60-75 days from "Go!"


If the Indiegogo community doesn't get us to the full goal, we'll decide whether there is enough support to start from where we are. If there is, great! We'll go ahead, and continue fundraising as required. If there isn't enough support to justify the risk, then we'll have to reassess. But we're pretty sure the community has a real desire to give actual power to ordinary people. Do you agree?



What did the founders contribute so far?


Warrick: 

"After pondering for a long time, as many of you have, I decided that if I cared enough, I should really do it. So I dedicated this part of my life to the idea that people are smart enough and dedicated enough to do what it takes to make their world better.


"During development, I’ve had a part-time job so I can eat, since I’m not rich. Snow removal. Snow removal is surprisingly hard! It was about -22 on this night, and windy, and I wasn't a very happy fellow:


"Here's the very next night at the same site, after the snow stopped.  -20 again but not windy... so it wasn't terrible at all:


"I’ve spent about 1500 hours building the Syntention demo, developing the enterprise structure, and gathering support. It’s been difficult. Friends tell me I  should write a book just about the hardships along the journey! But I'm excited to keep going. I’m driven, but not forced, and that makes a huge difference."


Preethi: 

Communications, Platform Design, Enterprise Design. "I still have a full-time job and work on Syntention evenings and weekends. As Syntention's user-experience lead, I'm primarily responsible for what you will see when the programmers are finished." She is the beating heart of Syntention, and so excited to take the next step!

Chris:  Advisor

Maureen:   Advisor

Now we’ve come to the point where our own resources aren’t enough for the next stage, so it’s up to you to lift Syntention from here.


Have a look at Syntention.com

Here’s the demo platform. 

It works and you can use it; all the data will be transferred to the full platform. You will see a hundred ways the demo sucks; you will also see that the finished product will change our world. If you get involved, you will be part of giving people what we’ve all wanted pretty much since the beginning.

We chose elephants for the logo because they're seen as benevolent giants... and when they decide where they want to go, they pretty much do. Syntention is like that.

.

This logo will be upgraded for the real platform, but you get the idea.


Risks and challenges?

So many!

Will enough people realize that regular people everywhere can actually decide things and make them happen?

Will people who are currently powerful try to hinder our effort?

Will “competitors” do it better? Some large companies (you can think of them!) could do this in a second, if they wanted to. But this is an enormous change to the way the world works, so it might be too risky for established companies.

Will we be able to let enough people know about Syntention, quickly enough?


The answer to all these, and more, is in your decision: 

Will you get involved in some way? 

If you will, then others will. If you and people in your network jump in, Syntention will succeed. Warrick has experience organizing people and developing enterprises. Preethi knows Communications, Enterprise Admin, and HR ... and she has boundless energy. Team Members Maureen and Chris have broad experience, wisdom, and energy. You have power. So we can overcome pretty much anything.


You can help by contributing to the funding, of course; and there are other ways to make an impact, too. Just telling your network is a big help. Let people know they can now do something real about anything that’s important to them. Or just use Syntention. When everyone sees Syntention being used, they will realize, “Oh! I get it!” And they will join in, too.


After all

you're not the only one

who wants to change the world.
story_txt:
It's true:You need a bit of courage to be one of the first couple of dozen backers.It takes a certain leap of faith - we get that! 
Do you want regular people to be able to change the world?
Regular people, everywhere.Your world and your neighborhood.
How many great things don’t get done because dreamers, builders, and community leaders don’t have something like Syntention to help them?
.Since the beginning,people have yearned for a wayto make things better. 
People everywhere have always wanted to make decisions that work best for them. Governments, dictators, multi-nationals, and the political establishment have rarely had your best interests at heart. (Is that putting it mildly?).




So how about if anyone or any group could propose a change, or an improvement to their local community, or the world as a whole? Gather support, get together, plan how to get it done, and do it?
Syntention lets us do that.

Syntention isonce and for allhow people everywhere will choose their futureand actually make it happen.Locally and globally.
People want to improve the world, or their local community,
or both. The words people use to describe how they feel are very powerful. Often, those words boil down to fear and hope...  People
who want something better really care about it.
It could be a global issue, like improving how countries treat refugees, or ending poverty, as UN Leader Ban Ki-moon's T-shirt says in the pic above.But it doesn’t have to be earth-shaking to be important.Need more daycare spaces in your community? Is there a dead space in your neighborhood that could be transformed into a park? Or maybe you wish a company would offer an additional service (breakfast all day at your favorite fast food place!!). Maybe you want to build a path through the wilderness:
We expect local Missions will be more
numerous than global Missions.
Syntention is the place for action......beyond petitions, which can feel like begging at the feet of the powerful.Plan how to gather support, and from where. Then together, plan how to get it done. Build a budget. Fund it. Assign tasks. Track progress. Celebrate success. All in one place.


Here's a quote from Rahul Gandhi: 
"Give a government all the power you want. Give it everything. It cannot solve the problems of a billion people. Give a billion people the power to solve their problems and it will be done immediately." 

Team MembersSyntention’s founders are Warrick Harrison - that's me! - and Preethi Ram. Preethi has the business education to hold everything together and the passion to drive it. She's also a pretty good presenter, which will soon be vital. Fun fact: she also speaks 5 languages, so you should be able to chat with her! We both have an HR background, which will be a huge help. I have a dozen years of experience as a professional leader of Volunteers, so I know: Dedicated people get amazing things done. I helped develop
a couple of organizations from scratch. I also built a web-based platform (ClientPlaza), so you know I can bring a tech enterprise to launch. Here's ClientPlaza's logo, just for fun:.Growing up on the Canadian prairies, I saw informal community
leaders get things done.
Two examples:
1) 
A small group of regular people got an indoor swimming
pool built in a tiny rural community. At first, no one thought it was a good
idea, but after many meetings and phone calls, the community rallied behind it.
2) 
Another small group saw a need to bring
awareness and support to the many people who came from around the world to help
build Canada. This was in a small farming town where people didn’t really love
immigrants much (okay there was rampant racism). After many community meetings, lots of phone calls, posters, a
formal proposal to the County, the Stony Plain Multicultural Heritage Centre became a reality ("Centre" is the Canadian spelling) . Here's a "before" pic:And today:It was amazing. And it was really hard to do, mostly because the
tools to communicate and rally support and make a plan just weren’t there. That
was 40 years ago, and the Stony Plain Multicultural Centre is still going
strong today. If that small group had had Syntention, they would have had an
easier time. They would have been able to do more.
We wonder:How many great things don’t get done because dreamers, builders, and community leaders don’t have
something like Syntention to help them?
How many times have you seen something appalling or disheartening, and
wished you could actually do something about it? How many times has everyone around the world wished they could actually do something?
It’s uncountable.
All the lost opportunities; the unnecessary suffering around the
world; the strife that we didn’t have to go through – it all makes us shiver. We know... you, too.
Let’s do something about it.
Now that we all have the ability to develop Syntention together,
shouldn’t we? So that once and for all we all have the ability to do what needs
doing.
Whatever comes up, almost anywhere around the world – we can
make things better.
We can make a decision, make a plan to get it done, budget
it, fund it, assign tasks, track progress, and celebrate success. All of that
in one place.
Your Indiegogo contribution
will build Syntention's

permanent platform
We created a demo.Here is Syntention This demo isn't robust. Nor does it
allow for the proper development of a proposal through discussion. It doesn't allow for enough collaboration. For example, proposals ("Missions") need
to be adjustable until they are satisfactory. Also, the Mission Project section
needs to be easier to use. All of this needs a team of real programmers. The
programmers have been chosen. Warrick worked with them before (on ClientPlaza) and they had great results together. They are ready for "Go!" Let's gather the resources
to make it happen. Timeline to live is 60-75 days from "Go!"
If the Indiegogo community doesn't get us to the full goal, we'll decide whether there is enough support to start from where we are. If there is, great! We'll go ahead, and continue fundraising as required. If there isn't enough support to justify the risk, then we'll have to reassess. But we're pretty sure the community has a real desire to give actual power to ordinary people. Do you agree?What did the founders contribute so far?


Warrick: 
"After pondering for a long time, as many of you have, I decided that if I cared enough, I should really do it. So I dedicated this part of my life to the idea that people are smart enough and dedicated enough to do what it takes to make their world better.

"During development, I’ve had a part-time job so I can eat, since I’m not rich. Snow removal. Snow
removal is surprisingly hard! It was about -22 on this night, and windy, and I wasn't a very happy fellow:

"Here's the very next night at the same site, after the snow stopped.  -20 again but not windy... so it wasn't terrible at all:"I’ve spent about 1500 hours building the Syntention demo, developing the enterprise structure, and gathering support. It’s been difficult. Friends tell me I  should write a book just about the hardships along the journey! But I'm excited to keep going. I’m driven, but not forced, and that makes a huge difference."Preethi: Communications, Platform Design, Enterprise Design. "I still have a full-time job and work on Syntention evenings and weekends. As Syntention's user-experience lead, I'm primarily responsible for what you will see when the programmers are finished." She is the beating heart of Syntention, and so excited to take the next step!Chris:  AdvisorMaureen:   AdvisorNow we’ve come to the point where our own resources aren’t enough for the next stage, so it’s up to you to lift Syntention from here.
Have a look at Syntention.comHere’s the demo platform. It
works and you can use it; all the data will be transferred to the full
platform. You will see a hundred ways the demo sucks; you will also see that the
finished product will change our world. If you get involved, you will be part
of giving people what we’ve all wanted pretty much since the beginning.We chose elephants for the logo because they're seen as benevolent giants... and when they decide where they want to go, they pretty much do. Syntention is like that..This logo will be upgraded for the real platform, but you get the idea.
Risks and challenges?
So many!
Will enough people realize that regular people everywhere
can actually decide things and make them happen?
Will people who are currently powerful try to hinder our
effort?
Will “competitors” do it better? Some large companies (you can think of them!) could do this in a second, if they wanted to. But this is an enormous change to
the way the world works, so it might be too risky for established companies.
Will we be able to let enough people know about Syntention,
quickly enough?
The answer to all these, and more, is in your decision: Will
you get involved in some way? If you will, then others will. If you and people in your network jump in, Syntention will succeed. Warrick has experience organizing people and developing enterprises. Preethi knows Communications, Enterprise Admin, and HR ... and she has boundless energy. Team Members Maureen and Chris have broad experience, wisdom, and energy. You have power. So we can overcome pretty much anything.
You can help by contributing to the funding, of course; and there are other ways to make an impact, too. Just telling your network is a big help. Let people know they can now do something real about anything that’s important to them. Or just use Syntention. When everyone sees Syntention being used, they will realize, “Oh! I get it!” And they will join in, too.After allyou're not the only onewho wants to change the world.

story:
Hi my name is Trevor and I'm launching a sweepstakes campaign for 10 lucky winners you may enter as many times as you like each entry is $1usd. The lottery will launch for 60 days in which 10  prizes of up to 50,000 dollars will be awarded depending on how many people enter will be randomly drawn. I'm doing this because I wanted to do something fun and at the end itll feel good to give 10 lucky people good news and I myself always wondered if these things were real and if anybody really won  the prize money so now I'm 100% sure there will be a winner 10 top prize winners to be exact. So if the top prize ends up being 50,000 then all 10 prizes will be 50,000 so share this page at the very least get a bunch of people in on this and lets give 10 lucky people a good chunk of money to start the new year!!! If your thinking oh well I aint gonna win i have no chance well if you don't try then youll never win so its only a dollar and what the heck give it a try you might be surprised!!

HOW TO ENTER

the way this is going to work is I'm going to set up a perk for $1 and up and its going to ask for name and shipping address in which I'm going to use to randomly draw these names so make sure you ADD THE PERK that corresponds to how much you paid EXAMPLE if you payed $5 then add the $5 dollar perk to get your 5 entries or I'm not going to know to enter you in  or how much entries you bought so  GOOD LUCK and remember its only a BUCK!!

ANNOUNCING THE WINNERS

The winners will be announced on the update page along with the prize amount right after their drawn and the winners will receive a check in the mail for the full amount  up to 4 weeks after the drawing. Why up to 4 weeks because the money will take up to 15 days to be released to me and depending on your location especially overseas it could take a while to get there. If your in the U.S it will only take up to a week after the money is released.

story:
About The Project

RedConnector is a content management system (CMS) which use Improved Site Builder options.

You are tired that you have to buy templates and plugins after a free cms installation or you have to buy a complicated drag&drop site-building  system at highest price?

You’r CMS website is slow, because the templates,plugins and drag&drop site-building systems are poorly structured?

The newest cms versions are too complicated and are slower?

If you are noticed this problems, Here is the solution!

We’d like to make a brand new CMS System, what is fast, clean and easy to use drag&drop site-building  system included by default.

To do this  we use the newest web solutions and technologies.

The CMS will be built on php, angularjs and bootstrap, While we working on the project we want to achieve the highest speed for the site.

The content creators are finally can experience the joy of creation and could easily have great freedom can design and create a web page and can save them as template.

For the developers we provide a clean, more transparent code, which allow to create nice, fast and clean templates or plugins.

In the future, you can choose from multiple license, to the experience should be personalized.

The created site are sublicensable to your costumers with some redconnector license.

The Drag & Drop site-building system is free to be turned off when not needed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every contribution—monetary or not—helps. There are other ways you can help spread the word without spending your money:

 

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about RedConnector.
  • Share this project on Twitter, Facebook, IndieGogo or on other platforms.

For continuous informations:

RedConnector on Twitter
RedConnector on Facebook

Our website

story:
Who should consider InSpark Coworking?

  • You are looking for more freedom and flexibility in your life and business.
  • You are looking to congregate, collaborate, and communicate with other business professionals.
  • You have outgrown your home-based office.
  • You want a comfortable place to work that is not a noisy coffee shop and doesn't cost thousands a month for an office space.

The InSpark Community is a coworking space for creative entrepreneurs who understand that “Isolation is the death of an entrepreneur.” You crave a space that isn’t Starbucks. In fact, it’s like nothing they have ever experienced, but once you arrive – you will know you are home. You will immediate feel the energy of the space and want to get involved. Think Field of Dreams! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need startup funds - primarily to secure the lease and furnish the space. We also need marketing materials, design help, awesome WIFI (a must) and coffee!! (also an absolute requirement!)

What you get - check out our perks to pre-buy YOUR spot!

We know people will be using this space in different ways - here are the options!

  • Drop-in passes
  • Space use - 5 days per month
  • Full time space use
  • Full time dedicated desk space

Why coworking?

There are so many reasons coworking is so popular.

People who cowork stay motivated AND make more money! They find new business partners and collaboration possibilities!

Dare I say - it's also more FUN?

We will feature local experts, regular business workshops available to the community, and monthly social events.

Risks & Challenges

    The only risk and challenge I see is NOT securing funding. (But seriously...that's not gonna happen!) If this space does NOT open as planned, ALL your monies will be refunded. 

    Short term vision

    We are opening this space March 1, 2017 at  16824 44th Ave W, Lynnwood, WA 98037.The space is 2600 square feet. We plan to expand to 4200 square feet during the summer of 2017 and will also have conference room and event space rentals available. Business hours will initially be 8 a.m. - 6 p.m. 

    The possibilities are really endless!

    And, it won't be the same without YOU!

story:
Harp & Shamrock Croft was a great addition to the [2015 Upstate Farm] Tour. Paul, Jenni, and their family’s passion for growing food for themselves and their surrounding community is contagious and truly inspiring. They are a perfect example that with thoughtful planning, the amount of food that can be grown in urban and suburban settings is astonishing.

Stephen Nix, 
Carolina Farm Stewardship Association


"The Little Farm That Could"


Harp & Shamrock Croft, LLC, (registered in the state of S.C. in good standing) is proud to unveil our inaugural IndieGoGo campaign! We are a small family farm in Upstate SC (this is a region of our State and not an actual city) with a dream of bringing local, fresh, and sustainable food to the community. We are not experts by any means as we still have a lot to learn. But the excitement grows each season we engage in farming and continue to get better each year.


First, you may be asking yourself "what is a croft?" In short, according to Webster's dictionary, a "croft" is: "a small farm worked by a tenant."

Harp & Shamrock Croft, LLC, est. 2013, is simply on a journey to realize with hard work and dedication anyone can accomplish what they set out to do. For us, our goal is to continue to expand in size and grow larger quantities of our product for the community to enjoy.

As of today, much of the expansion has been achieved by reinvesting every dollar earned back into the business from the selling of produce. The 2015 market season was a sheer joy as our products grabbed the attention of not only the market community but many local residents and shoppers in the area. What is unique about us is that we measure everything in square feet given our various growing areas, allowing us to give immediate care to each garden. By the beginning of the 2016 growing season, which is right around the corner, we will be tackling almost 10,000 square feet of actual growing space. Needless to say, we have BIG plans. But we need YOU as a partner to make this happen.


                                                 

(Take a look at our image gallery above or Facebook page for more great pictures.)

Our Needs And What You Get


We are asking for $15,000 to use for the purchase of additional supplies so that we can expand. In an effort to avoid incurring debt, we are asking you, the local and Internet community, to partner with us in our dream. Below are some of our estimated and most immediate needs:       


Our goal is to make this process simple while being able to invest these generous gifts directly into the farm business. But we do believe in giving back to those who support us. Take a look at some of the perks we will offer. We have both local and out of town benefits. The perks have been given considerable thought to what kinds of things we could give you that would be a reflection of our farm. 

Why Help


We want Harp & Shamrock Croft, LLC, to be on everyone's mind when they think "small farm," "local produce," "community-minded." We admire the larger farms in the area, but we want to work ideas like consulting, community engagement, webinars, teaching, etc. into our overall business model. To do this, we need to expand this year to create additional resources.

We believe everyone can greatly benefit from farming/gardening as a way of life, and we want to be a community resource to make it happen both onsite and offsite. This will take more resources and time, but the return benefits for the community are abundant--healthy families means healthy communities. Will you help us?

We Are Up For The Task


Farming is not easy by any means. We found this out the first year we entered market-based sales. With so many different variables that can impact even the most experienced farmers (e.g., heat, drought, wind, rain, snow, pests, disease, human error, etc.), it's a risk. Some would ask why even bother if there is so high a chance to fail. Harp & Shamrock Croft, LLC, is determined to be a success. The 2015 growing and market season was evidence of how far we have come in a very short amount of time. If anything, the title "The Little Farm That Could," given to us by the former Executive Director of the Hub City Farmers' Market (Spartanburg, SC), says a lot about who we are and what we can do. We are fortunate to have a great local farming support system where we live, outlets that know our products, and a continually growing customer base. We never shy away from reaching out to others when needed. For these reasons, we truly believe we can make our farm a success by expanding slowly each year. We have the drive, desire, and passion to see this business through. Now we just need you to partner with us.  

     

Other Ways That You Can Help


We live in an age of Social Media and real-time news. Take a look at our Social Media outlets and Website to share with your friends, families, co-workers, and the like. The more people know about us the better we will do in the long run.

                                     

Questions Or Concerns


If you have any questions regarding this campaign, please ask. We want to be transparent about our needs Contact Us.

                                   Thank you for considering our campaign!

The Callahans

We live in an age of Social Media and real-time news. Take a look at our Social Media outlets and Website to share with your friends, families, co-workers, and the like. The more people know about us the better we will do in the long run.                                      

Questions Or Concerns

If you have any questions regarding this campaign, please ask. We want to be transparent about our needs Contact Us.

                                   Thank you for considering our campaign!



The Callahans

story:
What does Verytas do?

Verytas is a browser extension that brings original source citations right into your social media news feeds.

We won’t spend much time explaining why something like this is important. We all know it is. Misinformation, fake news, and unverifiable memes permeate every social media conversation on almost every significant issue.

As you scroll, Verytas reads the stories, comments, links and images in your Twitter and Facebook feeds (with absolutely no identifying information about who you are, so your privacy is 100% protected) and inserts links into your feed the available citations. You don't even need an account to start using the Chrome Extension!

Citations will be color coded to help you prioritize.

If a link, meme, or comment can be objectively verified with reliable original source material (such as a video of a speech or a link to an academic study), it’s highlighted in green and the link to the material is inserted right into your browser for you to easily verify yourself.

If it’s verifiably false, it would be highlighted in red with the appropriate refutation links. If it’s satire, it will be highlighted in purple.

If it has elements that are both true and false, true but out of context, or otherwise contradictory, it will be highlighted in yellow and all relevant links will be shown to you so you can have as full a picture as possible.

(Sample satire article highlighted purple in a Facebook newsfeed)

Where do the citations come from?

As links, images, and comments are seen by Verytas users, they’ll be tallied (to help us prioritize by what’s being seen the most) and added to an online queue.

You or anyone can create a profile at Verytas.org to gain access to the queue, review content coming in, and add citations.

Just like Wikipedia, the crowd will help us accomplish the task of fact-checking. If you're reading this, you probably have checked a few outrageous urban legends or politicized nonsense for somebody.

All we're asking is that you help with verification. Instead of just telling your friends when something is BS, tell the whole world.

Whether or not the citations added appear in social media feeds is based on the score of a citation when it’s added.

Citations will be scored based on our algorithm which primarily factors the strength of the source being used and the history of the Verytaser. If you include a link to a domain that multiple users have approved for citations before and you’re brand new to Verytas, your citation will be shown.

But if Walter Cronkite comes back from the grave and tries to cite The Onion as proof, this citation will still not show up.

The more Verytasers that confirm a citation the stronger the citation will be weighted.

For any links or images for which there are strong citations both contradicting and supporting an assertion, we’ll default to showing both.

The algorithm and code for the extension will be open-source and available for review. Anyone can check to make sure we’re not up to any funny business collecting information we shouldn't be or spinning things due to our own biases.

At the end of the day it’s up to you to read the citations provided and decide what you believe. Verytas is here to help you scale-up your skepticism, not do your thinking for you.

If I contribute to this campaign, how will my money be used?

Any funds we raise will be used for developer time and technology that we need.

For example, we’re using an image matching service called TinEye to match memes and charts you want to Verytas with memes and charts in our database. It only costs about $0.01/search, but think about how many images just you see every day in social media -- those pennies add up!

We also need to pay for more development to move things forward and there are additional technology expenses.

All the money you give us will go right to that (we’re not getting paid from this -- we have day jobs).

Who’s behind Verytas? Your website is terrible and I can’t tell who you are. You could be aliens plotting to destroy Earth!

Our website is terrible. Development of the extension is more important right now. As we raise money to help grow our team we can worry about beauty in addition to truth.

As for who we are, right now the Verytas team has two members:

Andrei Oprisan is the co-founder who handles the engineering and all things technical at Verytas. He’s the one actually building this. His day job is at a software company in Boston.

Sam Mallikarjunan is the co-founder who handles the marketing and other business related functions (such as crowdfunding campaigns or starring in videos where he’s totally not reading from a script off screen). His day job is at that same software company in Boston.

Is there more to the future of Verytas?

There is! You can read our co-founders’ conversation with themselves in this blog article to learn the entire vision for how we want to make the Internet a better place. Click here.
I have very specific, very detailed technical questions about how Verytas will work. Who can I talk to?
Feel free to use the contact form! We've tried to be succinct here, but we're happy to explain anything you have questions about. You can also find us on Twitter or Facebook using the links below.

story:
Walk into the natural world and take a moment to stop and think. Everything that you need to live a healthy life is out here. Mother Nature provides all of the planets you could ever need to survive and thrive. Everything that we have done in this vein, for better or for worse, it is more or less unnecessary, at least on a small scale, because everything we need in order to get by grows from the ground.

At Vie Natura, we have taken this concept to heart and build a company upon it. We work with local farmers to source top-quality fruits and vegetables for our delectable, hearty smoothies. Unlike most smoothie companies, which make their product either in part or in full inside a laboratory, we work with ingredients that are completely natural, confident in our belief that customers will recognize the integrity of what we are doing and support us in the long run as a result. Our motto is this: great food requires a lot of care and attention.

What We Need & What You Get

Right now, we are turning to you,  Indiegogo, for help raising $100K. This start-up capital is going to cover the costs of our first retail location our operation via an organizational overhaul and widespread marketing campaign. As a thank-you to everyone who contributes, we are delivering some fantastic rewards, including merchandise with our logo on it and samples of the products that we will make.

 

The Impact

While there is an inherent goodness to what we are doing, we are always looking for bigger and better ways to improve the world that we inhabit. As such, we are giving our customers the option to donate 5% of every sale that we make to the charity of their choice. You can pick any  organization available in our community, let us know which one you’ve picked, and watch as their donations roll in courtesy of our business relationship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond making a monetary contribution, you can help us by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platforms you may use. The more people know what we are doing, the better off we will be. We want people far and wide to hear all about the superior juices and smoothies that are being sold under the Vie Natura banner.

All support is appreciated. Thank you for your time.

https://www.facebook.com/vienaturajuicebar/

story:
Pawsitivity in the city of Knoxville

Hello to each and everyone of you who have found this page! To begin with introductions, we are four undergraduate students at the University of Knoxville all enrolled in the same English class that gave us the project and goal of raising $1,000 for a local nonprofit. Us four, Julien, Bailey, Katelyn, and Katy, all chose our local non-profit, the Young-Williams Animal Center, out of a handful of others because we care too much about animals.

They're a huge part of our lives, with them being family who welcome us home with kisses upon kisses after a semester away here in Knoxville. And it's not just the four of us who have animals to welcome us home; it's everyone who has ever had a pet. The man who works is welcomed home by his golden retriever, by being tackled by the weight of his dog, and the woman who works is greeted by the excited "meows" of a kitty cat who missed her dearly. With that we all found in the YWAC, is that they give you those animals who will love you unconditionally for the rest of their lives, but they need the community's help. They need, mostly, a new x-ray machine, and obviously supplies such as food. No one benefits from animals more than people, and the four of us feel like we need to help them get what the YWAC, a temporary home, needs so they can find those forever homes.

The Young-William's Animal Center has a Vision and a Mission on their website which state:

  • Vision: A healthy community through compassionate care of animals.
  • Mission: To serve the community though innovative approaches to sheltering, adopting, the spaying/neutering of animals and public education about animal welfare.

The four of us, just undergraduate students at UTK, want to help the Young-Williams Animal Center achieve their vision and mission, and we plan to this semester and hopefully afterwards into the later years of our college lives. And for that to happen, we need you, the most important part of our efforts.

What We Need & What You Get

The breakdown you need to know:

Our total is $1,000 for a new x-ray machine that the YWAC needs for the animals that are under their care before finding new homes by the loving families and people in the Knoxville area, and while those cost more than just $1,000, every little bit counts for them to properly take care of those lovable animals.

Perks! Who doesn't love stuff? And more importantly, who doesn't love animal themed stuff?! We have come up with some small mentions or gifts for donations that YOU contribute! See those below!

  • With ANY AMOUNT DONATED, from the smallest to the largest: You guys get a shout out on our blog here 
  • With $15: You get a hand written note from all of us thanking you!
    • The note can have the picture of a cat or dog for an increase of $5! YOUR CHOICE!
  • With $35: You get a special gift bag, consisting of secret animal themed goodies
  • With $45: You get a DIY-made mug by us and this does include the orange paw print being painted as well!

 

  • And with a $5 increase with that, a total of $50, you get our full group name of Pawsitivity and not just the "Paws". 

Whether we get under, exactly, or over the $1,000 dollars, each penny is still going to the Young-Williams Animal Center

The Impact That YOU'RE Making

You might live in Tennessee, you might not, but sharing, donating, speaking about it, seeing this page and what it means, is more help than most anyone would make for most things. Almost everyone has interacted with animals in some way, and sometimes it's negative, but a lot of times there's a bond made, a positive bond that is something you'll never feel with a person. Animals give you unconditional love; they love with all they have because you're all they do have. Helping   animals helps people because those animals they get will be healthy and happy and ready for belly scratches during the day and snores at night that are right in your ear.

Risks & Challenges

All this money does go to the Young-William's Animal Center for their x-ray machine, no matter how much is raised. For them, they have to raise a total of $23,000 dollars, and we're only contributing to $1,000 of that. However, they have reached roughly to $10,000, which is wonderful. It's a challenge for us to help the successfully, and it's a challenge for you to decide to help them or not.

But we went to Mardi Growl, which is an event the YWAC has put on for the last ten years, and we wrote about it in the first part of our most recent blog post here, and from our experience with them, they fully believe in their cause to help the animals in their care, educate their community in which they reside, and help with innovations when it comes to sheltering.

Other Ways You Can Help

While you may not be able to donate yourself, others might. Share the page on social media, talk about it to friends and families and pull the page up on your phone even. 

And if it's not us, help other shelters and centers around your area. There are more than just the YWAC that need your help.

 All of us here who are "Pawsitivity", Julien, Bailey, Katelyn, and Katy, would love to thank each and every one of you for taking the time to read this and consider your effort into our cause here in Knoxville!

Keep those Paws up!

story:
Your room in the capital of Portugal

Many years ago we fell in love with Lisbon. Its architecture, light, beach, people, food: each and all exquisite. After months of house-visits and endless talks with banks today we have bought an 18th century apartment that we would like to share with you.

A renowned 19th century Portuguese actor lived on our street with his name: Rua de Augusto Rosa. On that street there is a pink house where a lady was living for 70 years. Walking through that door was like travelling back in time. Original tiles (the famous azulejos), wooden floors and doors, a bath on feet, and furniture from the start of century till the seventies. This incredible Pombaline apartment has kept the original structure. And we were able to buy it with ALL the furniture!

Now YOU can help restoring this beauty in the heart of old Lisbon, Alfama. We will dig in history and make sure that the best comes out for you to enjoy afterwards. The 120m2 terrace will help in making you feel comfortable.

Pictures

We have booked another trip to pick up the keys on September 21. Till then we can only show you the pictures we took at our visits when wanting to buy the apartment. Better ones will follow later.

What We Need 

We need you for the renovation : electricity, add a toilet, paint, new windows, appliances and nurture the wooden floor. This will all be ready for 2017 !

It will cost 40000€ of which we still need 10000€. We will make sure to get the best local craftsman,  buy from local dealers in the city, and work in the most ecological and sustainable way possible.

What You Get

You will get a fabulous stay in an incredible city near the most beautiful cathedral (Sé) and viewpoint (Miradouro Santa Luzia). A truly authentic, back-in-time experience where you will know what Lisboa people live like. We will make sure you get a famous "Pasteis de Nata" on top ! (delicious pastry)

The Impact

You can make a difference to this city (and to our lives for that matter). Too many apartments are emptied or only façades are kept so the charm of the old Lisbon is often unnecessarily replaced with new. Now is your time to save a piece of history and stay in it !

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenges are over. Buying an apartment in a foreign country was quite an adventure. Banks, lawyers, agencies, ... We have been through giant steps to purchase the apartment. Of course the challenge remains to make it a true home yet with help of locals and Portuguese friends in Belgium, it is possible to go to the next step.

In Belgium we have been renting out properties for over 20 years and over time we restored over 10 apartments. From a manor house to an art deco gem to a seventies tower flat to an industrial loft: we investigate a lot to make sure the restoration respects the origins and values authenticity.

Even if we don't reach 10000€ we will restore a maximum and it will only take slightly more time to get to the full result.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can't contribute financially ? Maybe there is other ways you can help ? We are open to exchanges ! 

In any case : you can share this so that your friends are aware of a new home to be !

Events

16/08/2016: campaign launched
18/08/2016: we made a logo "Casa Augusto Rosa"
19/08/2016: we set up our domainname www.casaaugustorosa.com and our @casaaugustorosa Facebook page
04/09/2016: we found 1 person to do small works and 1 person to follow up with Portuguese companies
06/09/2016: we reached 2000€ on our crowdfunding

Future Events

10/09/2016: first furniture is moved from Brussels to Lisboa
21/09/2016: we get the keys and will start meeting people for the works

story:
Our Story

What started many years ago as simple and passing thought - "Wouldn't it be fun to operate a coffee shop?" - has taken shape as the opportunity presented itself to open a unique experience in the Dacula area.

TradeWind Coffee Co. is a new coffee house to serve Dacula and the surrounding community. We seek to provide a place for the community to gather for meet-ups with friends, business meetings, church groups or student activities.

No stranger to entrepreneurship, owner Christian Jolly has built a successful video production company over the past 13 years and now seeks to leverage that business experience by building Dacula's first complete-service coffee house.

Some of the featured services and amenities will include:

  • Beverages - Selection of coffees, tea varieties and blended fruit and chilled frappe beverages.
  • Variety of Brewing Methods - Espresso, pour over, drip, French press, siphon, cold brew, Aeropress and more!
  • Premium Coffee Beans - Varieties include single origin, organic, fair trade and select blends - all provided by our local roasters.
  • Food - Breakfast, lunch & dinner menus designed around high-quality ingredients and quick service options.
  • Private Room - Available by the hour for small/medium groups or off-site business meetings.
  • Children's Area - separate room for young children to play while parents enjoy the cafe
  • Large Outdoor Patio - open-air accomodations for general dining and special outdoor events
  • Educational Events - Learn innovative methods and techniques for at-home brewing.
  • Live Music - Regional musicians performing regularly in-house
  • Retail Merchandise - Whole bean coffees - including those brewed in our shop - will be available for purchase by-the-pound, along with a selection of brewing equipment and tools, loose leaf and bag tea varieties, take home food items and quality promotional merchandise (mugs, bottles, t-shirts and more).

 

What We Need (Funding!) & What You Get (Perks!)

While we are using our own resources and traditional funding methods to help build the shop, we still need your help to accomplish all our goals and pave a clear path for this endeavor. Why would you support us? A few possible reasons:

  1. You live in/near the area and want to help bring a real coffee shop to life for your own enjoyment.
  2. You really love supporting small businesses and are just happy to be part of it!
  3. You think our perks are pretty cool and you love getting something awesome while supporting something awesome.
  4. ALL OF THE ABOVE!

Perks? We got 'em! Check out the different ways you can support our efforts while receiving something to tide you over until the shop is completely open to the public. All perk details are listed in the specific support levels.

Interested in more than one perk? If you'd like to take advantage of multiple perks (either for yourself, or as gifts for others), you'll need to check out a separate time for each perk.

Want to avoid shipping? Shipping is required on all physical goods orders except when a special event is included in the perk. However, if you want to wait and pick up your items, we can refund your shipping and you can get them when the shop opens.

*** Design previews are subject to change for physical perks ***

 

The Impact

As previously mentioned, this concept is something the area has not previously enjoyed. While there are a number of places to grab a quick cup of joe, there's never been anything as accommodating and extensive as the offering proposed by TradeWind Coffee Co.

In addition to the customer experience, the community will benefit from employment opportunities - full time and part time positions for experienced employees as well as high school and college students. Regionally, businesses will benefit from our sourcing of food and beverage ingredients from local suppliers, further enhancing the number of dollars retained in the area and aiding in the freshness of our prepared items. Lastly, the presence of a high-end coffee shop in the neighborhood adds value of living in this community, which becomes attractive for new families and helps maintain and boost property values for all residents.

 

Risks & Challenges

Part of the reason we are seeking additional funding through Indiegogo is to hedge our cash flow over the start-up period, providing a better opportunity to compete in the market for many years. The byproduct is that we are also able to remain innovative and responsive to customer preferences by leveraging additional cash flow into new service areas.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute financially, but you can still help!

  • Share our campaign! Even if you aren't able to help fund our shop, you probably know some people who would love to get involved.
  • Connect with us! Our Facebook and Instagram accounts are the best way to stay in touch with all the news and happenings around TradeWind Coffee Co. Be sure to share us with your friends on social!
  • Come in at opening! Once we're open, we invite you to come check out the shop and share your positive experiences with others.

Questions?

Feel free to contact us if you have any questions that aren't answered here (information on the build-out, menu questions or requests, information about working at TradeWind Coffee Co., financial questions, etc)

story:
Short Summary

RenFitness, LLC has become an integral part of the ultimate community in Seattle over the past three years. We are a strength and conditioning team that love the sport of ultimate and the people that make up this great community!

In January of 2017, the very first RenFitness Gym will open in the Ballard neighborhood in Seattle!! Having our own space will allow us to expand our programming for the ultimate community while also creating the first indoor space devoted to the sport. But we need your support in order to make it happen! The gym will hold exciting physical features, including the only indoor turf in the country dedicated to ultimate. The facility will be equipped to support both individual and team strength and conditioning training sessions. RenFitness professionals will be available whenever the gym is open to help you maximize your training. It will also be a gathering place for the community. Ultimate players will use the gym to come together to watch game film, for social gatherings, and community organizing.

The gym is conveniently located on major bus lines that run along 15th Ave NW and NW Market St, including the D-line and the 44. We’re also just a short pedal away from the Burke Gilman Trail.

Physical Features:

  • 3000SF of indoor turf
  • Functional training equipment (kettlebells, squat racks, foam rollers, the works)
  • 2 gender-neutral restrooms and a shower
  • Community space with couches/TV and tables/chairs
  • Huge parking lot (37 spaces) and lots of street parking

Program Offerings:

  • Courses from KB Circuit to RenFit to yoga
  • Team programming and clinics
  • Workshops and seminars for coaches and players
  • Weekly turf and social events (mini league, goaltimate, movie nights)
  • Field space and facility rental
  • Expanded RenFitness internship and coaches program
  • Virtual Gym subscriptions for those outside Seattle

Here’s a sketch of what our schedule could look like!

Don’t live in Seattle? We’re planning on offering a Virtual Gym subscription to share our programming and seminars with you! With enough funding, we’ll be able to offer this as early as June of 2017!

Our vision is ambitious, but with your help, we can create something great!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We’re asking for $30,000 to get the gym started! This will pay for:

  • 34x70 feet of indoor turf (enough for 3 Seattle-sized mini games or one goalty game!) and surrounding netting
  • Functional training equipment, rubber flooring, power racks, barbells and weights, kettlebells, dumbbells, weight benches, cardio machines
  • Community space furniture, refrigerator, sink, TV

If we don’t reach this goal, the money will still go towards these features we plan to offer - it just might take more time to roll them all out! With additional funding, we can afford:

  • “The Big Wall” projector for live ultimate screenings, movie nights, and reactive film-based training
  • Virtual gym access available by June 2017
  • A mobile gym to bring RenFitness to other areas of Seattle, especially lower-resourced communities
  • Offices for wellness professionals, with physical therapist and massage therapy services, beginning January 2018
  • Two more power racks for team training
  • Cardio equipment upgrades to self-powered treadmills

We’d love to show our appreciation for your help by offering you the following perks. Check out the sidebar for the different combos we’re offering! Make sure you select your desired perk package when you donate. All our gear comes from AGW.

  • Limited Edition Strive and Uplift Headband
  • Limited Edition FLEX Hat
  • Limited Edition Strive and Uplift Tank
  • Name on the Wall of Awesome
  • Two-Hour Event Space Rental

Are you interested in becoming an investor in the RenFitness gym project? We're looking for a couple more people to be involved at the 10K-20K level - please contact Ren at renultimate@gmail.com for more details!

 

The Impact

As long-standing members of the ultimate community in Seattle, we are ready to create a space designed specifically for this wonderful population. With your help, we can bring this dream to life! When we open our doors in January we want to be ready to train individuals and teams, provide community events, and offer indoor turf activities.

 

Risks & Challenges

We’ve signed the lease, so the ball is already rolling! This crowdfunding campaign will enable us to deliver the complete package we’ve described here.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re unable to contribute to the campaign at this time, but you want to help us out, here’s how!

Share this campaign with everyone you know! You can start online by using the Indiegogo sharing tools up at the top of the page. Talk about the gym with other ultimate players on the sideline of your next game, pickup, or team party. Let’s generate excitement about this new community asset!

If you have some skills, talents, goods, or time you want to share, please fill out this form.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I am Jim Richards, founder and CEO of mediadogg Software LLC. Since from a young age, I have had an intense interest in science, electronics and video / audio media. This has led me to careers in computing and education, with travels to a number of countries, thereby appreciating a wide range of cultural variations in music, art, language and cuisine.

Solar energy has been my hobby focus for the past few years. I wanted to find more ways to participate in efficient solar use without breaking the bank. Most of us can’t afford the large expense of installing solar panels. So I thought about “small” and “portable” as themes for solar exploitation and even monetary savings.

I then experimented with circuits that would safely capture energy from batteries that were about to be discarded, and developed a battery selection methodology (Smartsort™). I also experimented with the use of portable folding solar panels and rechargeable batteries. By collaborating with Shenzhen Digiway Electronics CO., LTD in China, I have stocked the first perks for this campaign, and have begun to design the future products. I intend to use the funding from this campaign to finance this continued development, as well as replenish some of my initial investment.

If you decide to help me, you will get some fun, easy to use products, as perks, that allow you to tap the power of the sun, reduce the impact of discarded batteries on our landfills and actually SAVE MONEY by incrementally adding to your savings – much like with a piggy bank - that eventually will more than pay for your initial purchase of the perks.

What We Need & What You Get

So far, we have spent nearly $4,500 in the design, development and production of a small inventory of eTopper™ products that we are using as Perks that are in-stock, and available now. So it is possible for you to get immediate value from your investment if that is your desire.

Of on the other hand, you are willing to place your trust in us, you may purchase the Perks that will not be available until sometime in 2017 – some perhaps as early as 1Q2017. These additional funds will be used to start immediately with the testing of prototypes and preparing for production of the 2017 Perks, as well as paying for some necessary business elements such as official UPC codes and insurance so that we can participate in wider markets. If sales are brisk enough, we are likely to also need to hire help for fulfillment and shipping.

The Impact

We have worked hard to develop products that are both effective and inexpensive. This means that there is a better chance that your investments, in addition to being earth-friendly, can actually save you money in a reasonable amount of time, say 1- 2 years. This is exciting. Many of us want to make an impact, but cannot do so, due to the high cost of implementing a solution. A good example of this is “off-grid” solar installations, that can cost up to $20,000. So we have developed a low-cost, high impact strategy for people who want to be earth-friendly and save money at the same time!

The primary component of our strategy is using rechargeable batteries to replace disposable batteries in the wide array of electronics devices, toys and gadgets that most of own, is entirely within reach of most of use financially, because we implement the strategy bit by bit. Today’s rechargeable batteries are much more powerful, efficient and cost effective than they were just few years ago.

The second component of this strategy is coupling the capture of solar energy with the use of rechargeable batteries. Portable folding solar panels are very affordable, and have enough power to charge a set of rechargeable batteries in a few hours. The planned eTopper™ set of products augment compliments this strategy by providing various adapters and tools to make it easier to adapt various solar panel designs and battery charging platforms. Furthermore, we plan to make available powerful, easy to use USB power banks that are populated with replaceable batteries instead of permanently embedded Li-ion batteries.

A third, but important aspect of our strategy is providing an effective way of using all the energy available in disposable batteries. Most batteries are discard with significant energy remaining. Extracting this energy is tricky and can lead to battery overheating and leakage. We have created a design that solves this problem, and will be bringing a product to market in 2017.

Risks & Challenges

As with any business endeavor, there are real risks that we will not achieve our goals. The competitive technological environment and the rapid changes in the costs and capabilities of specific technologies can dramatically change business assumptions. We will do everything humanly possible to meet our obligations under the terms of this campaign, but at the end of the day – we are only human, and thereby subject to many things beyond our control. We will do our best.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot or choose not to fund us by selecting a Perk, there are other ways you can help. Please tell anyone you know: friends, family or business associates that might be interested in our work, about this campaign. Posting on social media would be very helpful.

Of course, if you have any suggestions or comments on anything you see here, please post them, and we will try our best to be respectful and responsive to your concerns.

Just for reading this far, we have created a special discount code for 15% off the Amazon.com prices for eTopper™ products. Just search for “eTopper,” select the product you want and go from there. There are several options. At checkout, you can apply the promotion code O9VC2AKU for 15% off. Note also that USA shipping is free, and holiday gift wrapping is available for a small extra charge. This discount cannot be applied in conjunction with other discounts or Perks. Thanks for your support.

story:
Why Town Square?

Wikipedia* describes a town square as "an open public space commonly found in the heart of a traditional town used for community gatherings."

Our desire is to reach out to people and give them a  life-changing experience. When our customers become our friends and family, we've formed community.

The decision to create this eatery and brewery has come out of a creative desire to impact the community through the passions we can share with like-minded individuals. We want to build a sustainable place that can pour financial support back into the community through utilizing local suppliers and supporting local charities. 

Town Square will be a place that will offer an environment where the only distractions will be the new items on the menu and the chatter of fulfilling conversations. You will not find large televisions, loud music or noisy broadcasts. We are offering an opportunity to disconnect so that you can re-connect with some of the more important things in life; friends, family, the arts and the passing of time. 

*https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Town_square

Who are we?

Town Square consists of three young families that share a passion for local food, drink and building the communities we belong to. 

Brandon and Megan Boutin

Brandon is the driving force and visionary behind Town Square. His excitement and passion for community and craft beer is what drove Town Square from dream to reality. Megan is Brandon's endless support and, when necessary, voice of reason. They have two beautiful young girls that help keep them both focused on creating an environment that a family can be part of.

  

Tyler and Katrina McNaughton                           

Tyler's design and tech experience has brought Town Square to life through floor space and web designs. Katrina's fun, magnetic personality keeps us all going and smiling. Tyler and Katrina have one sweet young son with another expected (Boy or Girl?) to join us around the same time as we open the doors of Town Square. 

Sterling and Mellissa Nordin                               

Born and raised in a small town south-east of Edmonton, Sterling and Mellissa have a deep understanding of what can be accomplished through community. High School sweethearts, they now have three awesome kids who keep them busy!

You

It is you that will make Town Square what we desire. We want to give you the opportunity to join us in creating this beautiful space. As contributors you will get some awesome perks and you will be able to say you helped in creating Town Square Brewing Co. - A place you can call your own. 

What We Need & What You Get                        

Yay! You're still reading. We'll take that as a good sign. The big questions you may be asking now is, "How much?" And possibly, "What do I get out of it?"

Well, we will try to make this as straightforward as possible. We have raised enough capital to create the brewery and lease a space to host you; that would be, mmm... so-so. Our ask is that you help us raise an additional $30,000 to build a place that you can call your own, a place you would be excited to share with friends and family, a place that inspires, a place for community.

Just a few of the major purchases we are currently planning on putting your hard-earned money towards are: 

  • Unique features, products & accents that will have you and your friends asking "did you see that?"
  • A growler filler bar that has a Co2 purge that will keep your beer fresh to enjoy later.
  • Leather seating. Nothing says this is home like when you can find your very own butt groove in a leather seat.
  • Fireplace. C'mon, we live in Alberta... am I right? 

Why Indiegogo and not the other guys?

This was a simple decision. Other crowdfunding platforms offer only an all-or-nothing option, which is ideal for a startup that will require the goal to be met in order to get off the ground.  As mentioned above, Town Square is moving forward if we raise $1 or $1 million (Stretch...stretch...stretch goal!). What we are asking is: Will you join us in creating a community like no other?  And for your hard work in helping us, we want to reward you with some super cool perks!  

You will find our perks to the right of our blabber, but we want to highlight some unique ones that we feel are the best:

  • Our Community Gallery Wall - We want you!  We want to showcase you, our amazing community of supporters.  But we don't want just any photo.  Requirements consist of: Grade school  photos (awesome haircut and all), your awkward family photos (70's,80's,90's - they're all good!), Cute pet photos, and silly face selfies!
  • Become a canning member - We are planning to can limited batches of our beer on a quarterly bases. You will be among the first to get your hands on these. 
  • Community Member - Get an exclusive invite to come and join us once a month to taste our new beers prior to being released to the community.
  • You Brew - Work with the brew master to make a seasonal brew that you will be able to share with up to 10 friends at your own VIP private party. Not forgetting, of course, to boast about your own blood, sweat, and tears that went into it.
  • Shave the Beard - This is Brandon's mom's favorite. You get the honours in taking a razor to Brandon's beard. If that is not enough, you get a canning & private membership with the VIP package + ceramic growler. Oh, wait, and we will also be donating half of this perk to the charity of your choice.

*one other note, AGLC rules prohibit other liquor licensees from directly contributing to this campaign.*

The Impact

We might not be changing the world with this one campaign but we are inviting you to join us on making a change in and through our community. We strongly believe that if we can bring a community together with like-minded individuals, a difference will be made. 

Risks & Challenges

Every adventure has risks and challenges. These challenges can be overcome by the community we build. For this campaign, our biggest risk is that we don't inspire you enough to join us on making our venture something beyond what we could have imagined or anticipated. 

Tell Your Friends

This goal will not be met by just you... unless you're super eager to grab all of those sweet perks! To help our campaign be truly successful, we ask that you share our vision with others, inspiring them to get behind what we are doing and become a part of an amazing community right at the grassroots.

  • Share on Facebook
  • Share on Instagram
  • Tweet like you have never tweeted before
  • Send letters... do people still do that?
  • Go outside and scream it from the rooftops!

Again this is only possible through you and by you. We are only the dreamers and you are the ones that will make this place truly amazing. 

Follow us
Facebook
Twitter
Instagram

Thank you for backing us! We look forward to partnering with you to brew change in our Community!
story_txt:
Why Town Square?
Wikipedia* describes a town square as "an open public space commonly found in the heart of a traditional town used for community gatherings."

Our desire is to reach out to people and give them a  life-changing experience. When our customers become our friends and family, we've formed community.
The decision to create this eatery and brewery has come out of a creative desire to impact the community through the passions we can share with like-minded individuals. We want to build a sustainable place that can pour financial support back into the community through utilizing local suppliers and supporting local charities. 

Town Square will be a place that will offer an environment where the only distractions will be the new items on the menu and the chatter of fulfilling conversations. You will not find large televisions, loud music or noisy broadcasts. We are offering an opportunity to disconnect so that you can re-connect with some of the more important things in life; friends, family, the arts and the passing of time. 
*https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Town_square
Who are we?
Town Square consists of three young families that share a passion for local food, drink and building the communities we belong to. 
Brandon and Megan Boutin
Brandon is the driving force and visionary behind Town Square. His excitement and passion for community and craft beer is what drove Town Square from dream to reality. Megan is Brandon's endless support and, when necessary, voice of reason. They have two beautiful young girls that help keep them both focused on creating an environment that a family can be part of.
  
Tyler and Katrina McNaughton                           
Tyler's design and tech experience has brought Town Square to life through floor space and web designs. Katrina's fun, magnetic personality keeps us all going and smiling. Tyler and Katrina have one sweet young son with another expected (Boy or Girl?) to join us around the same time as we open the doors of Town Square. 
Sterling and Mellissa Nordin                               
Born and raised in a small town south-east of Edmonton, Sterling and Mellissa have a deep understanding of what can be accomplished through community. High School sweethearts, they now have three awesome kids who keep them busy!
You
It is you that will make Town Square what we desire. We want to give you the opportunity to join us in creating this beautiful space. As contributors you will get some awesome perks and you will be able to say you helped in creating Town Square Brewing Co. - A place you can call your own. 

What We Need & What You Get                        

Yay! You're still reading. We'll take that as a good sign. The big questions you may be asking now is, "How much?" And possibly, "What do I get out of it?"
Well, we will try to make this as straightforward as possible. We have raised enough capital to create the brewery and lease a space to host you; that would be, mmm... so-so. Our ask is that you help us raise an additional $30,000 to build a place that you can call your own, a place you would be excited to share with friends and family, a place that inspires, a place for community.

Just a few of the major purchases we are currently planning on putting your hard-earned money towards are: 

Unique features, products & accents that will have you and your friends asking "did you see that?"
A growler filler bar that has a Co2 purge that will keep your beer fresh to enjoy later.
Leather seating. Nothing says this is home like when you can find your very own butt groove in a leather seat.
Fireplace. C'mon, we live in Alberta... am I right? 


Why Indiegogo and not the other guys?
This was a simple decision. Other crowdfunding platforms offer only an all-or-nothing option, which is ideal for a startup that will require the goal to be met in order to get off the ground.  As mentioned above, Town Square is moving forward if we raise $1 or $1 million (Stretch...stretch...stretch goal!). What we are asking is: Will you join us in creating a community like no other?  And for your hard work in helping us, we want to reward you with some super cool perks!  
You will find our perks to the right of our blabber, but we want to highlight some unique ones that we feel are the best:


Our Community Gallery Wall - We want you!  We want to showcase you, our amazing community of supporters.  But we don't want just any photo.  Requirements consist of: Grade school  photos (awesome haircut and all), your awkward family photos (70's,80's,90's - they're all good!), Cute pet photos, and silly face selfies!

Shave the Beard - This is Brandon's mom's favorite. You get the honours in taking a razor to Brandon's beard. If that is not enough, you get a canning & private membership with the VIP package + ceramic growler. Oh, wait, and we will also be donating half of this perk to the charity of your choice.
