story:
OUR STORY

We are opening a new café-bar-restaurant-venue on Lerwick’s Commercial Street. The two level building has operated as a café for the best part of 20 years, and we intend to give it a new look and operating ethos that is distinctive from other outlets currently available in Lerwick.

Our food menus will place a strong emphasis on local produce including fresh seafood and a good choice of vegetarian and vegan options. Akshay Borges of Borges Seafood, who was a chef at the award-winning Scalloway Hotel for several years, will be in charge of the kitchen. He will be joined by Matthew Adam, who has many years of kitchen experience, most recently at the popular Peerie Shop café. 

Our bar will offer a wide range of craft beers, fine wines and spirits, and will be run by Magnus Stout, who has many years’ experience in Glasgow pubs and was duty manager in the café-bar at Mareel. 

Akshay, Matthew and Magnus can all draw on good working relationships with a range of local wholesalers and suppliers, while we are also looking to establish new tie-ins with craft brewers and artisan coffee suppliers to raise the standard of refreshments available. 

The second floor of the café-bar will be used to host a programme of cultural events including regular live music in the form of informal sessions and small-scale concerts featuring local and visiting artists. This will be programmed by Neil Riddell, who has established a strong reputation as a promoter of roots music in the islands through the non-profit Ragged Wood community group. 

The upstairs area will be available for private hire and will also be used to stage special food sittings throughout the calendar, including taster menus based on the bountiful qualities of fresh seafood available locally.  

We want The String to be a family-friendly venue where people can feel at home enjoying lunch or a pastry and a cup of coffee in the daytime, and a relaxed drink or dinner in the evenings. We will be seeking to capitalise on the growing number of cruise ship passengers and other tourists visiting the islands in the summer months, but also want to establish the venue as a social gathering place for Shetland’s thriving creative community. 

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

We have agreed to lease our premises, at 88 Commercial Street in the heart of Lerwick town centre, from the building’s lovely and super-helpful owners Ian and Janet Davidge. Although the premises have functioned as a café/bar for many years, a considerable amount of work is required to get it into shape. 

We are fitting a brand-new kitchen for Akshay and his team to cook in, as well as revamping the basement into a storage and food prep area. We are relocating the downstairs bar and installing a new upstairs bar, as well as revamping the upstairs venue area to make it more suitable for live music and other events.

This will require quite a major financial outlay on kitchen equipment including:

  • an extraction hood, cooker, oven, refrigerators and other appliances;
  • a cooling system for draught beer taps, and a new state-of-the-art coffee machine;
  • new flooring, lighting, furniture;
  • a small PA system
  • wages for tradespeople to carry out much of the work.

We believe that the four of us involved in this independent new venture have a strong track record in food, drinks and events promotion, and we hope that people will show faith in our ability to deliver a fresh, high quality café/bar that is strongly rooted in Shetland’s heritage, particularly its seafood and music. 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you don't have any money to give, but would like to support this project:

  • We are looking for volunteers to help with painting and other DIY tasks at the cafe-bar in the next few weeks;
  • You can help us by spreading the word about this campaign on social media, and by telling your friends and family about the idea.

Dandelion Market is the only community-owned natural food store in the Roaring Fork Valley. We strive to support local businesses and local agriculture whenever possible. We are committed to serving our customers and members by providing healthy, organic, and sustainable food and products and encouraging informed choices.

Dandelion Market is in need of funding to replenish your 50 favorite items. Your contribution will enable us to keep Dandelion Market's doors open and honor our financial commitments to our local vendors who have supported us through rocky times.

We are asking for $10,000 in funding. These generous contributions will be used to replenish your 50 favorite Dandelion Market items, and help us restore the Dandelion Market to its vibrant self with fresh produce, fresh farm eggs, whole milk, kombucha on tap, and your favorite specialty items!

Dandelion Market is more than just a local market. It is a place for people to connect, share and support what they believe in, and a home for farmer's to sell their produce everyday.

After 9 years of inhabiting our Main Street Home, we have been informed that we need to find a new place of residence by June 30th. The search is on, we have some hopeful places to land and recognize that the move out of our current space may lead us to downsize or take on a different form. We are in the process of crafting a strategic plan. We have many ideas for how Dandelion Market can best serve our Carbondale community and beyond including:

  • A food hub that offers an on-line farmer's market
  • A commercial kitchen that is accessible to our local community
  • A butcher shop that supports a local rancher who's operation is the prefect size for our needs
  • Other community needs and desires

Your contribution will help us make the first step towards our future vision. 

For those of you that don’t have a penny to spare, we'd greatly appreciate your help volunteering at the co-op. Please let us know how you might be able to lend a hand and we will gladly find tasks that match up with your skill set.

Please share this with other folks that also value supporting local food, local farmers. and community-owned co-operatives.

The Dandelion Market’s continued existence is now in all of our hands. It’s going to take a united effort to guide it towards it’s true potential.

story:
My name is Pixie Fyre and I live in Portland, Oregon. We were voted the Kinkiest City in America and I have a dream of opening a Cafe for Kinky people!


WHO ARE WE?:

The House of Fyre is a Leather House in Portland, Oregon. We are opening the cafe as a F/family. Each of our family members bring a very unique set of skills to this project, and together, we plan to bring something incredible to the Pacific NW communities

  • Pixie Fyre:  Owner and Concept Creator

  •  - has been in the Business Administration and Management field since age 16. Having started with small-town computer companies, she has worked for AV rated law firms and Fortune 500 companies in a variety of states. She has worked in the Portland area as a Professional Domme, Advocate and Educator for 4 years. During that time, she has successfully created the monthly Fetish Night events that have become one of Portland's most well-know kink events and fascilatated the growth of several of Portland's most talented vendors. She regularly teaches workshops for organizations and conferences incuding Portland Leather Alliance, PDX League of Gentleman, KinkFest and the BDSM Writer's Convention. She is active in the community and takes a great deal of pride in her community leadership and advocacy.: 

  • Angel Fyre: Cafe Manager

  •  - grew up in Portland and has been working in its food industry for 20 years. Her most recent role as Restaurant Manager allowed her to develop a variety of contacts, skills and experience while helping to build MoonFyre's concept, menu, and food service standards. Her personal experience as a trans woman, couple with her M/s dynamic with Pixie adds an especially unique dynamic to the skills they plan to teach in the cafe's Internship Training Program for service based, high protocol environments.

  • Imber Fyre: Construction Management 

  • -has a Bachelor's Degree in Construction Management and after completing his college internship here in Portland, he fell in love with the area and moved here from North Dakota. He has worked in the Portland construction community for 4 years, but has been working in construction since his teenage years. He is very excited to oversee and manage the build out component of the cafe as well as the ongoing improvements planned.

WHY DO WE WANT IT?:

A community space like our cafe would be the center of an amazing leather, kink and LGBTQ community. Portland has lost many spaces this year, and we want to offer a permanent location for our community to rally its resources. We want a home of our own to provide some of the following services:

  • Safe space for meeting and negotiating with prospective partners where staff can assist in safety, vetting and even negotiation processes. 
  • Workshops every weekend on a variety of topics taught by instructors from all over the country, and hopefully, the world.
  • Dining space to sustain a multitude of community munches.
  • Retail area to allow local vendors to feature their hand-crafted items and support them with sales.
  • Creative collaboration space to allow kink-friendly businesses to showcase their services while having a safe space to operate (i.e. massage, mental health services, artists, etc.).
  • Internships for job training, protocol training, service experience and education.
  • High Protocol Food Service events and training for servers. Assistance with Food Handlers Permit testing and job opportunities for LGBTQ and Leather community members. 
  • Safe space to be kinky, eat, drink and be merry!! 

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest challenges we face with this project is the need to spread the word. We have found a fantastic space that we will be able to open our doors without ANY limitations about who we are and what we do, but we have limited time to raise the remaining money needed to secure the space before our time runs out on the opportunity. Our owner has been hosting Fetish Night events and workshops for two years to save the funds that have gotten us part of the way, so now, we reach out to share our plans with the community and ask for your support!

Portland's recent loss of kink-friendly spaces has brought to light the need to be completely legally licensed and insured in order to prevent the same from happening. The legal fees for appropriate licensing, insurance and building the space to code means the start of a TRULY safe space. With a solid business plan and the goal to start the business without the limitations of bank loans and credit card debt, the cafe is without our reach. 

We have legal support. We have construction support. Now our investors, want to see the support and help of our communities! 


HELP NEEDED:

What do we need?:

  • The space needs to be found! DONE!!
  • All the legal logistics need to be done, filed and readied! DONE!!
  • We need to purchase display fixtures for the retail space! DONE!!
  • We need to print posters and postcards for our local area! DONE!!
  • The tables and chairs are ready to be made, we just have to make the final payment!
  • We need to have the restaurant equipment installed!
  • The Pet Play Area needs kennels and heavy duty padded mats!
  • The Hard Points need track rigging and we want a lot of them! We have been offered professional installation once the hardware is purchased! 
  • We need to finish raising the last of the funds needed to pay off the build out! 


"I'm not donating a lot... how else can I help?"

We understand that times are tough! Even a five dollar donation can help! Other ways you can add value to your donation:

  • Share share SHARE this campaign!! Share the link, tell your friends and get the word out there! 
  • Carry cards with the cafe information on it and pass it out to friends and places you visit that you know are kink-friendly!
  • Donate your time and energy! We always have a need for people to share their talents. Do you do art? Let us know! Do you do marketing? Let us know! Are you a tech wiz? Let us know! 
  • Visit www.HouseofFyre.com/cafe to stay up to date on all the fundraising opportunities we have going on! 


We can't do this without you!

story:
About Project

Crepes @ Coffee in Medellin Colombia is a pilot project that has 3 phases. First and the second step is to buy Wheelys Cafe Bike and to start a small production with one or two persons that can move both hands. A blind man or women can make a very good sauce. But someone must to teach him. I am the one, I am the teacher.

Wheelys Cafe bike can help our team to open step 3: Youtube movies. They will prepare the food and I will help them. In this way we can create a small cooking school together.


All the products we are going to sell with Wheelys Cafe bike will be made by them and myself, manual, artisanal and natural.

Wheelys Cafe Bike can change the taste of the famous Colombian Coffee.

Dear Readers, Help Me To Help a small part of these people because I want to dedicate myself to them.

Please do not forgot: this pilot project can work in any part of the globe with a condition: to want to do this....and I want!


Supporters and Partners of the project

  • Radio PRO Diaspora - on line radio Germany
  • PP Music Bucharest Rumania - Music Production Company
  • Petru Prodan - CEO Radio PRO Diaspora , Music editor , Professional Artist
  • Gustavo Alberto  Corrales - System Engineer at San Buenavetura University Medellin, expert on social reintegration of disabled people. Founder of: www.discapacidadcolombia.com and www.tecnoayudas.com

Our Team

  • Sandu Matei - Chef Profesional, 56 years, Medellin Colombia , founder
  • Silvia Marulanda - Industrial Engineer and lawyer, 52 years Medellin Colombia, co-founder
  • Diego Blanco - Indistrial Engineer  30 years, Bogotá Colombia, co-founder
  • Vasile Crucianu - Entrepreneur and lawyer 45 years, Bucharest Rumania, co-founder.
    We are four people with different proffesions, two continentes, but we have the same goal to creat an activity for this special group people.

    Special thank goes to :

    All the Reders and Donors, Indiegogo Team, Wheelys Caffee Team Stockholm, My Team, Radio Pro Diaspora Germany, Gutavo Alberto Corrales and My Wonderful Wife Luz Stela Mejia Beccera, 56 years old, who support me day and night in this project.

food and I will help them. In this way we can create a small cooking school
together.All the products we are going to sell
with Wheelys Cafe bike will be made by them and myself, manual, artisanal and
natural.
Wheelys Cafe
Bike can change the taste of the famous Colombian Coffee.

Help Me To Help a small part of these people because I want to dedicate myself
to them.

forgot: this pilot project can work in any part of the globe with a condition:

story:
StudioME


Imagine a TV studio, photography studio, audio booth and post-production house all at your finger tips!


StudioME is the first, easy-to-use, self-guided studio designed for users of any experience level to produce their own high quality media.  ME or M-E stands for Media Made Easy.

StudioME will be the hub for all your media production, achieving a level of high quality that only a studio environment can provide. And our self-guided model can save you up to 80-90% of production costs. 

PERFECT FOR:

  • Vloggers / Youtubers / Podcasters

  • Educators / Training

  • Public Speakers / Coaches / Consultants / Advisors / Leaders / Politicians / Agents

  • Small Businesses / Startups / Firms / Corporations

  • Kickstarters / Fundraising / Non-profit

  • Personal Media / Social Media

  • Artist / Musicians / Animators / Performers / Actors / Voice Talent

  • Amateur, Semi-Professional and Professional Videographers and Photographers 


Our 2,500 square foot facility will contain FOUR studios, each with a specialized function.  

The soundproof studio is perfect for your podcasts, voice recordings and screen captures and will be available for hourly rental.

The two self-guided studio pods are perfect for headshot photography, interviews or video podcasting.  They come fully equipped with professional lighting and audio, and an easy-to-use iPad-operated camera that allows you to record both video and photos at the touch of a button.  You have the option of using a green screen, white or black backdrop.  

The multi-purpose studio allows users to bring their own equipment or rent from our inventory. This studio is suited for a wide variety of uses including full body photography and multi-camera shoots.  

Each studio has its own dressing room and options to add an iPad-operated teleprompter or live internet broadcasting. 

 Unlike traditional studios, we offer 2, 6 and 10 hour packages for the self-guided and multipurpose studios with rental rates starting as low as $149* [A full pricing guide will be available upon request.]

Video, photo and audio equipment packages will be available to rent for use in-house, or off-site for an additional fee. 

Our post-production workstations will include hard drive storage and back-up on our top-of-the-line servers.  Each workstation will come with the tools and support you need to create high quality media.


HOW IT WILL WORK:

1. Sign up for a free membership on our website 

2. Book your studio time (2, 6 or 10 hour blocks) or equipment rental (daily rates) online on our easy to use scheduling application

3. Capture your media on an SD card that's yours to keep

4. Book post-production workstations (2 hour blocks) to edit your project or have our on-site editor custom quote your project

5. Receive free guidance on how to get the most out of your media when your project is finished!


Media Made Easy


The Impact

There's been a major shift in the media industry over the last few years and we are building a studio to meet those changes.  As productions are getting smaller and sharing media is getting easier, we are positioned to be the next evolution of the production studio.  

But don't just take our word for it -- hear from one of Pittsburgh's leading media personalities, Darieth Chisolm.  

Darieth Chisolm, former WPXI News Anchor, is an Emmy Award Winner, media personality, business coach, author, speaker, entrepreneur and video podcast show host of Hustle & Heart TV with Darieth Chisolm. www.dariethchisolm.com



EXPLANATION OF FUNDING:

Up until now, we have dug deep into our own pockets to self-fund this project, covering the legal fees, studio construction costs, marketing & promotion, website and scheduling application, and operations

Now we need your help!

Building a studio is NOT CHEAP!  In order to offer a wide selection of high quality, state-of-the-art equipment to our customers, we need to raise $45,000.  Contributions will help to purchase the items listed below.

- (x4) DSLR Cameras, Lenses & Accessories (~$10,000)

- (x14) Portable LED Westcott Flex Lights (~$15,000)

- (x5) Audio Kits (~$5,000)

- (x4) Editing Bay iMacs (~$10,000)

- Tripods, C-Stands, Backdrops & Teleprompters (~$5,000)

If we exceed our target goal of $45,000, the additional contributions will go toward expending our equipment rental offerings, furthering StudioME as the hub for media production.

- (x4) Additional DSLR Cameras, Lenses & Accessories (~$10,000)

- (x4) Additional Portable LED Westcott Flex Lights (~$5,000)

- (x2) Additional Audio Kits (~$1,000)

- (x3) Additional Editing Bay iMacs (~$7,500)

- Additional Tripods, C-Stands, Backdrops & Teleprompters (~$3,500)

- Livestreaming & Switching Equipment for Each Studio Space (~$3,000)


EXPLAINATION OF PERKS:
High Five: 
Thank you for your support! We will give a shout out to you on our social media page.
StudioME Sticker Bundle:
StudioME logo sticker & a shoutout on our social media.
StudioME T-Shirt Bundle:
You will receive a branded StudioME Tee (colors and size options included) to show your support, a StudioME logo sticker & a shoutout on our social media.

   

                                                                            

StudioME Hoodie Bundle:

You will receive a branded StudioME Hoodie to show your support along with a StudioME Tee, a StudioME logo sticker & a shoutout on our social media.

  


Launch Party:
Join us for our Launch Party honoring our supporters and receive an exclusive T-shirt for attendees only. 
Over some appetizers and drinks, you'll get a chance to:
  • be one of the first to tour the studio
  • meet the team
  • sign a StudioME poster that will be framed in the studio 
  • receive early-bird specials
  • be the first to hear about our exciting plans for the year

Gift Cards:
Receive a StudioME gift card to be used with for studio, workstation or equipment rental 

[Exterior image of future home of StudioME]

[Post production workstation rendering]

MILESTONES:

StudioME will open May, 2016 in a newly-built, retail location in the heart of East Liberty, just 5 miles from downtown Pittsburgh.

2016 TIMELINE

- JAN - Indiegogo Launch

- FEB - Website Launch

- FEB - March 2016 - Studio Construction

- APRIL - Purchase Equipment & Furniture

- MAY - Launch StudioME


HelpME

If you only support one new startup this year, please consider us and help to create the next big evolution in media production!  
Another way to help is to please send our Indiegogo link along to a few people that you think could benefit from our studio. 


*$149 rate based on 2 hour studio rental time for the self-guided and multipurpose studios. Subject to change.

story:
Short Summary

What if there were a place where you could go to completely disconnect from the hustle and bustle of your everyday? A place where the constant stimuli from the outside world would just float away and you could truly unwind?  

Well there is, just not in the triangle...yet.  

Float tanks have been around since the 50's and are now widely used thorough the world by people from all different backgrounds.  From pro and college athletes, high stress business people, to mindful yogis & creative artists, there isn't a single person that wouldn't benefit something from floating.

Benefits include:

  • Reduction in anxiety & stress
  • Enhanced creativity & focus
  • Improved skin
  • Chronic pain relief & reduction in swelling
  • Intense Relaxation
  • Relieve old injuries (especially back aches etc.)
  • Ease Arthritis
  • Release Endorphins – the body’s natural pain killer and happy pill
  • Improve the condition of the skin
  • Detoxify the system
  • Useful in pregnancy (for the full 9 months)
  • Increase circulation and energy levels
  • Balance the left & right brain
  • An aid for addictions, phobias and depression
  • Regulate sleeping patterns – simulates 6-8 hours of sleep
  • The list goes on and on...
Opening this studio is important to me because I've experienced first hand how AMAZING the experience can be.  I've had residual pain from broken bones, lower back injuries that eventually turned in to sciatica, and general aches from just living life to the fullest.  Relief was never as great as it was while in and after getting out of a float tank.
 
There are endless other people who have used floating as therapy to help relive headaches, ailments from fibromyalgia,  eating disorders, general anxiety, and so many more. 
 
Ultimately, having a flotation therapy studio alongside all the other wellness modalities, will help make our community a more mindful, focused, thoughtful, stress free place to work, live, and play!  Who wouldn't want that!?   By donating to this campaign, you can help contribute to making our area a more awesome place to be! 
 

What We Need & What You Get

In this initial push, we're hoping to raise $17,000.  By achieving this goal, we'll be able to secure more funding from other investors and bank loans, and opening costs of the studio including:

  • Buildout
  • Equipment
  • Licences & permits
  • Overhead costs
  • Employees
  • and more!

Risks & Challenges

As this is an initial push for funding it may not be enough to get the center completely up and running.  So, we're working with banks and potential private investors to help secure whatever we don't earn through this campaign.  Because there aren't other float centers currently in our area, banks are  a little more apprehensive in providing a loan, but with you all behind us, we'll be able to show the mass appeal and desire for a float center and a comprehensive business plan has been completed to help show the possibility of success to ease any unsure minds.
 
Buildout and bringing potential locations up to code can be challenging and expensive as well.   We've already reached out to the town and health departments to get the ball rolling and smooth out any potential kinks before they happen. 
 
I know all this work it's worth it because our community is worth it.  I am SO excited to bring this to our area in top notch fashion.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Contributions don't just come in the form of money.  Please share and spread the word!  You never know who wants to get out and float!  Indiegogo has really great share tools for you to use to get the word out!

    Thank you all again!  Your support means so much, your mind and body will thank you! 

    Float on~

    Jen

story:
Short Summary

Greetings,

My name is Paul Kilgore, I am the owner and head brewer of WAORGANY Brewing. WAORGANY Brewing pronounced (War-Gah-Knee) will be a small nano brewery located in Northern New York, near Ft. Drum, home to the US Army’s 10th Mountain Division.  We will be licensed as a New York State Farm Brewery, hand crafting our ales 3 barrels at a time in on our all electric American made brew house. The name WAORGANY comes from the abbreviations of the states; Washington, Oregon, Georgia and New York, representing where my family is from and just a few of the many places I have lived and brewed beer. I am a service disabled combat veteran who has spent over 21 years in the Army, and I am a two time cancer survivor. 

Currently WAORGANY Brewing is in the startup phase. I am a full time grad student and am 1 course away from graduating with my MBA.  I graduated from the EBV Program at Cornell University in 2014. Earlier this year I competed in a National Business Plan Competition for Veterans. There were close to 50 entries, and my BP for WAORGANY Brewing took 2nd place, helping validating my business plan for the brewery.

I started brewing beer in 1994, and have been expanding my knowledge and perfecting my techniques ever since. I am currently a Certified Beer Server and working on becoming a Certified Cicerone.  Many people have told me over the years that I should make beer for a living, but it wasn’t until 2013 when I was diagnosed with prostate cancer that it really struck me...I should be doing something that I love and am passionate about.  That passion is brewing beer.  Two surgeries and 39 radiation treatments later, my health is back on track, I am cancer free and now it is my goal to open my own local craft brewery.

What We Need & What You Get

Overall WAORGANY Brewing needs close to $500K to open the doors to our brewery.  Through this campaign we hope to raise 5% of that, in the amount of $25K. I have already put in a substantial amount of my own funds, including the money that I won in the business plan competition. However, that is still not enough to get the brewery up and operational. That is where I need your help. We have found a location, and working with local town zoning for approval, but need some additional help for equipment and startup costs. I am working with a local bank to secure the remaining funds needed, but will still need money for closing costs and down payment. The funds raised here will help offset the cost of our brewing equipment which is $75,000.  If we fail to meet our goal, we will still move forward opening the brewery, it will just be at a slower pace.

Perk Levels Rewards 

We will offer the following perks as a reward for helping us out. Anyone local to the area in Jefferson County NY or willing to travel to us to pick up your perks, can waive the shipping fees. As our campaign progresses, we will add additional perks or extend the numbers under each section to help give you more options for helping us!

We will have a local and out of the area perks for each level that will allow for anyone local to our area in Northern NY (13637) pick up the merchandise and not have to incur any shipping charges...but this is only if you are able and willing to come pick the items up, we can not deliver them (sorry), if you are unable to pick items up please select the away perks and we will gladdly ship them too you for our costs through the USPS, thanks. 

1  $10  WAORGANY Brewing Sticker and a Thank You on our web site

2  $25  Perk 1, and WAORGANY Brewing Pint Glass

3 $75  Perk 2 & WAORGANY Brewing Founders Club T Shirt (only time ever made)

4 $125  Perk 3, & Limited Edition  WAORGANY Brewing Founders Fitted Hat

5 $250  Perk 4, & WAORGANY Brewing Special Edition Founders Growler

6 $500  Perk 5, & Tap Faucet Name (name 1 of 10 beer faucets after you in our in tap room)

7 $1,000 Perk 5, & Collaborate with brewery, we brew a beer of your choice, you name it

8 $2,500 Perk 7, & Come into the brewery brew your beer with us and have the first pint!!

9 $5,000 Perk 7, & Name one of our fermentors. The name you choose will be placed on a plaque and displayed forever on your FV!

The Impact

Starting any business is a daunting task, and a brewery is no exception. We need help funding WAORGANY Brewing to help make my dream come true, which is to start and operate a local brewery, serve those in our community, especially our veterans, and help create jobs for the veteran community for years to come.  As a combat veteran and cancer survivor I can no longer wait for things to happen, I am taking my life into my own hands, and need help getting the brewery operational. You will be part of that, helping my dream come alive, and for that I will forever be grateful.

Risks & Challenges

Nothing is guaranteed. We still have a long way to go. We need approval by the local town, our facility needs to be inspected by our bank, and we need to begin renovations, and order equipment. Then once this is all done, we can apply to the Federal Government, (TTB), for our brewers permit, and then NY State, for our NYS Farm Brewery License. Anything could derail these steps and time line. It will take an additional six to twelve months until we are operational.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to donate, but it is simple and easy to help us out. Spread the word about our campaign. Like us Facebook, www.facebook.com/waorgany  and follow us on Twitter, and Instagram @waorgany help us go viral and raise money for our campaign and brewery. Also check out our friends at @Pints4Prostates www.facebook.com/Pints4Prostates/

As our campaign progresses, we will add additional perks or extend the numbers under each section to help give you more options for helping us!We will have a local and out of the area perks for each level that will allow for anyone local to our area in Northern NY (13637) pick up the merchandise and not have to incur any shipping charges...but this is only if you are able and willing to come pick the items up, we can not deliver them (sorry), if you are unable to pick items up please select the away perks and we will gladdly ship them too you for our costs through the USPS, thanks.  1  $10  WAORGANY Brewing Sticker and a
Thank You on our web site
2  $25  Perk
1, and WAORGANY Brewing Pint Glass
3 $75  Perk 2 & WAORGANY Brewing
Founders Club T Shirt (only time ever made)
4 $125  Perk 3, & Limited Edition  WAORGANY Brewing Founders Fitted Hat
5 $250  Perk 4, & WAORGANY Brewing
Special Edition Founders Growler 
6 $500  Perk 5, & Tap Faucet Name (name 1
of 10 beer faucets after you in our in tap room)
7 $1,000 Perk 5, & Collaborate with brewery, we brew a beer of your choice, you name it
8 $2,500 Perk 7, & Come into the brewery brew your beer with us and have the first pint!!
9 $5,000 Perk 7, & Name one of our fermentors. The name you choose will be placed on a plaque
and displayed forever on your FV!
The
Impact
Starting any business
is a daunting task, and a brewery is no exception. We need help funding
WAORGANY Brewing to help make my dream come true, which is to start and operate a local
brewery, serve those in our community, especially our veterans, and help create
jobs for the veteran community for years to come.  As a combat veteran and cancer survivor I can
no longer wait for things to happen, I am taking my life into my own hands, and
need help getting the brewery operational. You will be part of that, helping my
dream come alive, and for that I will forever be grateful. 
Risks
& Challenges
Nothing is guaranteed. We still have a
long way to go. We need approval by the local town, our facility needs to be
inspected by our bank, and we need to begin renovations, and order equipment.
Then once this is all done, we can apply to the Federal Government, (TTB), for
our brewers permit, and then NY State, for our NYS Farm Brewery License.
Anything could derail these steps and time line. It will take an additional six
to twelve months until we are operational. 
Other
Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone is able
to donate, but it is simple and easy to help us out. Spread the word about our
campaign. Like us Facebook, www.facebook.com/waorgany  and follow us on Twitter, and
Instagram @waorgany help us go viral and raise money for our campaign and
brewery. Also check out our friends at @Pints4Prostates www.facebook.com/Pints4Prostates/

story:
Free Water

Free bottles of water for London commuters!

100% of profits given to Water For Africa

#freewaterforlondon  #waterforafrica

Free Water was set up with one goal, to make a difference in London and across Africa. We aim to distribute over five million free bottles of water to Londoners per year, and expect to become as much a part of a Londoner’s daily commute as a free newspaper. 100% of our profits will be donated directly to a grass roots charity called Water For Africa (WFA), who helps West African communities gain what we take for granted, regular access to clean drinking water.
 

Every bottle of Free Water will make a huge difference to millions of people’s lives around the world.  And by investing from as little as £1 today into Free Water today you can personally help change the way millions of people can access water on a daily basis – in London and in Africa.

#freewaterforlondon

It is a simple concept.  We plan to advertise on water bottles in order to make them commercially viable and be able to give them away for free. Commuters would use their free bottles to refill during the day, and in so doing they will continue to advertise wherever they drink from their bottle – at work, in the gym, in the park with their children, on their bicycle.  You get the idea.


Why we need your help

Why We Need You

For Free Water in London to happen we are looking for £20,000 seed money.  We would use this towards renting an office and a warehouse.  As you are all aware London rental prices are sky-high and to get up and running it is a bridge we have to cross.

As 100 percent of our profits are given directly to WFA, we can't approach traditional investors. Therefore we have come to Indiegogo to ask the public for a hand making this dream of Free Water for Londoners a reality. If we can encourage a small percentage of Londoners to donate £1 or £2 then we can bring Free Water to the Capital this year.

And if you want to see first-hand how change happens in a West African community when a well is dug we would love to fly you to Africa to be part of the digging team if you make a donation of £5,000.  An experience of a life time!


#waterforafrica

Water For Africa was founded in 2002 with the aim of bringing lasting change to the people of Africa. Starting with the most basic of all necessities, water, the charity set out to disrupt the old aid model and embed fundamental change that lasts a lifetime. For 13 years Water For Africa has delivered dozens of successful projects and changed the lives of thousands of people.  And with the help of Free Water they will be able to expand their projects to many thousands more.

Everyone should have access to clean water and we at Free Water are proud to say we are helping to make this dream a reality through our partnership with Water For Africa.

The Impact

Perhaps you are thirsty, walk to the tap and pour yourself a glass of water. In large parts of the worlds this is not an option and every mouthful is a potential killer. Typhoid, cholera and many other water-borne diseases still run rampant.

In developing countries, around 80% of illnesses and 1 in 5 deaths of children under the age of 5 is directly linked to poor water quality. Incredibly half of all hospital beds worldwide are taken up with people suffering from water related diseases. Clearly everyone should have access to clean water we are proud to say that we are making this dream a reality.


In partnership with WFA, we are helping with their mission to provide water to thousands of people. This is just the first step, as we grow, our pledge grows too. Every bottle is a step towards a better future for millions of people worldwide. We are dedicating 100% of our  profits to Water for Africa to support the work that they do.



Water For Africa was founded in 2002 with the aim of bringing lasting change to the people of Africa. Starting with the most basic of all necessities, water, they set out to disrupt the old aid model and embed fundamental change that lasts a lifetime. For 13 years Water For Africa has delivered dozens of successful projects and changed the lives of thousands of people



Once we have set up London, we plan to expand across the country and internationally. Every expansion will enable us to make an even bigger difference.


Risks & Challenges

We have spent the past year researching common pitfalls in the market we are entering.  We are currently speaking to a number of interested multi-national organisations and strongly believe that as soon as people see what we are doing it will be a very popular vehicle for commuter advertising.  Not another discarded advert in a paper or a fleeting view of a billboard, but a product that the public holds in their hand with a positive message they can engage with. By sponsoring Free Water, companies can align themselves with a great cause whilst advertising on one of the best OOH mediums on the market.

We have also looked into whether or not people will pick up a bottle of water in the first place. Our market research has shown an incredible 98.5% positive response to the product.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute and thats ok, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

·  Tell everyone about us!

·  Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

·  Use the #freewaterforlondon and #waterforafrica hashtags on social media

Hydrating London to help hydrate the world

#freewaterforlondon  #waterforafrica

story:
Promiscuous Pint, Taphouse

At the Promiscuous Pint, we truly feel that every tap should get its turn. It is for this reason that we have incorporated a bold new concept in the world of craft beer. By using a self-pour tap system, wishing you could try one of every beer on tap at your favorite taphouse is a thing of the past. By being able to pour as much or as little as you want, you will be able to sample as many of our 40 taps as you desire. If that IPA is too bitter for your taste, good thing you just tried a few ounces finding that out. Not sure what a Lambic is? Now you can face your beer fear and give it a shot. Since all our beer is priced by the ounce, you can let your fear of commitment be your guide as you take a tour of dozens of breweries of which you may have never even heard.

At the Promiscuous Pint we are all about supporting the local brewers. With a focus on unique and rare offerings from local Colorado breweries, we will have rotating taps of all your Rocky Mountain favorites. 

The Promiscuous Pint was founded by Angela McLeod and Michael Austell based on our passion for fine craft beer. Angela retired from the Marine Corps and relocated back to Colorado to focus on her family and her dream of opening her own craft beer bar. Michael, a consummate business man with a wealth of knowledge in varied fields, came to Colorado with the desire to create something to call his own.  With a love of live music, sports, games and of course, fine craft beers, the dream of The Promiscuous Pint began to organically take form.

Our vision begins when you walk in, the concierge will give you a bracelet with a RFID chip in it which activates each tap and keeps track of your expenditures. They will then explain the how to operate the system and where to find the different style glasses as you change beers. At this point the journey is in your hands.

We will have all of your favorite bar games such as pool, foosball, corn hole, and more. We also look forward to having a stage where local musicians can share their passion with us, whether it is open mic night or a featured act. TVs all around will show your favorite sporting events (especially Gator football ;) and you can count on all the Pay-Per-View fights being live at the Promiscuous Pint.

As for food, we will be rotating Denver's finest gourmet food trucks to keep the dining options as fresh as the drinking options.

Contributions

Though our hard work, sacrifice, and dedication to the Promiscuous Pint we have saved $100,000.  We are asking for an additional $20,000 to purchase the software for the tap system.  

We know you have worked just as hard for your money so we are not asking for a free hand-out.  We are offering perks for your contributions, everything from Promiscuous Pint swag to multiple levels of membership. Here's a little clarification of the various perks. 


  • Snifter (promo pack): First 16 oz. from any tap is on us + Sticker
  • Tulip (promo pack): First 16 oz. from any tap is on us + Sticker + T-shirt
  • Pint (promo pack): $10.00 Beer credit +Sticker + T-Shirt + Promiscuous Pint logo-ed Pint Glass.
  • Beer Stein Membership Card (1 year): Membership Card (1 year) = $1 Off every 16 ounces poured (1 year) + "Pint" promo pack
  • Growler Membership Card (1 year): Membership Card (1 year)= 25% Off every 16 ounces poured (1 year) + "Pint" promo pack
  • Torpedo Keg Membership Card (1 year): Membership Card (1 year)= 50% Off every 16 ounces poured (1 year) + "Pint" promo pack
  • Pony Keg Membership Card (1 year): Membership Card (1 year)= Free Beer at Promiscuous Pint (40 ounces of any tap/day) + "Pint" promo pack + Priority to special events
  • Half Barrel Lifelong Membership Card: 

    Lifelong Membership Card= Free Beer at Promiscuous Pint For LIFE (40 ounces of any tap/day ) + "Pint" promo pack + Priority to special events. 

    Commemorative Oktoberfest style beer mug with your name to be displayed as one of our contributing founders.

Looking ahead

Without your contributions, the Promiscuous Pint will not be able to purchase the unique software system to allow self-serve taps.  This self-serve tap system will be a one-of-a-kind Denver taphouse. Your contributions will set us apart from your average taphouse.  Giving you a place to enjoy friends, good local craft beer, and freedom to pour your own. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand everyone can't contribute, but if you would please share this campaign and help us get the word out.  We need your help to put Promiscuous Pint on the map!

story:
Oldies and u.s. is a company I want to start cause here in belgium there are no people to be found who are able to restore and boost old american engines.

I have a couple of years of experience working with american cars. I build, rebuild, boost and repair engines from american cars. I am working in my own home garage which is to small.
My dream is to start my own company where i would have the space, the tools and the time to do it more and better.
In my garage i would start from an old and tired engine, and build a new one but with the matching numbers staying on.  

With 30.000 dollar i could find a space i could rent and make the investment i need to do for tools and setting up the workspace.
I would like to create a garage with a nice coffeeshop looking cornor where people can chat, read reviews and meet other enthousiasts.
I would be in the garage working on engines. Turning them apart to scratch and rebuilding them with the needs and possibility's of the custumer
This is what they get in return!


What We Need & What You Get.

More and more oldtimers are tired and need restoring and a rebuild of the engine.The problem is there are fiewer and fiewer people who do that.
For me it feels like a hobby cause i really like working on old greasy engines and i want to see them come back to life.
We will try to give some interesting perks which we hope could stimulate or help people make us some publicity and donations.


The Impact

This garage will give people finally a place where they can come in all ease to see their project-car engines come to life. If however i don't succeed to raise enough funds, i will still be using the money to better the space i am working in for now. new electricity standards, compressor, bridge, machinery to clean , sandblasters, special tools etc....


Risks & Challenges

It could be a challenge finding enough custumors, but lots of people know me allready. The problem is that  now i have to turn most of them down.

I would make me a member of allmost every oldtimer club in Belgium, go to meetings and try to meet as many people as possible: custumors,  tool and parts company's,... .

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Every mail, link, tweet can help .
  • Sending shopbooks, specialised literature, ...
  • Talk to people you know with american cars and on meeting. Help spread the word that there is finally a company that can help them taking care of their engines.

  • It's always good to have contacts in the u.s to buy spare parts on a reduction for company's.

  • Useful phonenumbers, contacts, tool specialists, ...

story:
(updates at the bottom)

Hello Indiegogo!

My name is Kate Eastmead, and I live in Port Orange, Florida with my husband Tj. We both grew up here in the greater Daytona Beach area, and we've found that Daytona Beach has much more to offer then just the ocean. It has a welth of culture and tourism hiding just on the other side of the bridge, centralized around the Daytona International Speedway, and the Daytona Flea and Farmers Market, which was voted one of the top 5 markets in the whole country. 

In 2013 Daytona Beach got its first Vegan restaurant, and ever since then the vegan (and vegitarian) population has been growing like crazy. The only problem is, the resources haven't. There is still only one vegan restaurant, though many big chains have added vegan options. And, we do have many "health food" stores, but they are extremely over priced and don't have many options. We know personally that there is a huge demand for vegan stores here, and we want to take advantage of that by being the first.

A year ago I started making my own personal care products, and getting very into baking, because finding cruelty free vegan products and vegan baked goods just wasn't at all easy in our area. I ended up honestly loving my products, and so did my husband and the rest of our family. One day he suggested we could sell them, and it just clicked. We now sell our products from our Etsy store, and to people in person just by word of mouth. It's gone pretty well so far, but now we can't get enough.

Our Current Products: keep in mind, this is just what we can currently AFFORD to make. 

Face Wash, Facial Toner, Facial Moisturizer For Oily Skin, Facial Moisturizer For Dry Skin, Sun Screen, Deodorant, Lip Balms, and combinations of those. 

Products we Plan To Make: this is just what we have thought up so far, the possibilities are endless!

Shampoos, Conditioners, Body Washes, Body Lotions, Body Scrubs, More Variations Of All Of The Products We Currently Make, Handmade Soy Candles, Handmade Recycled Jewelry (a percentage of the jewelry proceeds will go to an animal rights organization or charity to be later decided), Perfumes, Bath Oils, Bath Bombs, Bubble Baths, And Our Own Personal Art Designs To Be Printed On Shirts And Tote Bags, ect, To Advertise Veganism. 

Food/Snacks: Granola Bars, Fudge, Cookies, Brownies, Trail Mixes, Dried Fruit.

Everything we have ever made, and everything we will ever make, has 100% Vegan ingredients and is NEVER tested on animals, it is also all personally handmade by me (and sometime my husband lol), and packaged in all recycled materials. (The current stock of plastic containers we have are not recycled, but all future plastic containers will be.) 



What We Want To Do & What You Get

Our big idea is to open up a permanent store in the Daytona Flea and Farmers Market, and have separate portable equipment to travel to the many other markets and events that go on in central Florida. The Daytona Flea and Farmers Market is open Friday Saturday and Sunday, and all week long over any holiday. And, the many other events that go on around here happen year round, a lot of which are themed for health and fitness, which veganism is a big part of. We don't feel that leasing a store space or office space would benefit as much as this plan would, because being mobile lets us reach out to more people. And, that's what our real mission is; to educate more people on veganism, and show them in person how easy and affordable it really is to be vegan.

We need: The money to begin our rent for the Flea and Farmers Market, the portable tables, chairs, and tent, to bring to events, money to stock up on more of our products and be able to make the products we haven't yet, a printer for making the designs we will put on shirts and bags, and equipment for candle making.

We will be furnishing our shop with all recycled (and up cycled) materials we will personally build, keeping the money we raise strictly for the business itself. We set our goal at $1,000, which is not a lot of money when you're talking about starting a whole business, but that's our point! We do things cheaply and mindfully, leaving the smallest footprint we can, and bringing the most affordable products to our customers. If we DO NOT make our goal, we will still use every penny in this same way! It will only take us longer to fulfill our plan. 

PERKS: for every person who contributes no matter how big or small, they will get a handmade thank you card made of all recycled and up-cycled paper. 

Every contributions $5+ will also get a Lip Balm

Every contribution $10+ will also get an Eastmeads Vegan Earth sticker

Every contribution $20+ will also get a Decal/Bumper Sticker stating that you contributed to Eastmeads Vegan Earth in Daytona Beach

Every contribution $50+ will get the handmade thank you card, a Lip Balm, 2 stickers, and 2 Decal/ Bumper stickers 

Contribute $100 or more and get all that to begin with, Plus, 1 product of your choice free, once every month for a year! (Starting after our store opens).

The Impact

Veganism is becoming more and more prominent all around the world. All the major cities in America have lots of vegan restaurants now, even Orlando has quite a few. Daytona Beach is the next one to go, and we want to be a part of it. We plan to have a lot of informational pakets, stickers, and other advertisements with us everywhere we go to spread the word. 

Your contribution to our store, is more then just a great way to help the local economy. It's a great way to advocate for veganism and animal rights! It's just another way to do your part in helping to end animal agriculture and testing. 

Risks & Challenges

We are aware that not everything always works out the way you plan. Where as we know veganism will always prevail, our store may not at first. If we do not raise enough money for our plan, we will continue saving and it will still happen sooner or later. But, if we do fulfill our plan now with your contributions, and it does not make a profit quickly enough, we will have to consider a business or personal loan to keep us afloat until we can turn a profit. Of course that is not idea, but this project means enough to us to do whatever it takes. It's not about our own gain, it's about the bigger picture, and a Vegan Earth.

Other Ways You Can Help

Absolutely any contribution will help and be so greatly appreciated! If you cannot contribute in funds, but still want to help, PLEASE share our campaign on all your social media sites! Get the word out and help us make Daytona Beach the first stop in our new Vegan Earth!

Thank you so much for reading! We will keep everyone updated on all of our progress, and we hope to see you soon at our new store!



Updates: 

For the last two weeks we've gone out to the Sugar Mill Market in Port Orange, and brought with us all of our online products, as well as some delicious vegan snacks and deserts we baked. They were just tweaked recipes we found online, and they are not a direct representation of what we would bake for our store, but they all tasted great, and it was a good way to see what people liked and didn't. We sold a lot of product, and snacks, and many people donated to our campaign while we were there.

We've also gone door to door once so far, in the Port Orange area subdivisions, giving out our baked goods and snacks for free, and asking for donations to anyone who could afford to.  Everyone we spoke to loved our idea, loved the food, and many people donated as well. We also had a lot of people tell us they have sisters/brothers or friends that are vegan, and that they would love a store like ours to open up in the area. 

So as of today (March 6th 2016) we've made $150 in cash donations. And we've opened our own online store outside of Etsy, at the domain EastmeadsVeganEarth.com
story_txt:
(updates at the bottom)Hello Indiegogo! My name is Kate Eastmead, and I live in Port Orange, Florida with my husband Tj. We both grew up here in the greater Daytona Beach area, and we've found that Daytona Beach has much more to offer then just the ocean. It has a welth of culture and tourism hiding just on the other side of the bridge, centralized around the Daytona International Speedway, and the Daytona Flea and Farmers Market, which was voted one of the top 5 markets in the whole country. 
In 2013 Daytona Beach got its first Vegan restaurant, and ever since then the vegan (and vegitarian) population has been growing like crazy. The only problem is, the resources haven't. There is still only one vegan restaurant, though many big chains have added vegan options. And, we do have many "health food" stores, but they are extremely over priced and don't have many options. We know personally that there is a huge demand for vegan stores here, and we want to take advantage of that by being the first.
A year ago I started making my own personal care products, and getting very into baking, because finding cruelty free vegan products and vegan baked goods just wasn't at all easy in our area. I ended up honestly loving my products, and so did my husband and the rest of our family. One day he suggested we could sell them, and it just clicked. We now sell our products from our Etsy store, and to people in person just by word of mouth. It's gone pretty well so far, but now we can't get enough.
Our Current Products: keep in mind, this is just what we can currently AFFORD to make. 
Face Wash, Facial Toner, Facial Moisturizer For Oily Skin, Facial Moisturizer For Dry Skin, Sun Screen, Deodorant, Lip Balms, and combinations of those. 
Products we Plan To Make: this is just what we have thought up so far, the possibilities are endless!
Shampoos, Conditioners, Body Washes, Body Lotions, Body Scrubs, More Variations Of All Of The Products We Currently Make, Handmade Soy Candles, Handmade Recycled Jewelry (a percentage of the jewelry proceeds will go to an animal rights organization or charity to be later decided), Perfumes, Bath Oils, Bath Bombs, Bubble Baths, And Our Own Personal Art Designs To Be Printed On Shirts And Tote Bags, ect, To Advertise Veganism. 
Food/Snacks: Granola Bars, Fudge, Cookies, Brownies, Trail Mixes, Dried Fruit.
Everything we have ever made, and everything we will ever make, has 100% Vegan ingredients and is NEVER tested on animals, it is also all personally handmade by me (and sometime my husband lol), and packaged in all recycled materials. (The current stock of plastic containers we have are not recycled, but all future plastic containers will be.) 

   What We Want To Do & What You Get Our big idea is to open up a permanent store in the Daytona Flea and Farmers Market, and have separate portable equipment to travel to the many other markets and events that go on in central Florida. The Daytona Flea and Farmers Market is open Friday Saturday and Sunday, and all week long over any holiday. And, the many other events that go on around here happen year round, a lot of which are themed for health and fitness, which veganism is a big part of. We don't feel that leasing a store space or office space would benefit as much as this plan would, because being mobile lets us reach out to more people. And, that's what our real mission is; to educate more people on veganism, and show them in person how easy and affordable it really is to be vegan.

We set our goal at $1,000, which is not a lot of money when you're talking about starting a whole business, but that's our point! We do things cheaply and mindfully, leaving the smallest footprint we can, and bringing the most affordable products to our customers. If we DO NOT make our goal, we will still use every penny in this same way! It will only take us longer to fulfill our plan. 
PERKS: for every person who contributes no matter how big or small, they will get a handmade thank you card made of all recycled and up-cycled paper. 
Every contributions $5+ will also get a Lip Balm
Every contribution $10+ will also get an Eastmeads Vegan Earth sticker
Every contribution $20+ will also get a Decal/Bumper Sticker stating that you contributed to Eastmeads Vegan Earth in Daytona Beach
Every contribution $50+ will get the handmade thank you card, a Lip Balm, 2 stickers, and 2 Decal/ Bumper stickers 
Contribute $100 or more and get all that to begin with, Plus, 1 product of your choice free, once every month for a year! (Starting after our store opens).   The Impact Veganism is becoming more and more prominent all around the world. All the major cities in America have lots of vegan restaurants now, even Orlando has quite a few. Daytona Beach is the next one to go, and we want to be a part of it. We plan to have a lot of informational pakets, stickers, and other advertisements with us everywhere we go to spread the word. 
Your contribution to our store, is more then just a great way to help the local economy. It's a great way to advocate for veganism and animal rights! It's just another way to do your part in helping to end animal agriculture and testing.    Risks & Challenges We are aware that not everything always works out the way you plan. Where as we know veganism will always prevail, our store may not at first. If we do not raise enough money for our plan, we will continue saving and it will still happen sooner or later. But, if we do fulfill our plan now with your contributions, and it does not make a profit quickly enough, we will have to consider a business or personal loan to keep us afloat until we can turn a profit. Of course that is not idea, but this project means enough to us to do whatever it takes. It's not about our own gain, it's about the bigger picture, and a Vegan Earth.   Other Ways You Can Help Absolutely any contribution will help and be so greatly appreciated! If you cannot contribute in funds, but still want to help, PLEASE share our campaign on all your social media sites! Get the word out and help us make Daytona Beach the first stop in our new Vegan Earth!
Thank you so much for reading! We will keep everyone updated on all of our progress, and we hope to see you soon at our new store!

story:
Intro (Français ci-dessous)

Focused on bringing warmth and vibrancy into the home, Séries Habitantes is a unique and surprising way to discover the wide world of Montreal artists.

Through careful curation and selection, our team crafts a unique collection of Montreal’s best artisanal products and ships them straight to your door, bringing surprise and delight as you discover new and beautiful works by Montreal’s most creative artisans.

Séries Habitantes is a new monthly subscription box-service that intends to help you discover the very best of modern Montreal artisanry.

  • We're a small team of Montreal residents who’ve been inspired to action. We are photographers, writers, and lovers of quality handicraft.  
  • We’re looking for a small amount of financial backing to get our project off the ground and into homes around the country!

  • With your support, we can create a new platform for the world to access Montreal handicraft.  

What We Need & What You Get

  • We’ve set a goal of $7000 to launch our project. Some of this will be used towards the basic start-up costs of any business (website, business cards, banking, marketing, design), but the vast majority of this money will be used to get the first round of boxes into your hands!
  • In return for your contribution, we’ve put together some phenomenal rewards. We’ve collected some of the best and most unique handicraft and consumable items being produced in Montreal for our first series of boxes.
  • Depending on the amount raised, our intention is to continue launching this new service, even if we fall short of our goal. Regardless of how much we manage to raise, all of our supporters are sure to receive their rewards.
  • Any additional funds raised beyond the cost of providing rewards to our backers will be put towards costs we have already incurred, such as our website, design, product samples, etc.

The Impact

  • Montreal craftsmanship is world renowned, yet its circulation around North America remains limited. Our project aims to create a new channel for Montreal artisans to connect with their markets all around North America.
  • Our new subscription service is intended to provide an alternative to traditional retail stores for the artisans we work with. Not only do they get the spotlight of being featured through our service, we make sure that all of the artisans working with us can count on a stable income and fair remuneration for their work. We don’t believe in working for “exposure.”
  • For our customers, our goal is to open the doors of Montreal’s numerous studios and workshops, to help bring you a fresh experience of exploring and enjoying impeccable hand-crafted goods in your home.

Risks & Challenges

There are important challenges facing our project, not least of which is building up a track record to show the value of our curation. There is a healthy competition of subscription type services available online. There are numerous subscription boxes floating about the web, potential anxiety over receiving items that aren’t to your taste, and a preference to shop at craft sales are just a few risks we’re facing. But we’ve examined these variables and we’re confident we can tackle them. Based on our market research, here are a few qualities that set us apart:

  • Curation: While most subscriptions send you whatever they have in overstock, we curate our boxes with care, spending hours in collaborative discussions to craft each series.

  • Bicultural & Bilingual: Previous efforts to box Montreal have focused squarely on the francophone community, but this initiative will be completely bicultural.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond just the financial, there are other ways that you can support our project. We’ve learned to never under-estimate the power of the spoken word. Tell your family and friends about our boxes, share the project with your favourite artist, and give us a plug on the social media of your choice. And next time you see us, give us a good old-fashioned high-five!

Thanks for your support!

*

Intro

Laissez-vous surprendre par la diversité des artisan-e-s de Montréal pour insuffler une touche de chaleur et de vie à votre intérieur. L’équipe de Séries Habitantes choisit patiemment le meilleur de l’artisanat montréalais, et l’agence avec soin pour qu’il arrive le plus vite possible à votre porte. Surprises et petits bonheurs au rendez-vous grâce à la superbe créativité des artisan-e-s de Montréal.

Séries Habitantes est un nouveau service d’abonnement mensuel qui vous offre la chance de découvrir une panoplie de designers et d’artisan-e-s de Montréal.

  • Nous sommes photographes, nous sommes écrivain-e-s. Petite équipe montréalaise, nous aimons les produits faits à la main et nous avons senti le besoin d'agir.


  • Nous cherchons un financement modeste pour lancer notre projet et pour faire rayonner les produits montréalais partout au Québec et au Canada.
  • Grâce à votre soutien, nous serons en mesure de  lancer une nouvelle plateforme qui mettra en valeur le travail exceptionnel et unique des artisan-e-s et des designers de notre chère ville!

Nos besoins, vos récompenses

  • Nous espérons récolter 7000 $ pour lancer ce projet. Une petite partie des fonds sera dédiée aux frais de démarrage (site web, cartes d’affaires, frais bancaires, marketing et design), et le reste servira à la confection et à l'envoi des premiers coffrets!
  • Nous avons préparé des superbes récompenses en échange de vos contributions! Pour notre première série de coffrets, nous vous proposons un agencement unique de produits faits à Montréal.
  • Quel que soit le financement reçu à la fin de la campagne, nous irons de l’avant avec ce projet. Toutes les personnes qui auront contribué à la campagne recevront leurs récompenses, peu importe le montant final amassé.
  • Tous les fonds additionnels accumulés pendant la campagne seront utilisés pour rembourser les dépenses déjà effectuées : le site web, le design, les échantillons de produits, etc.

L’impact

  • L’esthétique montréalaise et québécoise se fait certainement remarquer. Cependant, la diffusion à travers l’Amérique du Nord des produits faits ici demeure limitée. Nous voulons offrir une nouvelle façon pour les artisan-e-s de Montréal de servir leurs marchés d’un océan à l’autre.
  • Notre service d’abonnement veut offrir une nouvelle façon d’acheter, différente des commerces traditionnels « pignon sur rue ». C’est aussi un nouveau point de vente pour nos artisan-e-s, et une nouvelle expérience de découverte pour les amateurs et les amatrices de produits de qualité.
  • Nous visons non seulement à mettre en valeur les produits des artistes à travers nos coffrets, mais également à les rémunérer de manière juste pour leur travail. Nous ne croyons pas qu’« offrir de la visibilité » soit suffisant.
  • Notre but est de vous transporter et de vous ouvrir les portes de nombreux ateliers d’artistes de Montréal afin de vous offrir une expérience unique et inspirante. Vous aurez ainsi la chance d’explorer la diversité des produits faits à la main tout en restant dans le confort de votre chez-vous.

Risques & défis

Nous faisons face à plusieurs défis en montant ce projet. Le plus grand est de démontrer que nous avons la capacité et l’expertise de choisir les produits et de les arranger avec soin. Il existe déjà en ligne une saine concurrence pour ce genre de service d'abonnement. Cependant, connaissant ces défis, nous sommes sûrs que nos avantages et notre point de vue unique nous permettent d’offrir un produit de qualité au sein de ce marché. Nos plus grandes forces sont autant la capacité que nous avons de mettre en valeur les produits montréalais, que la relation que nous tissons avec les artisan-e-s de Montréal.  

  • Confection : nous ne cherchons pas à écouler quelconque excédent : nos coffrets et nos séries sont confectionnées avec un soin infini, au terme de discussions participatives allant en profondeur. Nous voulons offrir un artisanat de qualité à notre clientèle. En fait, nous voulons offrir à nos client-e-s une occasion d’élargir leur horizon esthétique.
  • Relation avec les artisan-e-s : nous travaillons étroitement avec les artisan-e-s qui créent les produits que nous agençons dans les coffrets. L’authenticité de notre partenariat est à l’avantage de toutes les personnes impliquées, que ce soit les artistes, notre équipe, ou bien évidemment nos clients!
Autres contributions
Nous apprécions toutes sortes de soutien pour notre projet. Même si vous n’êtes pas en mesure de donner financièrement, tout le monde sait que le bouche-à-oreille est un excellent moyen de faire connaitre une nouvelle entreprise. Si vous aimez notre projet, parlez-en avec votre famille, vos ami-e-s, vos collègues de travail, votre voisin-e, votre chat ou votre chien! N’oubliez pas de partager le projet sur les médias sociaux et faites le connaitre à vos artistes préféré-e-s.

Un gros merci pour votre soutien !

story:
Short Summary

My name is Amanda Clark and I am a multipotentialite! I will soon have my B.S. in Psychology and I am a full-time Christian fiction author, but that's not all I do. I have so many passions that if I listed them all we would be here all day. I am passionate about the human condition and helping others. My desire is to combine all of my skills, experience, and creative nature to create something new. My goal is open a cafe that will become the hub for my community to give back. To allow customers to spend money where is counts and learn about the needs in our community. I want to harness modern day consumerism and turn its eyes to the face of the poor. I don't want to just help homeless people, I want to change their lives and give them a fresh start. Providing jobs, resume/ job search counseling, emotional and financial support. 

What We Need & What You Get

Any money will help! My goal is $3,000 this will allow for the business to began immediately give back to the community by giving me the financial freedom to take on Serving Grace's first project. I am also personally investing, not only my time but financially.

  • The location of the cafe is on Lee University's campus. I would not have to pay rent or utilities which will give us even more financial freedom. 
  • The location has all the equipment I would need to run  a fully functioning coffee shop. This includes a sitting area, free wifi, and bathroom. 
  • Working with wholesale vendors and local bakeries my start up inventory and supply cost will be approximately $1,500
  • Additional funds are required in order to obtain all permits and inspection that are necessary  which will cost $100.
  • Initial advertising/marketing and minor interior decoration will cost $400
  • $700 will then be used for sponsoring our first resume/job fair! Hosted by the Cleveland public library. Money is required to rent space, paper material (for printers etc.)  and supply food/ beverage

The Impact

  • I could start this business myself without your contribution, but it would have to start small and I would be confined by financial needs. This would inhibit my desire to help other by having to serve the needs of the business first. 
  • As soon as the cafe is in business, 50% of the profit goes to helping the homeless
  • Cleveland has six homeless shelters struggling to stay open and are full every night. Beyond the shelters, local parks fill up with homeless people looking for a place to sleep. Your contribution can help change this! We can make a difference!
  • Getting the community and students involved with an ongoing epidemic in our city.

Risks & Challenges

I had a business adviser friend of mine survey the location and market potential. He believes this coffee shop would be profitable immediately and that this was a once in a lifetime opportunity. 

The Challenges: 

This isn't going to be easy and I have zero romanticized notions about how hard it is to own a small business, but I have the work ethic, skills, and passion. I will  make this business not only succeed but redefine our community.

The economy is always changing and small businesses get hit the hardest but with persistent marketing and the purpose driven consumerism I believe we can overcome the uneasy economy. It doesn't hurt that it's located on a college campus! 


Other Ways You Can Help


  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Prayer and positive thoughts are also accepted!
  • Contact me on Facebook, Twitter or my website! www.facebook.com/AuthorAmandaClark                                              @AmandaOClark                                                                  www.writtenbyamandaclark.com

I have so many passions that if I listed them all we would be here all day. I am passionate about the human condition and helping others. My desire is to combine all of my skills, experience, and creative nature to create something new. My goal is open a cafe that will become the hub for my community to give back. To allow customers to spend money where is counts and learn about the needs in our community. I want to harness modern day consumerism and turn its eyes to the face of the poor. I don't want to just help homeless people, I want to change their lives and give them a fresh start. story:
About The Red Hen

Do you remember your favorite story from childhood?  Mine was The Little Red Hen, as told by Florence White Williams.  It is a folk tale that tells the story of a hard working hen who finds a grain of wheat, grows it, and turns it into bread.  Throughout the tale she perseveres against the challenges and succeeds at what seemed like an impossible task.  

That story has stuck with me and remains relevant to me today, though my challenges are slightly different than those of a chicken trying to grow wheat and bake bread.  

My home town currently faces a challenge: there are no "just" book stores that appeal to the local readers and that carry a wide array of books.  I want to answer that challenge, and open a book store for the community-a place people can gather, a place to learn new things, a place for children to come to and create memories (most of my earliest memories revolve around books and stories).  

Here's where the Red Hen is asking for help:

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for $5,000 to cover licensing fees and getting a website established, so I can start selling and generating business while I work on the "bricks" part of the clicks and bricks model.  

Once the initial goal is met, additional funds will be directed toward the costs and development of the "bricks"-establishing a book store that people can visit to find books or conversation.

What's in it for you?

My everlasting gratitude-any amount will make a difference, just like a single grain of wheat grows into a head of wheat with many grains.  

Knowledge that your contribution will ultimately benefit a community-once the bricks are in place, classes in life skills will be made available to the community, reading incentives will be provided to encourage children to read, and the money spent at the store will be recirculated into the community.

The Next Step

The next step from your contribution-a website is set up, and I start doing business and building up community awareness of the business.  From that point, a physical location is the next goal.  Once I have the funds, The Red Hen will move into a brick and mortar location, and I will be able to expand my inventory, start community classes in life skills, and provide a meeting place for early readers and avid book lovers to get together.  Ideally, this will happen this year.  Realistically, it may not, but this Red Hen likes to shoot for the ideal.

Challenges and Risks

The immediate challenge facing The Red Hen right now is getting off the ground.  Once up and moving, the challenges keep coming, just as the Little Red Hen faced many challenges in her story.  And just as the Little Red Hen kept moving forward, so will the store, meeting each challenge as it comes, and addressing or avoiding risks that come up.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can share our story-with friends, with family, with everyone.
  • Once you have made your contribution, give us a share.
  • Once the website is up and running, stop by and see how we are doing.
