story:
Hello!

My name is Andrei Filatov. Im 24 years old and I live and work in Shanghai, China. First time I came here in 2010 to study Chinese language(Ni Hao!) in Fudan University and since then I can call Shanghai my home. I remember this crazy week I had when I just came here, NOBODY speaks English, everything is in Chinese(of course, you’re in China! Haha) and me standing outside the airport and thinking where to go and how to get there... After 5 years spent here I want to apply all the knowledge and experience I have to provide affordable and cozy place to stay for people who travel around or moving to Shanghai!

Shanghai is a huge city which brings people from all around the world in one place. Every year more than 133 million people visits China, they come here to experience how 4000 year old culture blends with the beauty of a modern world. Foodies can find great variety of cuisines here, from the diverse regions of China to newest techniques of molecular gastronomy. Students come to study in best universities around China! Shanghai can fit any persons needs and many of them already enjoy what it has to offer!

LunaPark Capsule Hostel

Since I graduated in my university where my specialty was Hospitality, I always had a dream of owning a hotel, small and cozy where you can greet your clients and be in the epicenter of its life. I hope that LunaPark is a big step towards my dream and with Your help we'll be able to do it! As you might understand from the name, LunaPark will be not just regular hostel, it will be Capsule hostel, which means that instead of beds we'll provide personal capsules with lots of features inside!


 Also we already ordered August Smart Lock and August Doorbell Cam, so our guests can access hostel any time just with a push of a button! No keys needed! In future we plan on embedding latest smart-home technologies in our hostel.

Our hostel will be located near Peoples Square in the center of Shanghai. It's close to most attractions in the city, you can walk around The Bund and enjoy the view, make a shopping tour on Nanjing Road, have a wonderful dinner at Xintiandi or just relax at Yu Garden all within walking distance!

What will the money be used for?

As for now I managed to secure the apartment and order some of the tech. But to convert this place in a caplsule hostel we will need capsules, lockers and also I would like to renovate the bathrooms! After negotiations with the factory I concluded that I will need 10000USD to finish everything! This money will go towards purchasing this items:

- 12 Capsules(6 for Ladies room and 6 for Guys)
- Lockers
- Bathrooms renovation(showers, toilets)
- Big Living room sofa to enjoy TV and PS4
- Wall mounted desk for PC's

As a thank you for helping us reach our goal LunaPark can offer some amazing perks!

$5 Donation - You're amazing! We'll put your name on our Funders Wall of Fame! Thank you for your help and stay tuned!


* It will look alike!=)

$25 Donation - I will send you handwritten Thank you! message on a Shanghai postcard!  Also you will get some stickers with LunaPark logo and your name will be on our Funders Wall of Fame!

$50 Donation - Get our limited edition Luna Park funders snapback! You'll also get cool stickers, Thank you! postcard aaand a spot on our Funders Wall of Fame!

$100 Donation - We appreciate your time and contribution in our dream, so next time you will be around don't worry - you have a place to crush! This perk gives you 100USD Gift Card + Snapback + Stickers + Post Card aaaand a spot in our Funders Wall of Fame!

$500 Donation - Oh my! We're ENORMOUSLY thankful! This time we'll name one of our Capsules with the name you came up! Your Signature Capsule, sounds cool! Also you'll get our Gift Certificate and all previously mentioned perks! Thank you!

$1000 Donation - You'll be our biggest contributor and we are ready to give you almost anything! Hah! This time you'll be the one to come up with your perk!
*Some terms and conditions may apply!


I totally understand if you can not contribute to my campaign but I would appreciate if you can help me to spread the word about it and share it with your friends!
Enormous Thank you to all of you who help me to build this amazing hostel!

Xiexie and once again Thank You!
Andrei

story:
Short Summary

HAUTE GOAT FARM is a place where visitors of all ages can really get back to basics - animals, nature, food in their natural environment. This is a place to feel truly alive, explore, discover and be inspired. Our goal is to build on what we've already established and create even more unique and engaging experiences for visitors to the farm.  Where getting back to basics is about to get even better!  We invite you to help us fund this ambitious growth and help us realize those dreams.


The Impact

We live in a time in which cities are consuming the land that once provided natural healthy foods and a lifestyle to sustain us.  Haute Goat Farm is a magical alternative,  if for only a few hours, for those who are willing to venture 5 minutes north of Canada's busiest thoroughfare, the 401 - less than an hour from Toronto. We offer young and old alike an opportunity to stop, breathe fresh air, engage with our farm animals and experience nature in many different ways.  We don't take people back in history, but share a vision of the future through a traditional, thoughtful updated lens.  

  

BACKGROUND

Shain and I, like so many people, dreamed of getting a piece of land in the country. Shain's idea was to have a 'country place' to retire to - My idea was to have the horses and goats I'd always longed for.  We found our little piece of heaven on 25 acres in eastern Ontario.  And when we brought home our first Nigerian Dwarf goats, we fell madly in love.  These wee beasties don't just steal your heart - they run away with it forever...

It wasn't too long before were looking for ways to share them with others.  So, just about 2 years ago, we started a small company called HAUTE GOAT as a way to celebrate all things goat (ours in particular), and to get back in touch with our roots, the land, farm animals,  local food.

 

We invited people to the farm and to learn more about where their food comes from, how it is grown, all about our adorable goats and most of all a chance to 'get back to basics' in a way that you never could in the city.  The tours have become so popular, we added a visit to Shain's Shiitake lodge to see how those mushrooms are grown.

And no tour is complete without meeting our Icelandic horses, Lukka, Fabeina and Rocky...

Clearly people (especially people from the city) crave getting in touch with farm animals, the country, fresh, local food and all the things that remind us of where we come from.  


GETTING BACK TO BASICS IS ABOUT TO GET EVEN BETTER

In the summer of 2015 we had the incredible luck to find and buy a 200 acre farm just one hour east of Toronto and we began to imagine the possibilities.

We decided to turn to crowdfunding to help grow the experience for our visitors to include even more.  

It's ambitious, a little grand, and it's all very exciting.  We hope you agree and join us in the next stage of this adventure.


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $33,700 for some ambitious new initiatives.  These will build on the great things we've already established and make the experience for visitors even better.

* SECRET GARDEN AND LIVING WOODLAND - Cost - $10,700

To be designed by nature conceptualist, educator and professional garden designer Carolyn Lecker, visitors are invited to walk the paths and explore what is natural here and what has been more recently nurtured as a complimentary life industry of shiitake mushroom zones.

In the secret garden, visitors will come across tall educational "totems"...   information trees between the other trees.  Conclude your walk with a living library of tree trunk tables and benches with weather protected books of information and detail about this marvellous "forest population."

* FARM KID ZONE - Cost $10,500

Led by Julie Tufts, the Farm Kids program is designed just for kids.  Letting them experience the farm animals up close and personal, giving them a chance to dig in the garden to plant and then harvest vegetables, this area just for them will be pint-size and kid-friendly.


* ALPACA MOUNTAIN - Cost - $12,500

We are adding Huacaya Alpacas to our family.  This opens up the world of fibre to Haute Goat and we're pretty excited about that.  Alpaca fibre is incredibly light, comfortable and is hypoallergenic because it has no lanolin.  And a bonus!  Alpaca poop (called 'beans') is (second to goat poop) some of the best garden fertilizer for vegetable gardens and can be used fresh from the pasture.   And if all of that weren't enough, they are the most gentle, sweet natured animals.

UNIQUE PERKS

We've put together a fun list of perks to choose from.  This is our way of thanking you for your sponsorship and giving something unique back.  


About Us   

Debbie Nightingale and Shain Jaffe

When Shain asked Debbie, eight years ago, if she'd like to buy a farm in the country - after she picked herself up off the ground, she said 'yes' at the speed of light. Shain, a true urbanite, successful literary agent and theatre producer, must have lost his mind for just a moment she figured.  Debbie had a small, but successful television production company in Toronto but she'd always loved the country and animals. Three weeks later, they found themselves the owners of a magical 25 acre property in Campbellford, Ontario.  For two years, Shain and Debbie commuted between city and farm.  In 2009 when Shain decided to retire, Debbie leaped at the opportunity to bring home goats.  The impossibly cute Nigerian Dwarf Goats who don't just have the sweetest, richest milk of all the goat breeds, but steal your heart and run away with them.  Those first 4 goats, grew into a herd of 30 or more (depending on the season) and became the inspiration for the business that has become Haute Goat.

Juliette Tufts

A teacher with more than 25 years of Primary and Special Education teaching, curriculum development and recreation experience. A graduate of Laurentian University, obtaining an honours degree in Physical Health/Education and a Bachelor of Education degree from Nipissing University. Juliette and her husband of 37 years moved to the Northumberland area, where they embarked on owning and running their own small cottage resort on Rice Lake. There three children are experiencing their careers in Australia, Europe and Peterborough. Juliette's love of animals, nature and the farm life has led her to Haute Goat. 

Carolyn Lecker

“A Living Woodland” is a creation of Carolyn Lecker, a nature conceptualist, educator and professional garden designer. Carolyn is the Director and designer of the award winning Black Walnut Educational Gardens, in Prince Edward County, where innumerable gardens; heritage; medicinal; exotic and notably the Fragrant Tactile Garden for the Visually Challenged are situated on a 17 acre site. The facility showcases gardens both for their beauty and inspiration but also as a tool in learning. There is an emphasis on intergenerational activity (seniors and at-risk youth). Visiting classes; school age and university come for programming and many others of many ages visit from around the world participating in tours, workshops, special programs and occasionally volunteer. 

As a designer, Carolyn is a specialist in raised bed gardening, sustainable landscape, rooftop horticulture and forest gardening. As a visiting lecturer, Carolyn has brought her focus of gentle permaculture and sustainability to three continents. 

In Canada, Carolyn has been featured for her gardening expertise at Canada Blooms; a Master Gardener Series and on CBC Ideas. Her published work has included books – “Raised Beds and Symphonies”;  “A Sensory Garden”; and currently is in the midst of creating a series on “Animal Architecture”  - the first three books already published for school curriculum and the complete series available this Spring in bookstores.


GIVE what you can - pick a perk on the right! We'll send you project updates - new perks, photos, campaign events, and all things Haute Goat.  

Then, SHARE. Tell the world you've contributed and that they should too! It’s super easy -like us, tweet us, give us a shout out on social media using our handle @hautegoat, and/or share the link via email with family and friends. Thank you!

* ALPACA MOUNTAIN - Cost - $12,500

We are adding Huacaya Alpacas to our family.  This opens up the world of fibre to Haute Goat and we're pretty excited about that.  Alpaca fibre is incredibly light, comfortable and is hypoallergenic because it has no lanolin.  And a bonus!  Alpaca poop (called 'beans') is (second to goat poop) some of the best garden fertilizer for vegetable gardens and can be used fresh from the pasture.   And if all of that weren't enough, they are the most gentle, sweet natured animals.

UNIQUE PERKS
We've put together a fun list of perks to choose from.  This is our way of thanking you for your sponsorship and giving something unique back.     
About Us   




Debbie Nightingale and Shain Jaffe

When Shain asked Debbie, eight years ago, if she'd like to buy a farm in the country - after she picked herself up off the ground, she said 'yes' at the speed of light. Shain, a true urbanite, successful literary agent and theatre producer, must have lost his mind for just a moment she figured.  Debbie had a small, but successful television production company in Toronto but she'd always loved the country and animals. Three weeks later, they found themselves the owners of a magical 25 acre property in Campbellford, Ontario.  For two years, Shain and Debbie commuted between city and farm.  In 2009 when Shain decided to retire, Debbie leaped at the opportunity to bring home goats.  The impossibly cute Nigerian Dwarf Goats who don't just have the sweetest, richest milk of all the goat breeds, but steal your heart and run away with them.  Those first 4 goats, grew into a herd of 30 or more (depending on the season) and became the inspiration for the business that has become Haute Goat.
Juliette Tufts

A teacher with more than 25 years of Primary and Special Education teaching, curriculum development and recreation experience. A graduate of Laurentian University, obtaining an honours degree in Physical Health/Education and a Bachelor of Education degree from Nipissing University. Juliette and her husband of 37 years moved to the Northumberland area, where they embarked on owning and running their own small cottage resort on Rice Lake. There three children are experiencing their careers in Australia, Europe and Peterborough. Juliette's love of animals, nature and the farm life has led her to Haute Goat. 
Carolyn Lecker

“A Living Woodland” is a creation of Carolyn Lecker, a nature conceptualist, educator and professional garden designer. Carolyn is the Director and designer of the award winning Black Walnut Educational Gardens, in Prince Edward County, where innumerable gardens; heritage; medicinal; exotic and notably the Fragrant Tactile Garden for the Visually Challenged are situated on a 17 acre site. The facility showcases gardens both for their beauty and inspiration but also as a tool in learning. There is an emphasis on intergenerational activity (seniors and at-risk youth). Visiting classes; school age and university come for programming and many others of many ages visit from around the world participating in tours, workshops, special programs and occasionally volunteer. 
As a designer, Carolyn is a specialist in raised bed gardening, sustainable landscape, rooftop horticulture and forest gardening. As a visiting lecturer, Carolyn has brought her focus of gentle permaculture and sustainability to three continents. 
In Canada, Carolyn has been featured for her gardening expertise at Canada Blooms; a Master Gardener Series and on CBC Ideas. Her published work has included books – “Raised Beds and Symphonies”;  “A Sensory Garden”; and currently is in the midst of creating a series on “Animal Architecture”  - the first three books already published for school curriculum and the complete series available this Spring in bookstores.



GIVE what you can - pick a perk on the right! We'll send you project updates - new perks, photos, campaign events, and all things Haute Goat.  
Then, SHARE. Tell the world you've contributed and that they should too! It’s super easy -like us, tweet us, give us a shout out on social media using our handle @hautegoat, and/or share the link via email with family and friends. Thank you!

story:
SO WHAT'S LIBRA COFFEE DOING? 

Libra Coffee is launching an online coffee subscription service with an important social mission: provide clean drinking water to the communities where our coffee beans are sourced. We are obsessive about roasting the best coffee in the world and delivering your special beans straight to your doorstep. Also, we are dedicated to helping our supply chain stay healthy and strong through our clean water initiative. 



WHY WATER?

In countries like Ethiopia - the origin of coffee and home to some of the best coffee in the world -  about 40% of the population doesn't have safe water to drink. 

And what makes the water so unsafe? Lets look at Central America, where during the dry season, people must drink from contaminated water sources. Communities often drink from the same water source as they wash their clothes, take baths and even throw their trash. Contaminated water often leads to ecoli poisoning and disease. E-coli makes national headlines in the U.S. for contamination at Chipotle, but goes unnoticed in poverty-stricken countries every day.

This is where Libra Coffee comes in. With every bag of coffee purchased, two people will gain access to clean drinking water for 5 years.  We do this by donating a portion of every sale to provide these communities with extra-strength water filters that eliminate 99.99% of all harmful bacteria. Each water filter lasts a minimum of five years, and can support at least 100 peoples' clean drinking water needs.  


OK, I'M GETTING INTERESTED... MORE ABOUT LIBRA. 

Hi, my name is Eric Medina, and I'm the founder of Libra Coffee.  I am so passionate about coffee that I have a Master's Degree from Italy in the  Science  & Economy of Coffee. This education not only provides me the know-how to roast and prepare quality coffee, but also has helped me establish close relationships with farmers all over the world.  These connections allow me to effectively source traceable and ethical coffee beans while providing a distribution channel for getting water filters to farming communities that need them most. In 2015, I acquired a roasting facility in Oceanside, California, where I have been experimenting and perfecting my roasting technique. 


LET'S DO THIS!

Our goal is to provide 10,000 people with clean water at year-end. Every bit of support gets us get closer to our goal - so we appreciate any financial contribution you can afford and please share on social media. 

LASTLY, DON'T FORGET TO CHECK THE GALLERY FOR IMAGES OF THE PERKS. AND ALL ORDERS WILL BE SHIPPED AFTER THE CAMPAIGN.

story:
Video de présentation, cliquez ici


Salukes ! 

Bière Dikkenek est un projet qui mûrit depuis 4 ans dans la tête de Dave. Le projet est animé d'une envie de partager des bons moments autour d'une bière spéciale, mais également revendiquer que l'on aime ça. Consommer la bière et adhérer au projet Dikkenek, c'est une façon de s'inscrire dans un esprit " à la belge" avec tout ce qu'on lui connait :  humour, bon goût, bonne compagnie, autodérision, compromis et surréalisme. Dikkenek, ce terme est compris par un flamand, wallon, bruxellois, français. C'est aussi un petit clin d'oeil au film qui est sorti le 21 juin 2006 et à son humour bien belge et "décalé". 

La bière est brassée en périphérie bruxelloise à la Belgoo Brewery, elle est blonde et titre à 6,7 % Vol. Alc. Elle bénéficie d'une franche amertume persistante avec une subtile note florale et une fine saveur mandarine, c'est clairement une bière de soif. Elle est le fruit d'une collaboration entre Jo Van Aert, brasseur/propriétaire et David Blocteur, consultant indépendant pour micro brasseries et actif dans le milieu brassicole depuis plus de 10 ans. La recette a été élaborée à la base par David Blocteur lors de sessions de brassages "en amateur" pour ensuite être finalisée par JO Van Aert.

Cet esprit, David B (gembloutois d'origine), l'a développé lors de ses années d'études supérieures à Bruxelles. Institut Coremans, EPFC et surtout au cercle Hermes lors de guindailles estudiantines dans les divers cercles de l'ULB et des sorties dans les marolles. 

Le projet a besoin de vous ! 

Crowdfunding = financement participatif. ici, nous sommes dans le cadre d'un financement participatif avec contreparties.

Cela signifie que pour une somme investie, vous contribuez à l'expansion du projet. En échange vous recevez des goodies à hauteur de l'investissement, mais vous devenez également membre d'une communauté. Vous serez invités chaque année à participer à une soirée Dikkenek. Ce sera l'occasion d'échanger les avis, déguster en priorité un nouveau brassin. La communauté aura toujours un privilège de priorité sur l'information, sur les nouveautés.

Dans le cadre de ce crowdfunding, votre aide est précieuse pour investir dans l'achat de matériels utiles à la bonne distribution de la bière. Dans un premier temps, il est nécessaire d'investir dans des fûts en inox (300 pièces) et dans des casiers en plastique (2000 pièces).

Le premier brassage a eu lieu le 9 mars. Il y a 24 hectolitres de bière blonde prête à être mise en fût et en bouteille.

Un deuxième brassage a eu lieu ce vendredi 13 mai afin d'assurer la continuité de la distribution à partir de son lancement le 3 juin prochain. 

Lors de sa sortie, une liste des endroits où vous pourrez la déguster et l'acheter sera publiée. (Envoyée par mail et/ou publiée sur la page Facebook)

Les ingrédients : 4 malts ; Pilsen, Pale Ale, Munich, Malt de blé et 3 houblons : Hallertau Perle, Chinook et Cascade.

Ce que vous recevrez en contrepartie de votre contribution ? 

Cela va du stickers au verre, en passant par un décapsuleur personnalisé, un t-shirt, une casquette, le droit de participer au brassage de la bière, des fûts offerts pour fêter un anniversaire ou organiser un barbecue, .... Bref, il y a vraiment de quoi se faire plaisir.

Sans oublier, l'invitation à participer le 3 juin 2016 à partir de 19h au lancement de la bière dans un établissement sélectionné pour son esprit "Dikkenek" 

Si vous n'êtes pas disponibles ce jour là, pas de panique il y aura d'autres occasions de se rattraper. Votre package, vous sera remis dans les semaines qui suivent.

Chaque année, il y aura une Dikkenek Party à laquelle tous les crowdfunders seront conviés. 

Pas de compte Paypal ou de carte Visa ? 

Aucun problème, un compte bancaire est spécialement ouvert pour y transférer votre participation financière. Le montant sera automatiquement prit en compte sur la page de indiegogo/Dikkenek crowdfunding. Vous pourrez,ainsi, y suivre l'évolution. Demande de ce numéro via le petit lien "poser une question" en surbrillance rose en haut à droite de la page,

 juste au dessus de la mention " Montant recueilli"

Mille fois merci :)

Dave

Votre package, vous sera remis dans les semaines qui suivent.Chaque année, il y aura une Dikkenek Party à laquelle tous les crowdfunders seront conviés. Pas de compte Paypal ou de carte Visa ? Aucun problème, un compte bancaire est spécialement ouvert pour y transférer votre participation financière. story:
***This campaign runs from 1 April - 30 April 2016 

You know us Vegans are crazy right!? 

 What’s an even CRAZIER idea than to ‘convince’ 1 Billion people to join our ‘cult’ – yes? 

...And all in the name of “World Peace” 

Even more insane! I know right? Who do I think I am, Miss Universe or something?! 

What if it works? What if it’s just CRAZY enough TO work? 

What if it’s SO ‘extreme’ we could ACTUALLY create some REAL changes on our planet? 

Imagine if we had 1 Billion people experiment with being Vegan for just 4 weeks? 

I’m Bev Buckley and I’ve been full on Vegan for nearly a year now. 

It’s been an amazing adventure so far and it just keeps getting better, I almost feel like I have ‘come out of the closet’, and I don’t have to follow a belief system that doesn’t support my values anymore (aka – Carnism).

Growing up I didn’t even know there was such a thing as ‘Vegan’… as I’m sure you may have had the same experience. Now, being Vegan is becoming more and more ‘normal’. 

Most people choose to go Vegan because they are concerned for the massive amount of animals enduring huge amounts of suffering. 

In honesty, that fact did contribute to my choice of becoming Vegan, but it wasn’t my main reason. 

My main reason for choosing to be Vegan was because Vegan food just tastes better, I had SO much more energy!  I had given up so many of the foods that caused me discomfort, it was just the logical next step, I couldn't live my life with pain anymore.

It was a process, it didn’t happen overnight, and it was challenging. Mostly because our mass society REALLY doesn’t support this way of living and neither do most of our family or friends.

It’s also such an inbred, indoctrinated belief system that has been made ‘familiar’ to us from birth! We are taught that eating meat, dairy and animal products is: Natural, Normal and Necessary ...

But is it really?

I now have so many friends who are Vegan and who had the VERY SAME issues as me, when exploring the Vegan lifestyle. 

We all want to be accepted and most of the time being vegan isn’t acceptable.

I feel very strongly about giving everyone an opportunity to at least experiment being Vegan for a month and FEEL what it feels like. 

I began thinking of what I could do to contribute and assist in ‘BEING THE CHANGE’.

I came across a book by Will Tuttle called the “World Peace Diet”, long story short he came to South Africa and gave an AMAZING talk. 

After his talk, as we were leaving I saw a book by Master Ching Hai which we were given. In the book she says: 

Now I don’t really know how viable it is, I mean 8 weeks… really?

We could certainly make some dramatic changes just by having 10 000 more people giving Veganism a ‘test drive’. BUT to my mind …

…ones that naysayers say are ‘impossible’, ‘impractical’ or ‘unrealistic’…

So, I set up this campaign for our planet, our beloved Mother Earth, Pachamama, Gaia, Tara and so many other names we give her, she gives us life. I feel very strongly that it’s up to US to ‘Be the change’ we want to see in the world. To wait for the corporations to catch up – will quite frankly never happen.

One of the most intimate relationships we can have on this planet is the food we eat, water we drink and air we breath. All three are being polluted and we are contributing to the destruction (whether we know it or not). Our Standard American/African/Asian Diet (SAD) is no longer sustainable, are you going to give Vegan 4 Good a go?

…to one of reverent respect, kindness and love for all beings, but most importantly yourself. I believe experimenting with being vegan is one of the kindest things you can do for YOU.

The truth is it’s gonna take more of us for this to happen, to sign up and share the message. This is a co-creative project, I have the idea, the platform, the support system and the program, everything for YOU to succeed. 

                                   CLICK HERE TO WATCH THE 'PERKS' VIDEO

… that is versatile enough to make it more raw or substitute alternative Vegan options. It is also relative to different parts of the world that may not have ‘ready made’ Vegan products or restaurants in your country. (Trust me in South Africa Vegan options are few and far between). 

… to make it easy to buy your goodies 


… to keep you motivated 


… where you can ask any questions or get advice too 


… of favorite recipes and more Vegan recipes from other Vegan fundies and foodies 


 … where you can ask questions, share stories and recipes or give/get advice 


… in your area, from restaurants to nutritionists, chefs and vegan produce creators (this will be developed as our reach grows) 

I know RIGHT! I told you being Vegan makes you crazy! Everything is delivered electronically – since I’m all for being more sustainable, let’s go for the quickest, easiest and simplest route.

Become a part of our support system for transitioning Vegans Contribute a recipe or success tip for aspiring Vegans with recognition

Be listed on our Vegan 4 Good website as a contributor  

Be mentioned/featured in our Vegan 4 Good Recipe book

Be mentioned/featured on our Facebook Group page

Be mentioned/featured/interviewed in or on our coaching videos

*Limited to 40 of each category see the perks :-) 

Good for YOU! You can support by choosing the $1 option, you wont get the program but you will be included and recognized as one of the Billion people who MADE HISTORY!

We love you! Most of my family still eat meat, this is about educating and enlightening EVERYONE to make their OWN choice! 

You may still love animals and support the vision for World Peace, but may just find that you don’t want to or cant stop eating meat. 

We are not intending to force anyone into anything. 

You are welcome to support too for $1, and take a look at why we are so PASSIONATE as Vegans. 

In this campaign I have structured it to break the BIG 1 Billion People Target down into smaller, more attainable targets. Meaning I will run 8 campaigns, consisting of a launch month (to spread the word) and a ACTION/fulfillment month, where we will do the 1 month Vegan 4 Good experience and support each other and others exploring being vegan for the first time.

Each meal plan will be different from the last, Ill have new coaching videos and interviews with more experts too. This is intended to be a very dynamic, ever expanding campaign and I will be documenting everything in this process.

When this gains more momentum more people will hear and know about it, and then decide to join us.

It's also up to YOU to share it :-) - if we can exponentialize it to the power of 10 in each round we will be that much closer to the end target of 1 Billion people Vegan for a month.

Of course if it is done sooner then that will be even MORE AWESOME!

I must be honest, I am excited and scared all at the same time! I wonder what amazing possibilities this will open up for ALL of us!

Here is a video of me explaining the strategy:

**Timeline to Success Vegan 4 Good Video

And here is a simple idea of the timeline and targets I have set for us to reach:

Simply choose your perk on the right hand side of the page, pledge your amount and BOOM! You will have taken the first step with us to an amazing adventure of being Vegan for 4 weeks. 

The rewards will be fulfilled from the last week of April, since we want you to prepare to start the 4 week program as a group collective on May 1st 2016.

The target for this campaign (Round 1)  is 100 - 1000 people (or more), and you can share and encourage your friends and family to join too. 

When we reach or exceed the target, the next rounds target will be higher, so we could even have 1 billion people be Vegan for a month in our first round! What amazing things are possible?

I ask that when you choose to do this with us for the 4 weeks, join the Facebook group, join us on the coaching calls, ask questions and for support. That is the whole reason I put this together, because the No.1 thing that holds us back is a weak support system. Support yourself and ask for support.

We can DO THIS!

Facebook Vegan 4 Good

Youtube Vegan 4 Good

 Ok… I have a confession to make… I’m a tree hugging fairy that believes in riding rainbows on unicorns. You got me!

I love dancing with bunnies and butterflies in my spare time (which is most of the time). I laugh more than I frown and I think I might be addicted to raw chocolate.

I’m more in LOVE with myself and my life now than ever. I feel as if I can just be myself and that’s ok. I believe that the number one thing that is contributing to ALL of this is the fact that I have become Vegan. 

My wish is that every human being on earth could feel how great this feels, which is why I started this Indigogo campaign.

If I could choose to leave any legacy it would definitely be ‘The fairy who inspired one billion people to be Vegan for a month and sparked the initiation of world peace’. 

So if you feel like you would like to be a part of this amazing adventure, back this campaign.

Also, since I love hugging trees, I firmly feel that there should be plenty more on the planet. So whatever profits get generated from this campaign I have full intention of buying lots of land and planting food forests with lots of cacao (chocolate) trees, and retreat center where you can come for a magical Vegan getaway too!

In the book she says: Now I don’t really know how viable it is, I mean 8 weeks… really?We could certainly make some dramatic changes just by having 10 000 more people giving Veganism a ‘test drive’. BUT to my mind ……ones that naysayers say are ‘impossible’, ‘impractical’ or ‘unrealistic’…So, I set up this campaign for our planet, our beloved Mother Earth, Pachamama, Gaia, Tara and so many other names we give her, she gives us life. I feel very strongly that it’s up to US to ‘Be the change’ we want to see in the world. To wait for the corporations to catch up – will quite frankly never happen.One of the most intimate relationships we can have on this planet is the food we eat, water we drink and air we breath. All three are being polluted and we are contributing to the destruction (whether we know it or not). Our Standard American/African/Asian Diet (SAD) is no longer sustainable, are you going to give Vegan 4 Good a go?…to one of reverent respect, kindness and love for all beings, but most importantly yourself. I believe experimenting with being vegan is one of the kindest things you can do for YOU.The truth is it’s gonna take more of us for this to happen, to sign up and share the message. This is a co-creative project, I have the idea, the platform, the support system and the program, everything for YOU to succeed.                                    CLICK HERE TO WATCH THE 'PERKS' VIDEO
… that is versatile enough to make it more raw or substitute alternative Vegan options. It is also relative to different parts of the world that may not have ‘ready made’ Vegan products or restaurants in your country. (Trust me in South Africa Vegan options are few and far between). … to make it easy to buy your goodies … to keep you motivated … where you can ask any questions or get advice too … of favorite recipes and more Vegan recipes from other Vegan fundies and foodies  … where you can ask questions, share stories and recipes or give/get advice … in your area, from restaurants to nutritionists, chefs and vegan produce creators (this will be developed as our reach grows) I know RIGHT! I told you being Vegan makes you crazy! Everything is delivered electronically – since I’m all for being more sustainable, let’s go for the quickest, easiest and simplest route.Become a part of our support system for transitioning Vegans Contribute a recipe or success tip for aspiring Vegans with recognitionBe listed on our Vegan 4 Good website as a contributor  Be mentioned/featured in our Vegan 4 Good Recipe bookBe mentioned/featured on our Facebook Group pageBe mentioned/featured/interviewed in or on our coaching videos*Limited to 40 of each category see the perks :-) Good for YOU! You can support by choosing the $1 option, you wont get the program but you will be included and recognized as one of the Billion people who MADE HISTORY!We love you! Most of my family still eat meat, this is about educating and enlightening EVERYONE to make their OWN choice! You may still love animals and support the vision for World Peace, but may just find that you don’t want to or cant stop eating meat. We are not intending to force anyone into anything. You are welcome to support too for $1, and take a look at why we are so PASSIONATE as Vegans. In this campaign I have structured it to break the BIG 1 Billion People Target down into smaller, more attainable targets. Meaning I will run 8 campaigns, consisting of a launch month (to spread the word) and a ACTION/fulfillment month, where we will do the 1 month Vegan 4 Good experience and support each other and others exploring being vegan for the first time.Each meal plan will be different from the last, Ill have new coaching videos and interviews with more experts too. This is intended to be a very dynamic, ever expanding campaign and I will be documenting everything in this process.When this gains more momentum more people will hear and know about it, and then decide to join us.It's also up to YOU to share it :-) - if we can exponentialize it to the power of 10 in each round we will be that much closer to the end target of 1 Billion people Vegan for a month.Of course if it is done sooner then that will be even MORE AWESOME!I must be honest, I am excited and scared all at the same time! I wonder what amazing possibilities this will open up for ALL of us!Here is a video of me explaining the strategy:**Timeline to Success Vegan 4 Good VideoAnd here is a simple idea of the timeline and targets I have set for us to reach:Simply choose your perk on the right hand side of the page, pledge your amount and BOOM! You will have taken the first step with us to an amazing adventure of being Vegan for 4 weeks. The rewards will be fulfilled from the last week of April, since we want you to prepare to start the 4 week program as a group collective on May 1st 2016.The target for this campaign (Round 1)  is 100 - 1000 people (or more), and you can share and encourage your friends and family to join too. When we reach or exceed the target, the next rounds target will be higher, so we could even have 1 billion people be Vegan for a month in our first round! What amazing things are possible?I ask that when you choose to do this with us for the 4 weeks, join the Facebook group, join us on the coaching calls, ask questions and for support. That is the whole reason I put this together, because the No.1 thing that holds us back is a weak support system. Support yourself and ask for support.We can DO THIS!Facebook Vegan 4 GoodYoutube Vegan 4 Good Ok… I have a confession to make… I’m a tree hugging fairy that believes in riding rainbows on unicorns. You got me!I love dancing with bunnies and butterflies in my spare time (which is most of the time). I laugh more than I frown and I think I might be addicted to raw chocolate.I’m more in LOVE with myself and my life now than ever. I feel as if I can just be myself and that’s ok. I believe that the number one thing that is contributing to ALL of this is the fact that I have become Vegan. My wish is that every human being on earth could feel how great this feels, which is why I started this Indigogo campaign.If I could choose to leave any legacy it would definitely be ‘The fairy who inspired one billion people to be Vegan for a month and sparked the initiation of world peace’. So if you feel like you would like to be a part of this amazing adventure, back this campaign.Also, since I love hugging trees, I firmly feel that there should be plenty more on the planet. So whatever profits get generated from this campaign I have full intention of buying lots of land and planting food forests with lots of cacao (chocolate) trees, and retreat center where you can come for a magical Vegan getaway too!

story:
Want to take a breake and don't know where to go?

Travel should be fun and happy moment, but what if you want to take a break, have a lunch or find a place to sleep and you don’t have time to organize everything in advance?

KlikCup will find the right place for you in fast and easy way. In two clicks you can have a list of bars, restaurants or accommodation facilities starting from your position or from the place that you choose,

KlikCup is your guide for restaurants, bars and an accommodation facilities. Choose your place from three categories;

     1. Drinks

When you are looking for a place to have a drink or to go out, check out the large bars list, their description, photos and visitor comments.

  • Events is a subcategory that offers a everyday real-time updated events like concerts, party drinks and others. About events you will find all details that you need like event time, description and event photo. Enjoy and have fun!

     2. Food

Easiest way to find all types of restaurants and to choose the right one for you with help of restaurants' description, verified photos and visitors comments. KlikCup offers you online menus updated at least once in a month.

  • Daily offer/brunch is a subcategory that offers you updated daily offer for every restaurant that offers a brunch to it's guests. Don't wast time looking for printed flyers, check out everything online and in few clicks. 

     3. Accommodation

Make a reservation from large accommodation offer. Check out facility and room equipment and find the best room for you with help of visitors reviews and their comments.

  • Reservation You can book and cancel every room directly with accommodation facility. Fast reservation without any commission for the guests or for the facility. Our goal is to make everybody happy.

What is KlikCup

KlikCup is a revolutionary website and only platform in the world where facility management can communicate directly with their costumers on global level offering them real time updated information.

  • In this time of modern technology, it is strange that it doesn't exist a common website for bars where they can offer their service at one place and on global level. With KlikCup, bars will have the possibility to upload events and at the same time, users have a real time updated data on bar locations and their happenings.
  • Updating own online menu is not a common thing for every restaurant but KlikCup gives the possibility to easy update restaurant menu and daily offers to wide audience and at the same time costumers have modern and online menu of their restaurants in their hands.
  • Today online accommodation booking service is too expensive for facility owners where they are literally being robbed. With most popular travel websites commission can go to 30% of room price. Due to high rates, owners are forced to add this commission to room price and in this way their rooms are more expensive to their clients. At the same time, owners have lower profit from renting these rooms. Through KlikCup platform, facilities manage reservations directly with their costumers. Reservation offer to wide audience, with no commission is a “dream come true” to every owner.

How KlikCup was created

Idea for KlikCup came to me when I was visiting beautiful city of Bratislava in Slovakia. After a long walk exploring the city I wanted to take a brake and drink a coffee. Since it was my first visit to Bratislava, I didn't know the city and where to go, but I wanted to see more and I didn't had time to waste.

I saw a small bar sign in city center and I decided to take a chance because the bar outside looked more like a warehouse than like a bar. When I entered, I was amazed. Beautiful interior with story behind it and the location in a historical building.

I thought to myself that it is a shame that there is no way to share this story to others. Luckily this bar was in city center and I was wondering what is with others in side streets?

In that moment i decided to create a tool that will give me reliable information in few seconds, verified description given by the facility management but also visitor comments to make the best decision.

I wanted to help others with the same problem but also those looking for a restaurant or a place to sleep. I wanted to help travelers but also facilities to promote them, to tell the real story. Let them communicate between themselves. 

KlikCup today

First KlikCup website has been developed to make market research and it is still active on domain www.klikcup.com. We wanted to show the idea to wide public and to gather opinions. Now when the project is completed, the old website is being replaced with new platform and modern design.This customized platform is designed by numerous clients’ specification, with adapted database that is able to accept more than 10 million users.

What We Need 

New website platform creation started in 01 October and will take additional 5 to 6 months. For this project, we took the service of the best IT specialists in the country. This professional development project is worth 18 000$.

For the beginning, the strategy is to offer KlikCup services in 4 countries; France, Italy, Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina. Direct visits to facility owners would be done with 8 commercial agents. For verified photos and taking the real story information, we need equipment to take photos of facilities. To show right away how the website works, we need additional equipment that shows the website functionality. Equipment for 8 commercial agents is estimated on 8 000$.

Creating a mobile platforms for iOS and Android systems costs around 4 000$ and it is crucial to be accessible on every mobile device at the very start.

Total estimated costs are 30 000$ and we need your support to make a dream into reality.

Reaching our goal

  • If we reach our entire goal:

We will start right away with 8 commercial agents like planned when the platform development is finish. By this time, our commercial agents will be educated and instructed how to approach to every client.

  • If we do not reach our goal:

We will reduce the number of commercial agents and our staff and we will start according to raised funds.

  • If we collect more than our goal:

We will increase the number or commercial agents at the very start and intensify our presence in every country. We will spread “the word faster” and gain the precious time. If we raise 100 000$ or more, we will start our presence right away in Germany and Spain. For every additional fund we will offer our services to other countries in order to reach our ultimate goal; to offer KlikCup to the whole world.

Risks & Challenges

We have already done market research in several countries and questioned more than 600 facility owners so we could minimize the risk of not being accepted by the market. Still there is risk of not adapting appropriately to different country cultures and their needs.

How to resolve this?

  • We are eager to develop KlikCup and to adapt it to any requirements,
  • Enthusiastic team is devoted to improve KlikCup services every day.

Opportunities

You have the opportunities to make the impact, join us and create the future. Our goal is:

  • To help others easily find the right information,
  • To minimize advertisement costs to all clients and in that way to receive better quality of services,
  • To change the online communication and to present modern advertisement.

You Can Help in different ways

If you don’t have financial possibility to support our efforts, you can also:

  • Support this project by suggesting it to your friends, people you know,
  • Share this campaign using Indiegogo share tools,
  • Spread the word and make some noise about KlikCup,
  • Give us suggestions, and we will value your every advice.

story:
There are different knits to choose from and each one of them is unique. Each loveable knit is handmade, has it's own name and it's one of a kind. 

Your kid will love it and for every purchase we will give 10 test strips to pregnant women in Bulgaria to save lives!

We are introducing these Warm Hug knits on Indiegogo to raise funds for an awareness campaign and need your help to unlock the potential of this project.

By ordering your knits now, you'll receive them in time for the Winter season. 






The one and only Bunny




The one of a kind Teddy bear


Both knits are made of 100% cotton and are filled with silicone fluff. Their size is 32 centimeters.


Giving tests to pregnant women helps:

1. Declining the death rate caused by high blood pressure (preeclampsia)'

2. Protein self-control at home, especially for pregnant who are far from hospitals;

3. Raising awareness regarding the high blood pressure disorders during pregnancy.

Preeclampsia sometimes develops without any symptoms. High blood pressure may develop slowly, but more commonly it has a sudden onset. Monitoring your blood pressure is an important part of prenatal care because the first sign of preeclampsia is commonly a rise in blood pressure. Blood pressure that is 140/90 millimeters of mercury (mm Hg) or greater — documented on two occasions, at least four hours apart — is abnormal.

Other signs and symptoms of preeclampsia may include:

  • Excess of protein in your urine (proteinuria) or additional signs of kidney problems
  • Severe headaches
  • Changes in vision, including temporary loss of vision, blurred vision or light sensitivity
  • Upper abdominal pain, usually under your ribs on the right side
  • Nausea or vomiting
  • Decreased urine output
  • Decreased levels of platelets in your blood (thrombocytopenia)
  • Impaired liver function
  • Shortness of breath, caused by fluid in your lungs
  • Sudden weight gain and swelling (edema) — particularly in your face and hands — often accompanies preeclampsia. But these things also occur in many normal pregnancies, so they're not considered reliable signs of preeclampsia.

Our goal: to provide 1000 test strips to pregnant woman in Bulgaria


Thank you for reading our campaign. So if you want something different than a knit, but still hadmade and loveable, feel free to choose from the cards below, made by mothers  to support pregnant women!






# 1 The grey Teddy



#2 The white Miss


#3 The blue Teddy


#4 The beauty Princess


#5 The green Monster


#6 The orange Toddler - SOLD!



#7 The adorable Miss



#8 The purple Toddler


#9 The unique Girl


#10 The cute Boy


#11 The yellow Sunshine


#12 The blue Pilot


#13 The glowing Princess


 Every Warm & Hug knit is HANDMADE and ONE OF A KIND!


Every knit has been made with so much love FROM MOTHERS TO MOTHERS!




A story for the hope, expectancy and a miracle...

When I was 23 years old, my husband was 30. We had a dream – to have a baby and every day for two years we dreamed of that time to come. I fancied how I carry a life in me until one morning my dream came true. There were two lines, two red lines! I was so happy... We were so happy.

I called my doctor and after a few days she officially announced my pregnancy. I was subjected to all the necessary tests – blood tests, genetic testing, screening, etc. Everything was alright.

During the 5th month, I started having contractions and was emergently accepted in a hospital for 5 days. After that, every day I listened to classical music, caressed my belly and talked to my baby, my little boy.

One day I felt an awful pang in my abdomen. I remember that I couldn’t sleep all night. On the next morning, I was accepted in the hospital once again. I couldn’t remember anything. Like it wasn’t happening to me.

I wondered if it was true or not. Yes, it was true.

I remember being in a wheelchair and how I waved to my husband, and... that pain, and that fear in my heart.

I heard the doctor say: ”Don’t worry about the child, don’t care about it. Fast! Faster, we have to save the mother”.

I prayed for myself and the baby to stay alive.And for nothing, nothing else.

40 hours in the operating room. I was intubated. In that hospital, there was no medical equipment to save my life. But the other hospitals refused to admit me (although I have insurance).

Scanner. Embolism.

Plasma, blood, more blood! And that voice which told me about what was happening with the baby, about the operations, about hysterectomy; about how the doctors cut me and what exactly they were doing to me. I thought “What the hell is that?”

I felt my body in the middle of a room, maybe a green room.

Coma. Coma. Coma.

It sounds so scary. Where were they moving me? I think there were 4 or 5 doctors, I heard different voices.

“Give me something! Faster! I can’t stop the blood. Everything is in blood. Push it. Hold her hand!” – said a doctor’s voice.

I was thinking ”My hand, oh no. I want my hand. Please, don’t cut my hand”.

My next memory is fear, fear, fear, but no pain. And that white light, so blinding.

Silence, peace, quiet.

I prayed again: “Oh my God, please, take me. I can’t fight anymore. I can’t. I don’t have enough strength”.

And that song “You Are Wonderful Tonight”. In my mind, I saw my husband singing it. And I heard a voice in my head saying: “Don’t worry. You must be strong. You have a child. You are a mother. Who will take care of your son? Aren’t you going to fight? Don’t you want to hear the word “mom”? You must fight because he is fighting for you”. I saw my baby, how small and premature it was. I hugged him. I loved him. And I knew I would be fighting for him.

I heard my husband’s voice and I felt his hand. But I couldn’t do anything. I couldn’t speak, I couldn’t move. I could only cry, cry in myself. I heard the heart monitor: beep, beep, beeeep....And that fear again. No, no... I was thinking: “I don’t want to die...” I heard a voice: ”Sorry, I have to change the bank”.

My next clear memory is how one of the doctors said to me: “Take a breath and cough strength. You are my pride”.

“Where is my hand? I can’t speak. I can’t ask anyone what has happened. I don’t even know that I’m a mother. Where is my baby?”

Next memory...

Maybe 25 doctors were bent over me and they were looking at me. “Can she hear us? Does she know something? Hey Monika, how are you? Tell us something, please”. But I really couldn’t.

“Who are these people? Why are they looking at me?”

Then in my mind appeared a red light with memories and dreams. I looked at my belly and I panicked because I knew that there wasn’t any baby inside. However, my baby wasn’t next to me. If I was seeing lights up till that moment, now they had died away. I was too scared to ask what had happened. The doctors told me that I had a baby, but we were in two different hospitals because of our physical conditions.

On the 20th day after birth, I managed to walk on my own and they took me to my little boy. I saw him for the first time. I was standing secretly in the hallway and waited there for hours. It was dark, heavy and I could barely see through those dirty windows in front of me....

A loud noise sounded through the hall. My heart was beating so hard that I couldn’t hear anything. Then, for a moment it stopped beating, there was nothing on my mind. The whole pain and the absolute happiness, which can exist in the world, now existed in my head together at the same time. There was an ocean of tears in my eyes, which I tried to hide. I was smiling as never before in my whole life. This changed my entire world. Suddenly, I realized that this pure human being is my little baby – my child, my new world! At that moment, I felt myself much stronger and ready for the “fight” because I knew that I had to be with my child in these tough times.


Although I could see him through a glass window for only 2 minutes, I went to the hospital every day. I prayed and waited for this moment when I could touch and hug him. And this moment actually came. After 45 days, I touched my new world and hugged my dreams for the very first time.

I’m proud of him and his strength. Believe me, these little children are the strongest human beings in the world. Therefore, when they annoy you in the future, don’t forget that they have extremely tenacious character and they are doing their battle at all costs.

I would like to thank my husband, who was with me during this tough period, my parents, who prayed for us, our friends, who gave us such huge support. I would like to extend my gratitude to the doctors, who saved my life, also to the doctor, who took care of my treasure and who continues doing it even now.

I share our story and I hope that it would give support to other mothers. Be strong and believe!

This is my story.

This is the HELLP syndrome. It can happen suddenly, unexpectedly, but can be prevented, if diagnosed in time.

Thus was born the idea to establish the "Healthy mothers, healthy babies" Foundation – from my personal history. We want to help women to be responsible for themselves and the health of their babies. To remind them how important regular reviews are! To urge them to be interested in changes in the body and comment them with their doctors. Building trust between the doctor and the patient and between the obstetrician and the patient. We focus on prevention and all the necessary tests for the good health of mother and baby.

Because the information gives us peace! 


We appreciate every help. So if you want something different than knits or hats, but still hadmade and loveable, feel free to choose from the cards below, made by 12 y.o student to support pregnant women!






#1 The lovely Bunny


#2 The spring Flowers


#3 The red Love


#4 The abstract Flower


#5 The classic Roses


#6 The orange Fun


#7 The lovely Memory


#8 The colorful Roses


#9 The ethno Roses


#10 The one-and-only Rose


#11 The graceful Swans


# 12 The yellow Glory


#13 The swans in LOVE


The size of all cards is 15/20 cm.

These unique cards have been made by 12-year-old students to support our mission.

Each card will provide 5 test strips to a pregnant woman in need.

Help us spread the world!

Follow us on social media and share our campaign link with your family, friends, and followers - we will make a bigger difference have greater impact when we do it altogether!

Click here for "Healthy mothers, healthy babies" Foundation's Facebook



Currently our handmade knits and cards are available exclusively on Indiegogo.

1. What are the knits and hats made of? First of all, they are made of pure LOVE. Used materials for knits are: 100% cotton and filled with silicone fluff.

For hats: 25% wool and 75% premium acrylic.

2. Are the knits and hats machine washable? We recommend you to hand wash your knit/hat and lay it flat to dry to help preserve the knit's shape and details.

3. What is the appropriate age for these knits and hats? Our knits are designed  for 3y.o. and up. Our hats are suitable for children from 1y.o. to 7 y.o.

4. Can my child choke on the knit? We do recommend that young children always be supervised when playing with all toys.

5. What if my child doesn’t like the knit/hat? If your child doesn’t love his or her knit, please give it away to another kid. We thank you for that kind effort of yours!

6. Where do you ship? We ship worldwide! Enjoy free shipping to Bulgaria. For orders to international destinations, we offer a subsidized shipping rate of $20 USD. 

7. Can I buy a knit as a gift?  Yes, they make wonderful gifts! Thank you for choosing us!

8. How can I help support your Foundation? You can support us by spreading the word! Sharing our given story and posting photos of our knits on social media will help us reach more people and ultimately help more pregnant women get informed!

9. Is this a charity? Yes, we are a non-profit organization. Our mission is to help women to be responsible for themselves and the health of their babies. To remind them how important regular reviews are! To urge them to be interested in changes in the body and comment them with their doctors. Building trust between the doctor and the patient and between the obstetrician and the patient. We focus on prevention and all the necessary tests for the good health of mother and baby. 

10. How do you give the 10 test strips? We provide tests by simply buying and giving them away.

"Healthy mothers, healthy babies" charity foundation is registered and operates according to Bulgarian laws.

11. What exactly is the test? Regular self-monitoring of blood pressure and self-testing for proteinuria could improve detection of pre-eclampsia in the higher risk pregnant population, as well as reducing the time, cost, stress and inconvenience of frequent appointments without compromising the ability to detect and monitor a potentially serious disease.

12. If you’re a Bulgarian company, why don’t you work with Bulgarian Giving Partners? We are a proudly Bulgarian organization and  we love to work with Bulgarian Giving Partners as we grow. Each informational campaign requires large financial and resource commitment, so as we grow, we look forward to work with and increasing the number of countries in which we give.


"Healthy Mothers, healthy babies" Foundation
story_txt:
There are different knits to choose from and each one of them is unique. Each loveable knit is handmade, has it's own name and it's one of a kind. Your kid will love it and for every purchase we will give 10 test strips to pregnant women in Bulgaria to save lives!

We are introducing these Warm Hug knits on Indiegogo to raise funds for an awareness campaign and need your help to unlock the potential of this project.
By ordering your knits now, you'll receive them in time for the Winter season. 
The one and only BunnyThe one of a kind Teddy bearBoth knits are made of 100% cotton and are filled with silicone fluff. Their size is 32 centimeters.Giving tests to pregnant women helps:1. Declining the death rate caused by high blood pressure (preeclampsia)'2. Protein self-control at home, especially for pregnant who are far from hospitals;3. Raising awareness regarding the high blood pressure disorders during pregnancy.Preeclampsia sometimes develops without any symptoms. High blood pressure may develop slowly, but more commonly it has a sudden onset. Monitoring your blood pressure is an important part of prenatal care because the first sign of preeclampsia is commonly a rise in blood pressure. Blood pressure that is 140/90 millimeters of mercury (mm Hg) or greater — documented on two occasions, at least four hours apart — is abnormal.Other signs and symptoms of preeclampsia may include:
Excess of protein in your urine (proteinuria) or additional signs of kidney problems
Severe headaches
Changes in vision, including temporary loss of vision, blurred vision or light sensitivity
Upper abdominal pain, usually under your ribs on the right side
Nausea or vomiting
Decreased urine output
Decreased levels of platelets in your blood (thrombocytopenia)
Impaired liver function
Shortness of breath, caused by fluid in your lungs
Sudden weight gain and swelling (edema) — particularly in your face and hands — often accompanies preeclampsia. But these things also occur in many normal pregnancies, so they're not considered reliable signs of preeclampsia.
Our goal: to provide 1000 test strips to pregnant woman in BulgariaThank you for reading our campaign. So if you want something different than a knit, but still hadmade and loveable, feel free to choose from the cards below, made by mothers  to support pregnant women!

 Every Warm & Hug knit is HANDMADE and ONE OF A KIND!



Every knit has been made with so much love FROM MOTHERS TO MOTHERS!







A story for the hope, expectancy and a miracle...
When I was 23 years old, my husband was 30. We had a dream – to have a baby and every day for two years we dreamed of that time to come. I fancied how I carry a life in me until one morning my dream came true. There were two lines, two red lines! I was so happy... We were so happy.
I called my doctor and after a few days she officially announced my pregnancy. I was subjected to all the necessary tests – blood tests, genetic testing, screening, etc. Everything was alright.
During the 5th month, I started having contractions and was emergently accepted in a hospital for 5 days. After that, every day I listened to classical music, caressed my belly and talked to my baby, my little boy.
One day I felt an awful pang in my abdomen. I remember that I couldn’t sleep all night. On the next morning, I was accepted in the hospital once again. I couldn’t remember anything. Like it wasn’t happening to me.
I wondered if it was true or not. Yes, it was true.
I remember being in a wheelchair and how I waved to my husband, and... that pain, and that fear in my heart.
I heard the doctor say: ”Don’t worry about the child, don’t care about it. Fast! Faster, we have to save the mother”.
I prayed for myself and the baby to stay alive.And for nothing, nothing else.
40 hours in the operating room. I was intubated. In that hospital, there was no medical equipment to save my life. But the other hospitals refused to admit me (although I have insurance).
Scanner. Embolism.
Plasma, blood, more blood! And that voice which told me about what was happening with the baby, about the operations, about hysterectomy; about how the doctors cut me and what exactly they were doing to me. I thought “What the hell is that?”
I felt my body in the middle of a room, maybe a green room.
Coma. Coma. Coma.
It sounds so scary. Where were they moving me? I think there were 4 or 5 doctors, I heard different voices.
“Give me something! Faster! I can’t stop the blood. Everything is in blood. Push it. Hold her hand!” – said a doctor’s voice.
I was thinking ”My hand, oh no. I want my hand. Please, don’t cut my hand”.
My next memory is fear, fear, fear, but no pain. And that white light, so blinding.
Silence, peace, quiet.
I prayed again: “Oh my God, please, take me. I can’t fight anymore. I can’t. I don’t have enough strength”.
And that song “You Are Wonderful Tonight”. In my mind, I saw my husband singing it. And I heard a voice in my head saying: “Don’t worry. You must be strong. You have a child. You are a mother. Who will take care of your son? Aren’t you going to fight? Don’t you want to hear the word “mom”? You must fight because he is fighting for you”. I saw my baby, how small and premature it was. I hugged him. I loved him. And I knew I would be fighting for him.
I heard my husband’s voice and I felt his hand. But I couldn’t do anything. I couldn’t speak, I couldn’t move. I could only cry, cry in myself. I heard the heart monitor: beep, beep, beeeep....And that fear again. No, no... I was thinking: “I don’t want to die...” I heard a voice: ”Sorry, I have to change the bank”.
My next clear memory is how one of the doctors said to me: “Take a breath and cough strength. You are my pride”.

“Where is my hand? I can’t speak. I can’t ask anyone what has happened. I don’t even know that I’m a mother. Where is my baby?”
Next memory...
Maybe 25 doctors were bent over me and they were looking at me. “Can she hear us? Does she know something? Hey Monika, how are you? Tell us something, please”. But I really couldn’t.
“Who are these people? Why are they looking at me?”
Then in my mind appeared a red light with memories and dreams. I looked at my belly and I panicked because I knew that there wasn’t any baby inside. However, my baby wasn’t next to me. If I was seeing lights up till that moment, now they had died away. I was too scared to ask what had happened. The doctors told me that I had a baby, but we were in two different hospitals because of our physical conditions.
On the 20th day after birth, I managed to walk on my own and they took me to my little boy. I saw him for the first time. I was standing secretly in the hallway and waited there for hours. It was dark, heavy and I could barely see through those dirty windows in front of me....
A loud noise sounded through the hall. My heart was beating so hard that I couldn’t hear anything. Then, for a moment it stopped beating, there was nothing on my mind. The whole pain and the absolute happiness, which can exist in the world, now existed in my head together at the same time. There was an ocean of tears in my eyes, which I tried to hide. I was smiling as never before in my whole life. This changed my entire world. Suddenly, I realized that this pure human being is my little baby – my child, my new world! At that moment, I felt myself much stronger and ready for the “fight” because I knew that I had to be with my child in these tough times.

Although I could see him through a glass window for only 2 minutes, I went to the hospital every day. I prayed and waited for this moment when I could touch and hug him. And this moment actually came. After 45 days, I touched my new world and hugged my dreams for the very first time.
I’m proud of him and his strength. Believe me, these little children are the strongest human beings in the world. Therefore, when they annoy you in the future, don’t forget that they have extremely tenacious character and they are doing their battle at all costs.
I would like to thank my husband, who was with me during this tough period, my parents, who prayed for us, our friends, who gave us such huge support. I would like to extend my gratitude to the doctors, who saved my life, also to the doctor, who took care of my treasure and who continues doing it even now.
I share our story and I hope that it would give support to other mothers. Be strong and believe!
This is my story.
This is the HELLP syndrome. It can happen suddenly, unexpectedly, but can be prevented, if diagnosed in time.
Thus was born the idea to establish the "Healthy mothers, healthy babies" Foundation – from my personal history. We want to help women to be responsible for themselves and the health of their babies. To remind them how important regular reviews are! To urge them to be interested in changes in the body and comment them with their doctors. Building trust between the doctor and the patient and between the obstetrician and the patient. We focus on prevention and all the necessary tests for the good health of mother and baby.
Because the information gives us peace! 


We appreciate every help. So if you want something different than knits or hats, but still hadmade and loveable, feel free to choose from the cards below, made by 12 y.o student to support pregnant women!








#1 The lovely Bunny




#2 The spring Flowers


#3 The red Love



#4 The abstract Flower


#5 The classic Roses


#6 The orange Fun


#7 The lovely Memory


#8 The colorful Roses


#9 The ethno Roses


#10 The one-and-only Rose


#11 The graceful Swans


# 12 The yellow Glory


#13 The swans in LOVE


The size of all cards is 15/20 cm.
These unique cards have been made by 12-year-old students to support our mission.
Each card will provide 5 test strips to a pregnant woman in need.


Help us spread the world!
Follow us on social media and share our campaign link with your family, friends, and followers - we will make a bigger difference have greater impact when we do it altogether!


Click here for "Healthy mothers, healthy babies" Foundation's Facebook

For hats: 25% wool and 75% premium acrylic.


2. Are the knits and hats machine washable? We recommend you to hand wash your knit/hat and lay it flat to dry to help preserve the knit's shape and details.
3. What is the appropriate age for these knits and hats? Our knits are designed  for 3y.o. and up. Our hats are suitable for children from 1y.o. to 7 y.o.
4. Can my child choke on the knit? We do recommend that young children always be supervised when playing with all toys.
5. What if my child doesn’t like the knit/hat? If your child doesn’t love his or her knit, please give it away to another kid. We thank you for that kind effort of yours!
6. Where do you ship? We ship worldwide! Enjoy free shipping to Bulgaria. For orders to international destinations, we offer a subsidized shipping rate of $20 USD. 
7. Can I buy a knit as a gift?  Yes, they make wonderful gifts! Thank you for choosing us!


8. How can I help support your Foundation? You can support us by spreading the word! Sharing our given story and posting photos of our knits on social media will help us reach more people and ultimately help more pregnant women get informed!
9. Is this a charity? Yes, we are a non-profit organization. Our mission is to help women to be responsible for themselves and the health of their babies. To remind them how important regular reviews are! To urge them to be interested in changes in the body and comment them with their doctors. Building trust between the doctor and the patient and between the obstetrician and the patient. We focus on prevention and all the necessary tests for the good health of mother and baby. 


10. How do you give the 10 test strips? We provide tests by simply buying and giving them away.
"Healthy mothers, healthy babies" charity foundation is registered and operates according to Bulgarian laws.


11. What exactly is the test? Regular self-monitoring of blood pressure and self-testing for proteinuria could improve detection of pre-eclampsia in the higher risk pregnant population, as well as reducing the time, cost, stress and inconvenience of frequent appointments without compromising the ability to detect and monitor a potentially serious disease.
12. If you’re a Bulgarian company, why don’t you work with Bulgarian Giving Partners? We are a proudly Bulgarian organization and  we love to work with Bulgarian Giving Partners as we grow. Each informational campaign requires large financial and resource commitment, so as we grow, we look forward to work with and increasing the number of countries in which we give.

story:
The House of The Wounded Healer

The House of the Wounded Healer is the inspired vision of Noemí Ko-jí Santana and Francisco "Paco" Genko-ji Lugoviña to build a space for rest, reflection and refuge so they may continue their life-affirming work with renewed energy.

Paco is an ordained Buddhist priest and Noemí is a Dharma Holder of the Zen Peacemaker Order. With over 20 years of international missions committed to promoting anti-conflict programs and peace initiatives, Noemí and Paco deeply understand that the caregivers of the world need their own space in order to recharge and reconnect.

And so was born the idea of a space for self-healing for the healers of the world!

 

$50,000 to Build a Foundation for the Healers of the World!

A few years ago, Noemí and Paco bought the historic site of Don Ricardo Alegría, known as the "father of modern Puerto Rican archaeology".  Villa Alegría is 7 acres of beautiful lush land in the sloping hills of Cayey, Puerto Rico.  

They decided to rehabilitate the large historic home and transform the land into a retreat center as a place of refuge for caregivers and peacemakers to honor his legacy and preserve the beauty of the mountain area called Jájome (pronounced Há Ho Meh).  

The plan includes using the main house to be used for guest rooms, meditation hall, dining room, kitchen, and garden.  Long-term plans will include bungalows, a chapel and two long houses for conferences and group meetings.

The main house, also known as a "quinta" (pronounced kin-tah) is almost 100 years old and needs major rehabilitation and modernization in order to complete the transformation into a holistic center for wounded healers.

$50,000 will help pay for the costs of rebuilding the foundation of the main house. 

 

The Peace Perks!

  • $5 - Buddha-Dharma-Sangha is the blessing for your generous contribution
  • $10 - Prayer Pouch
  • $25 - Money Plant 
  • $50 - Prayer Scarf
  • $75 - Book: "The Adventures of Sweets and Goldie"
  • $100 - Prayer Bracelet
  • $250 - Prayer/Meditation Singing Bell
  • $500 - Prayer Bracelet and Prayer/Meditation Singing Bell
  • $1,000 - Gift Package includes items 1 through 4
  • $2,500 - Gift Package includes items 1 through 7
  • $5,000 - Tree Named after the Donor
  • $10,000 - Name one of the Gardens
  • $25,000 - Name one of the Rooms and RT Ticket with 3 nights stay at the site
  • $50,000 - Name the Gazebo after Donor and you will get a round-trip ticket and 5 day stay for the official opening of the House of the Wounded Healer (or other time of your choosing).

 

The GRAND VISION

The main house will be the center of all activity. Plans are in the works to build cottages and low buildings in keeping with the terrain and natural habitat of the area for a place that will offer respite, contemplative practice, meditation, mindfulness practice, yoga and opportunities to share teachings for the novice and master alike.
 

The Wisdom of the Circle

The Wisdom of the Circle, as developed by the Zen Peacemaker Circle and the Global Peacemaker Community, is one of the forms of practice and teaching that will be offered there — as well as The Way of Council.


Right Livelihood and Artful Expression

Guests will be able to choose from one-day to longer residency programs that include the practice of Right Livelihood,  samu or work practice, or a combination of these options. Guests will find a regular schedule of workshops, lectures and talks by master teachers from many backgrounds, daily meditation, classes in health and nutrition, herb gardening, natural healing modalities, plus a full program in Artful Expression seminars.

 

Wounded Healer Program and Living and Dying are One Program

The Wounded Healer Program will be especially attractive to those who work in the helping and healing professions, particularly when they need to come in from the rain for a spell and recharge their batteries. A program on Living and Dying are One will invite participants to explore the possibility of a seamless cloth wrapping around these two events of life.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word and share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter:

facebook: https://www.facebook.com/houseofthewoundedhealer/

twitter: https://twitter.com/refuge4healers

And thanks in advance for your support!
