story:
Let me Introduce you to my vision!

 

  • My name is Suzanne Lundquist and may I just start off by saying thanks for your interest in my campaign! I have always seen the beauty of art in the world and it really started coming out in my photography. I love the fine arts and would love to start reminding the world and future generations that there is still plenty of beauty in the world. I am a single mother of three beautiful children and trying to start my life over after my divorce forced me to close my business, after two years of great customers and clientele. I am not at a point where I am able to restart my photography business, with you help! Hopefully you see something worth funding here!
  • I am starting this campaign mainly to get the equipment I need to start my photography business again. Before forced to close my business a few years back, I always had great feedback and plenty of clients. And to this day, just using my smartphone I have still been able to move people with my images. Now I have been given this opportunity to work toward my dream of photography again and become a storyteller in the world of art again. With your help I will be able to reach out to others with my photographs and tell their stories to the world.
  • With your help you will be helping me by getting my name out there again and helping me establish myself as a photographer. You will also be helping those in my community with advertising of their own work and businesses; I intend to help them with some charity work, as well as my normal business. I want to help the world see all that is happening when we look in the right direction and eventually showcase my work.

What I need to make this happen.

Here is a list of the equipment needs I would need to start-up again.

  • Canon 5D Mark III
  • Two Lenses: Canon EF 70mm-200mm f 2.8 telephoto zoom lens & Canon EF 100mm f2.8 Macro Lens
  • Canon Speedlite Flash 430 EX III RT External Flash
  • Memory Cards: 2 16 GB CF Cards and 1 32 GB CF Card
  • Canon lens hood
  • If enough is left over I would be looking at purchasing a more up to date Laptop also

These would be the necessities for the startup process of the business to get it up an running. With your help you will be able to bring smiles to many old and new customers alike and help out surrounding communities and local businesses. 

I will be taking fine art prints, family, wedding, equine, all sorts of engine types, and marketing and advertising for businesses. By helping me I am going to be reaching out to others to, "pay it forward," by helping people who have started movements to help the world or individuals in need. The world is a beautiful place and there are so many individuals and groups trying to help out in their communities, whether it be helping: the homeless, veterans, children, or anyone else in need, I would like to give back to those who are trying to make the world a better place. I would like to help show the beauty in compassion and remind the communities around us that there is still plenty of good in the world.

I will do this not only for people in need but, also for my customers with the pictures I create because, its these little moments we catch, in all the hustle-and-bustle, that we can share with our family and future generations to come. Because, we all leave behind something and wouldn't we like to leave behind more than just a story? Wouldn't we we like too leave behind a legacy and a story line full of pictures to give someone the very real feeling that you were here, and at that very moment have them feel the same things you did?

If I do not reach my goal amount the money invested into here will still go towards the business and I will still try my hardest to make my way back into the creative edge again. I feel the passion for this dream is strong and will lead not only me but my family back into a sustainable future and keep the arts alive for my kids and their future stories.

Ways to help without money

Are you interested but unable to contribute? No worries because that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can spread the word! Reach out on social media sites or to your friends and family about our campaign. Make some noise!
  • Don't forget to share too by using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Also sometimes just a kind word of encouragement can go far and if you can't send one to me give one to someone around you trying to believe in their own art. Or something as simple as reminding them to just a smile every once in awhile! You can make a difference in the world everyday with just the simplest things!

And that's all there is to it.

Are you interested but unable to contribute? No worries because that doesn't mean you can't help:

You can spread the word! Reach out on social media sites or to your friends and family about our campaign. Make some noise!
Don't forget to share too by using the Indiegogo share tools!
Also sometimes just a kind word of encouragement can go far and if you can't send one to me give one to someone around you trying to believe in their own art. Or something as simple as reminding them to just a smile every once in awhile! You can make a difference in the world everyday with just the simplest things!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
In March Kyle and I stumbled across a beautiful home in the middle of the serene desert. We did a walk through and the house needs a lot of work. We'll need to replace the flooring, a few windows, the garage door, a hot water heater and quite a few other things. This may sound like a big order and we can't do it all at once but we're willing and excited. Because of this the owners have agreed to rent the home to us at no cost until the repairs have been made and possibly much longer. We have a 5 year lease and 3 acres of land... but no electrical panel!

This is the point where we ask for help. The cost to repair the electrical panel is going to be $2,500 plus a $500 electrical release permit. This is the largest expense and also the one we need to do first. We can't begin other repairs if we don't have power! Aside from the many repairs we've fallen in love with this house. I've always dreamed of a fixer upper to make my own but I never dreamed it could be in such a gorgeous location with my perfect little family. Kyle and I hope to grow into our new home and settle until the next grand adventure. Anything you're willing to contribute gets us one step closer to being able to move away from the congestion of LA. Thank you. We love you.

story:
For our English speaking Friends...

...Please watch the video First in English:

Then, you may translate this information below with  https://translate.google.com  

 

1 idée et 3 hommes : 1 concept avec 3 directions.

La publicité représente un budget colossal pour nombre de petits producteurs, artisans, fabricants. Ce budget se traduit par un prix de vente plus élevé que le coût de production. Le consommateur en fait les frais et le producteur n'en tire aucun avantage si ce n'est d'arriver à mieux se faire connaître.

Le concept s'articule dans 3 directions:

1. Des consommateurs grâce à une plateforme de consommation collaborative et participative offrent à tous les producteurs, artisans, fabricants la possibilité de se faire connaître et de promouvoir leur savoir faire.

2. Cette plateforme permet aux acteurs de la production et des services de vendre leurs compétences et leurs produits sans frais de publicité. Ils peuvent ainsi garantir leurs meilleurs prix, ceux-ci n'ayant plus besoin d'inclure de frais publicitaires. Le consommateur paye pour savoir et se fait ensuite rembourser par un tarif préférentiel et garanti comme tel.

3. Cette plateforme est véhiculée par un magazine/catalogue virtuel qui présente tous les produits et services de ceux qui le veulent. Le magazine a un coût fixe qui est largement compensé grâce aux tarifs offerts avec le meilleur prix garanti. L'intégralité du produit de la vente de ce magazine est ensuite partagée entre les consommateurs et producteurs qui souhaitent promouvoir sa diffusion . Un tirage au sort de produits et services offerts par les annonceurs  (environ 200 produits et services) a lieu chaque mois.

Tout ceci est donc né de la rencontre de 3 personnes:

Des années d'expériences dans le commercial, le marketing et le coaching ont permis à Philippe RIAT d'asseoir ses convictions quant à ce projet. Comme il a beaucoup voyagé, il partage avec l'équipe une vision qui va bien au delà de nos frontières. Il est l'Activateur et le chef d'Orchestre de cette aventure extraordinaire qu'est en train de devenir le CACHE-CA$H-MAGAZINE. Lorsqu'on lui a remis la partition de l'oeuvre, il n'en a plus dormi. Il a travaillé à ce que tout concorde pour plaire aux auditeurs. Il a imaginé le concert en se mettant à la place de chacun. Des musiciens d'une part qui vont faire de ce concept une oeuvre remarquable, mais aussi des auditeurs qui en redemanderont... En d'autres termes, il va associer au mieux les consom'acteurs avec les entrepreneurs qui ne verront plus que l'info-merciale pour atteindre un plein succès dans leurs affaires.

Il a une expérience d'écoute et une connaissance des cultures de plusieurs continents et lui aussi grand voyageur (avec 12 années au sein du service de santé des armées). Si Philippe est le Chef d'orchestre, Bertrand de MALEPRADE est le compositeur et le stratège. C'est en découvrant un concept qui évoluait dans le monde virtuel qu'il a eu l'idée de le transférer au monde vivant. Il a donc composé la partition. Il a 100 idées à la minute qui partent dans tous les sens. Mais sans chef d'orchestre partageant la vision et canalisant le trop plein d'idées il serait impossible que cette partition puisse voir le jour. Philippe et Bertrand étaient voués à travailler ensemble.Un compositeur? Un chef d'orchestre? ...c'est bien beau, mais quid de l'orchestre et de l'auditorium pour mettre en exergue tout cela?

C'est là qu'Olivier HEIMERDINGER   est arrivé. Il a vu la partition. Il a compris la portée que l'oeuvre pourrait avoir dans les mains d'un chef d'orchestre qui vibre à chaque note. Il a été conquis. Il a imaginé alors les instruments de l'orchestre mais aussi l'architecture de l'auditorium pour que les auditeurs soient en même temps des spectateurs d'une oeuvre nouvelle destinée à bouleverser les canons de la musique ...enfin du rapport entre les consom'acteurs et les entrepreneurs! Olivier gère tout ce qui est technique. Il permet aux auditeurs (consom'acteurs) de venir jouer dans l'orchestre avec les musiciens (entrepreneurs).

 Ce concept n'a besoin de fonds que pour démarrer plus vite.

En effet, il nécessite que quelques personnes puissent se rendre disponibles pour le promouvoir plus rapidement.  Une fois le décollage opéré l'autofinancement se fera automatiquement car le concept est exponentiel. En effet une personne qui en parle à 2 qui font de même fait qu'en 10 générations de partage on a 1000 personnes (1024 pour être précis) et en 10 générations de plus on atteint 1 million de personnes.

Ces fonds de départ permettent l'acquisition des serveurs, du matériel et des outils informatiques pour mieux protéger et organiser tout le système ainsi que la mise en place de la structure.

Même si ces fonds ne sont pas complètement récoltés le concept démarrera. La partie initiale en R & D (Recherche et Développement) est estimée à plus d'une centaine de milliers d'euros. Le plus important est donc déjà effectué. Mais à présent, pour gagner un temps précieux, il faut mettre l'ensemble en place et permettre que les acteurs du départ puissent se focaliser sur ce lancement et le promouvoir auprès de tous les fabricants, producteurs, artisans qui en ont grand besoin (RAPPEL: ils vont pouvoir réduire leur budget publicité de manière considérable). 

Faudra-t-il 3 mois pour le lancement ? ou davantage? ...C'est vous les contributeurs qui vont en décider.

Les contributeurs peuvent agir de 3 manières concrètes:

1. Contributions financières conséquentes avec des avantages à la clé (abonnement à vie possible au magazine).

2. Participation et inscription à la plateforme de consommation collaborative de manière active c'est à dire en faisant une promotion auprès de leurs relations.

3. Une participation avec inscription à cette même plateforme de manière passive pour être tenu au courant de toutes les offres de produits et services à venir. Plus la plateforme aura d'inscrits plus les entrepreneurs auront envie de s'y faire connaître.

Exemple: un fabricant de vérandas offre en super promotion des vérandas type à 5000 €. Mais pour faire connaître son produit il a du investir à risque plusieurs milliers d'euros de publicité (imaginons 500 € de PUB pour vendre 1 véranda).  Dans la cadre du Cache-Ca$h-Magazine, ce fabricant n'a pas à investir quoique ce soit pour se faire connaître. Il est donc plus serein et peut plus confortablement proposer ses vérandas avec sa marge nette assurée. Il peut donc proposer en exclusivité (au meilleur prix garanti) sa véranda à 4500 € aux consommateurs de la plateforme, soit une économie de 500€ pour le consommateur.
...nous aurions pu tout autant prendre l'exemple d'un traiteur ou d'un vigneron...

Des consommateurs grâce à une plateforme de consommation collaborative et participative offrent à tous les producteurs, artisans, fabricants la possibilité de se faire connaître et de promouvoir leur savoir faire.2. Cette plateforme permet aux acteurs de la production et des services de vendre leurs compétences et leurs produits sans frais de publicité. Ils peuvent ainsi garantir leurs meilleurs prix, ceux-ci n'ayant plus besoin d'inclure de frais publicitaires. Le consommateur paye pour savoir et se fait ensuite rembourser par un tarif préférentiel et garanti comme tel.3. Cette plateforme est véhiculée par un magazine/catalogue virtuel qui présente tous les produits et services de ceux qui le veulent. Le magazine a un coût fixe qui est largement compensé grâce aux tarifs offerts avec le meilleur prix garanti. L'intégralité du produit de la vente de ce magazine est ensuite partagée entre les consommateurs et producteurs qui souhaitent promouvoir sa diffusion . Un tirage au sort de produits et services offerts par les annonceurs  (environ 200 produits et services) a lieu chaque mois.Tout ceci est donc né de la rencontre de 3 personnes:Des années d'expériences dans le commercial, le marketing et le coaching ont permis à Philippe RIAT d'asseoir ses convictions quant à ce projet. Comme il a beaucoup voyagé, il partage avec l'équipe une vision qui va bien au delà de nos frontières. Il est l'Activateur et le chef d'Orchestre de cette aventure extraordinaire qu'est en train de devenir le CACHE-CA$H-MAGAZINE. Lorsqu'on lui a remis la partition de l'oeuvre, il n'en a plus dormi. Il a travaillé à ce que tout concorde pour plaire aux auditeurs. Il a imaginé le concert en se mettant à la place de chacun. Des musiciens d'une part qui vont faire de ce concept une oeuvre remarquable, mais aussi des auditeurs qui en redemanderont... En d'autres termes, il va associer au mieux les consom'acteurs avec les entrepreneurs qui ne verront plus que l'info-merciale pour atteindre un plein succès dans leurs affaires.Il a une expérience d'écoute et une connaissance des cultures de plusieurs continents et lui aussi grand voyageur (avec 12 années au sein du service de santé des armées). Si Philippe est le Chef d'orchestre, Bertrand de MALEPRADE est le compositeur et le stratège. C'est en découvrant un concept qui évoluait dans le monde virtuel qu'il a eu l'idée de le transférer au monde vivant. Il a donc composé la partition. Il a 100 idées à la minute qui partent dans tous les sens. Mais sans chef d'orchestre partageant la vision et canalisant le trop plein d'idées il serait impossible que cette partition puisse voir le jour. Philippe et Bertrand étaient voués à travailler ensemble.Un compositeur? Un chef d'orchestre? ...c'est bien beau, mais quid de l'orchestre et de l'auditorium pour mettre en exergue tout cela?C'est là qu'Olivier HEIMERDINGER   est arrivé. Il a vu la partition. Il a compris la portée que l'oeuvre pourrait avoir dans les mains d'un chef d'orchestre qui vibre à chaque note. Il a été conquis. Il a imaginé alors les instruments de l'orchestre mais aussi l'architecture de l'auditorium pour que les auditeurs soient en même temps des spectateurs d'une oeuvre nouvelle destinée à bouleverser les canons de la musique ...enfin du rapport entre les consom'acteurs et les entrepreneurs! Olivier gère tout ce qui est technique. Il permet aux auditeurs (consom'acteurs) de venir jouer dans l'orchestre avec les musiciens (entrepreneurs). Ce concept n'a besoin de fonds que pour démarrer plus vite. En effet, il nécessite que quelques personnes puissent se rendre disponibles pour le promouvoir plus rapidement.  Une fois le décollage opéré l'autofinancement se fera automatiquement car le concept est exponentiel. En effet une personne qui en parle à 2 qui font de même fait qu'en 10 générations de partage on a 1000 personnes (1024 pour être précis) et en 10 générations de plus on atteint 1 million de personnes.Ces fonds de départ permettent l'acquisition des serveurs, du matériel et des outils informatiques pour mieux protéger et organiser tout le système ainsi que la mise en place de la structure.Même si ces fonds ne sont pas complètement récoltés le concept démarrera. La partie initiale en R & D (Recherche et Développement) est estimée à plus d'une centaine de milliers d'euros. Le plus important est donc déjà effectué. Mais à présent, pour gagner un temps précieux, il faut mettre l'ensemble en place et permettre que les acteurs du départ puissent se focaliser sur ce lancement et le promouvoir auprès de tous les fabricants, producteurs, artisans qui en ont grand besoin (RAPPEL: ils vont pouvoir réduire leur budget publicité de manière considérable). Faudra-t-il 3 mois pour le lancement ? ou davantage? ...C'est vous les contributeurs qui vont en décider.Les contributeurs peuvent agir de 3 manières concrètes:1. Contributions financières conséquentes avec des avantages à la clé (abonnement à vie possible au magazine).2. Participation et inscription à la plateforme de consommation collaborative de manière active c'est à dire en faisant une promotion auprès de leurs relations.3. Une participation avec inscription à cette même plateforme de manière passive pour être tenu au courant de toutes les offres de produits et services à venir. Plus la plateforme aura d'inscrits plus les entrepreneurs auront envie de s'y faire connaître.Exemple: un fabricant de vérandas offre en super promotion des vérandas type à 5000 €. Mais pour faire connaître son produit il a du investir à risque plusieurs milliers d'euros de publicité (imaginons 500 € de PUB pour vendre 1 véranda).  Dans la cadre du Cache-Ca$h-Magazine, ce fabricant n'a pas à investir quoique ce soit pour se faire connaître. Il est donc plus serein et peut plus confortablement proposer ses vérandas avec sa marge nette assurée. Il peut donc proposer en exclusivité (au meilleur prix garanti) sa véranda à 4500 € aux consommateurs de la plateforme, soit une économie de 500€ pour le consommateur....nous aurions pu tout autant prendre l'exemple d'un traiteur ou d'un vigneron...

story:
Confort, douceur, chaleur et légèreté 

Bonjour ! 

Mon nom est Renaud Paradis, je suis un tisserand et designer de Val-David, Québec, Canada. Ça fait environ 16 ans que je me passionne pour les métiers de la fibre,  En 2013, j'ai démarré mon entreprise L'Écheveau Divin, aussi connue pour certains, sous le nom de Red Dragon Weaving

Mes créations textiles, sont tissées main avec des fibres haut de gamme pour offrir des créations uniques, d'une beauté et d'une qualité incomparable. Les fibres utilisées sont issues du bébé alpaga, de la jeune chèvre mohair, de la laine mérinos, de la soie, et du bambou.  Chaque pièce est créée avec amour et dans le calme; l'environnement de création leur est alors transmis.

J'ai reçu une très bonne nouvelle, je suis sélectionné pour une Exposition Internationale de Métiers d'Arts qui se tiendra ce novembre en France.  C'est une opportunité exceptionnelle, un grand pas dans ma carrière et je me sens honoré de pouvoir participer et surtout d'avoir été choisi pour l'ensemble de mes créations pour représenter le Québec et Val-David.

J'ai déboursé les frais de mon expo, j'ai acheté mon billet d'avion et maintenant je me lance dans le vide et je pratique mon lâcher-prise afin de remettre la suite à l'univers, c'est à dire vous :)

Votre soutien serait grandement apprécié.  Ce chapitre de ma vie se résume comme une nouvelle aventure qui s'offre à moi au présent pour un avenir meilleur, j'ai besoin de vous afin de réaliser ce rêve et surtout pour avoir un voyage sécuritaire et rempli de bonheur.


 Ce dont j'ai besoin et ce que vous obtenez

 Voici ce que je ferai avec les fonds envoyés sur cette plateforme :

  • Le but de cette campagne est d'amasser 2000$, ces fonds serviront à payer mon hébergement, mes vivres, mes transports et mes frais de logistique en territoire européen.
  • Tous les cadeaux offerts ici sont empreints d'une énergie d'amour et de calme ; les châles, capes, ponchos, robes, jetés et murales sauront charmer et habiller les amateurs de belles pièces.
  • J'ai mis le montant total minimum de ma campagne de socio-financement à 2000$.  Si je n'atteints pas le montant requis, Indiegogo  va me remettre les fonds reçus et je vous ferai parvenir vos cadeaux de toute façon.  Avec les montants reçus j'irai quand même en France mais disons que je serai plus limité dans mes vivres pour mes transports et pour mon hébergement. 
  • Si je reçois plus que 2000$, jusqu'à concurrence de ce montant je ferai un voyage sécuritaire et rempli de bonheur.  Les fonds reçus en excédant seront réinvestis pour l'achat de fibres et de matières premières.

 

L'impact

La mission de L'Écheveau Divin est de partager au plus grand nombre ma passion pour les fibres en offrant des créations ultra douces, d'une beauté et d'un raffinement remarquables.  Cette aventure va me permettre de

  • Partager ma passion et ma cultur
  • Exporter le talent québécois et canadien 
  • Acquérir de nouvelles connaissances
  • Rencontrer de nouveaux partenaires financiers
  • Voyager sereinement et efficacement 

 

Risques et défis

Se lancer dans une aventure comme celle-ci peut pour certaines personnes sembler hors du commun, mais pour moi et pour la plupart des gens de ma communauté, croire en l'univers ou en l'abondance qui nous est offerte selon l'énergie que l'on résonne est chose commune. Vivre dans cette belle communauté m'a énormément apporté et je lui en suis extrêmement reconnaissant ; elle m'a redonné la confiance que j'avais perdue au fil du dernier chapitre de ma vie, je suis maintenant rempli de lumière et tranquillement j'applique les enseignements acquis pour qu'un jour, un plus grand nombre puisse en bénéficier.  C'est la foi en l'univers qui guide mon chemin, éternelle gratitude.

Les fonds accumulés vont m'offrir de nouvelles expériences qui feront de moi un homme encore plus accompli que celui que je suis déjà.  :)

 

 D'autres façons d'aider

 Certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire qu'elles ne peuvent pas aider :

  •  Vous pouvez passer le mot et vous pouvez aussi partager cette campagne de socio-financement avec vos amis (es) et votre famille avec l'outil de partage Indiegogo, ou simplement en partageant ce lien via Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc et en courriel.

Merci

Renaud :)

Joyeuses fêtes !!

Comfort, softness, warmth, lightness

Hi !

My name is Renaud Paradis, I am a weaver and designer from Val-David, Quebec, Canada.  My passion for fiber arts began about sixteen years ago. In 2013 I launched my business L'Écheveau Divin , a.k.a. Red Dragon Weaving .

My creations are hand weaved by me with luxury hand dyed yarn to offer unique creations of unmatchable beauty and quality.  The fibers I use are: baby alpaca, kid-mohair, merino wool, silk and bamboo.  Each creation is weaved in an energy of love  and in a  peaceful environment.

Lately I have received a wonderful news: I have been selected to participate at an Internationnal Arts and Crafts Show in France, this coming november.  This is a great opportunity, a large step for my career and I feel honored to have been chosen for the  totality of my creations to represent the province of Quebec and the town of Val David, and of course my country Canada.

My booth is paid, as well as my plane ticket (leaving on the 29th of october), at this point I practice "letting go" and I hand over my life to the Universe, this means you :)

Your financial support would be greatly appreciated.  This chapter of my life sums up to a new adventure that has been offered to me in the present for a greater future. I need your contribution so I can realize this dream but mostly to have a safe business trip, fulfilled with happyness.

What we need & what you get

Here's what I will do with the money raised through this platform:

  • The goal of $2000 will cover the cost of lodging, food, transport and logistics on europeen territory
  • All of the gifts that are offered here are footprint of the energy of love and calm; Shawls, ponchos, dress, throws and murals will charm and dress fine fiber arts enthusiasts
  • I've set a fundraising goal of $2K. Even if I don't meet this goal, Indiegogo wil still release the funds raised for me and I'll still deliver the gifts that are ordered.  I will still go to France but lets say that I will be more limited with food supplys , transport and lodging on europeen territory.
  • If I raise more than $2K, up to this amount I will make a safe and happy business trip.  The exceeding funds will be reinvested to purchase yarn and weaving materials.

The impact

My mission is to share to the largest number, this time in France, my passion for fiber arts in offering creations that are ultra-soft and of remarquable beauty and elegance.  (I also give weaving courses for this purpose but, at this time, in France it will not be possible).  With this adventure I will:

  • Share my passion and culture
  • Acquire new knowledge
  • Meet new business partners
  • Have a safe and pleasant business trip

Risks an challenges

To jump in an adventure like this might, for some people, seem out of the ordinary but for me and most of the people surrounding me, to believe in the Universe or in the abundance that is offered according to the energy that we resonate is common knowledge.  To live in this beautiful community has brought me a lot and I feel much gratitude; It has helped me to regain the self-confidence I had lost in the last chapter of my life.  I am now footprint of light and slowly I apply the knowledge acquired so one day more people shall benefit from it.

The raised funds will offer me new experiences that will make me evolve, therefore become a more accomplished man than the one I already am :)

Other ways you can help

Please help me get the word out and share this campain with your friends and family by using the Indiegogo share tool or simply share this link.

Thank you 

Warmest season's greetings to you and your family, and best wishes to all :)

 

Renaud Paradis :)

story:
Welcome Center & Community Center

  • The Winston-Salem Ambassadors is a tax-exempt nonprofit who aims to create a welcoming and inclusive city! Our mission is to increase awareness of Winston-Salem, to get you connected to all that we have. 
  • This physical space is the most important aspect of our mission moving forward. It is a place where people can COME INTO to speak with an actual real live person who loves Winston-Salem, and who is all too happy to plug you in!
  • We are 100% donation-based and we CANNOT do this without you!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The BULK of this $26,950 will go straight towards rent on the physical location. The rest will be utilities, high speed wi-fi that you can use when you're with us and brightening up the place (it's been empty for a long time!)
  • You get something for donating from $10 and they only get more exciting the more you give! (IE: Fancy party, or a whole month featuring YOU!)
  • Meeting Space for 5-20 people.
  • Lounge Space for downtime when you're Downtown.
  • SMALL BUSINESS office space for fellow community members.

The Impact

We can't do this without you and therefore you should benefit!!

  • This space will have a meeting space AND a lounge area as well as housing the Ambassadors. We guarantee you will find something useful here every time.
  • This Welcome Center and Community Center will be for old-timers and newcomers alike. We truly believe that people will feel welcome walking in, and that means that they will feel welcome in our City.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • SHARE, SHARE, SHARE THE WORD! Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, other platforms that you in-touch people know more about! And most importantly, tell your family and friends and colleagues! 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

We're here for you. We're here for US -  this OUR community and you can help us make it a better place. JOIN US!

story:
A New Unique Lodging Option

The Art House Hotel provides a unique lodging option with a focus on providing travelers with the most flexible accommodations in the industry. More typical single room stays are available, but the hotel places an emphasis on affordable multi-room apartment-style lodging, providing fully stocked kitchens, private living rooms and adjoining bedrooms for an entire family or a small group traveling together.

   

In addition to private lodging of the highest quality, the Art House Hotel offers small group conference facility options, including comfortable, living room settings for small group gatherings. An outdoor terrace space that is ideal for small ceremonies and special celebratory events. An a la carte menu of concierge and wellness services is also available to meet guest needs on demand. Services range from providing dining options to scheduling in-room massage or other spa services. 

The building is just a few short blocks from the natural beauty of the shores of Lake Michigan, the Oak Leaf Trail, and Bradford Beach. Also walkable are local cultural assets and attractions including the Milwaukee Art Museum, Summerfest- the worlds’ largest outdoor music festival, the War Memorial and the Discovery World Museum and much more. In addition to optimal walkability, the location also provides easy access to bikesharing stations, public transit, and carsharing modes of transportation, making convenient access to all of Milwaukee's best restaurants, shopping and nightlife. Additionally, the hotel offers free parking spaces in the rear of the building.

We Need Your Help!

Now as you can see in the photos, the Art House needs a little love and tlc. Well, rest assured, we have plans and the financing in place to give it a $1.2 million dollar renovation starting in December 2017. We will be restoring the entire building and updating everything, so that the building is like new again, but we need your help! We are raising some additional funds to complete some of the extra features that our accountant wont let us do just yet on the outside. We want to create a beautiful sanctuary garden out back, so our guests can unwind and relax, in the tranquil surroundings of a garden sanctuary. We will turn this...

Into this...

It's a Perkorama!

Get a great deal on a room up to 30% off! Or attend one of our special events for free! After our Indiegogo campaign is over, starting in april 2018, the Art House will have a special event, workshop or seminar weekend every month, Our ongoing events will allow you to experience the authentic people and places of Milwaukee first hand. Our events and festivities will cover all kinds of interesting topics like, the best micro brewery tours, or photography lessons from a professional photographer, or a foodie festival from award wining chefs, or world renown architecture tours, visiting special places found only in the Milwaukee area. So make sure you sign up for the events perk on our Indiegogo site right away. And if you sign up early, You will be rewarded with extra free perks that we will offer every week here on Indiegogo during the campaign. Every Sunday, for the next 3 weeks during this Indiegogo campaign, we will have new perks with special limited offerings, and those that have already signed up for one of our regular perks will get a free bonus perk for being one of our early investors! The earlier you help us fund our campaign, the more free perks you get. If you sign up in the 1st week, you will get 3 free bonus perks throughout the campaign! 

All hotel room perks on this campaign have no blackout dates! Book anytime of the year!

Thanks for considering our campaign! 

You can also find more info on our website at www.arthousehotelmilwaukee.com. email us with any questions you have and we’ll get back to you asap!

Dale Stenbroten and Katy Rowe

President of Art House Hotel
story_txt: A New Unique Lodging OptionThe Art House Hotel provides a unique lodging option with a focus on providing travelers with the most flexible accommodations in the industry. More typical single room stays are available, but the hotel places an emphasis on affordable multi-room apartment-style lodging, providing fully stocked kitchens, private living rooms and adjoining bedrooms for an entire family or a small group traveling together.   In addition to private lodging of the highest quality, the Art House Hotel offers small group conference facility options, including comfortable, living room settings for small group gatherings. An outdoor terrace space that is ideal for small ceremonies and special celebratory events. An a la carte menu of concierge and wellness services is also available to meet guest needs on demand. Services range from providing dining options to scheduling in-room massage or other spa services. The building is just a few short blocks from the natural beauty of the shores of Lake Michigan, the Oak Leaf Trail, and Bradford Beach. Also walkable are local cultural assets and attractions including the Milwaukee Art Museum, Summerfest- the worlds’ largest outdoor music festival, the War Memorial and the Discovery World Museum and much more. In addition to optimal walkability, the location also provides easy access to bikesharing stations, public transit, and carsharing modes of transportation, making convenient access to all of Milwaukee's best restaurants, shopping and nightlife. Additionally, the hotel offers free parking spaces in the rear of the building.We Need Your Help!Now as you can see in the photos, the Art House needs a little love and tlc. Well, rest assured, we have plans and the financing in place to give it a $1.2 million dollar renovation starting in December 2017. We will be restoring the entire building and updating everything, so that the building is like new again, but we need your help! We are raising some additional funds to complete some of the extra features that our accountant wont let us do just yet on the outside. We want to create a beautiful sanctuary garden out back, so our guests can unwind and relax, in the tranquil surroundings of a garden sanctuary. We will turn this...Into this...It's a Perkorama!Get a great deal on a room up to 30% off! Or attend one of our special events for free! story:
For more than 20 years, The Comedy Studio has invited comedy’s biggest fans to enjoy emerging talent.  Our mission: to support the comedic arts as an intimate and affordable option for anyone who wants to come to see a show. Many of the biggest names in stand-up comedy today got their start at The Comedy Studio, including Gary Gulman, Eugene Mirman, Sam Jay, Emma Willmann and Jen Kirkman, while others such as Ali Wong, Mike Birbiglia, Anthony Jeselnik, Colin Jost, Sarah Silverman and dozens more have graced the club’s stage over the years. And if that isn’t enough, we won Best Comedy Club in Boston for three consecutive years by Boston Magazine!  Oh yeah, we’re bragging.

Now, after two decades of renting an attic above a restaurant, we are finally moving into our very own space in Union Square, Somerville, MA.  Here we will stay true to our roots: our up-and-coming comedic talent and our dedicated fans will remain our top priority. The only difference is that we will be doing it in our own custom-designed club, and we’ll have a bar! To that end, we want to provide the very best experience for the entertainers and patrons and we would appreciate your support.  It turns out that building a top-notch entertainment venue is expensive! Audio visual systems, lighting and lots of furniture don’t come cheap.  So to make this dream a reality, we decided to try and raise some additional money.

Please help us reach our fundraising goal of $50,000.  Of course, if you want to give more than that, we won’t stop you.  The Comedy Studio will open at Bow Market in Union Square, Somerville  MA later this summer, and we invite you all to come visit us and support the entire Boston comedy community.

story:
BBQ Lovers, Assemble! 

Nickel's Pit BBQ is a result of so many forces aligning: hard work, passion, creativity, fate, love, and pure luck. We happened upon the perfect space for a second, independently-owned location and we've truly risked everything that we have to take this leap. Our Market Street building is a thing of beauty with exposed brick hidden behind tile that we happily smashed open. 

From the dust, we will create smoke but cannot do it without your help. We love what we do and want you to be as proud of this project as we are. (Also, smashing open piggy banks feels so dang good).

Help Us Help You(r Appetites)

We are seeking at least $20,000 to help defer our equipment costs since the kitchen is being built from the ground up and you need those tots. Every dollar you contribute will be put towards the following:

  • Beautiful J&R Manufacturing Smoker (to be lovingly named Butchie)
  • Hood Exhaust System (little smoke in the air = good, room filled with smoke = bad)
  • Fryers (fried pickles, jalapeños, and curlies, oh my)
  • Grill
  • Range
  • Refrigeration
  • Dish Machine
  • Draft System
  • Tables & Chairs
  • Point of Sale System (robot that won't take over the word, just take your order)
  • Signage

How sweet are these perks? Seriously, go look at them right now and come back. Hi there. Amazing, right? There are so many exclusively cool sauces, shirts, clubs, and party starters to choose from, and quite honestly, it's all at a fantastic discount. Whether or not we sell every last item and event, every dollar goes such a long way and we are blessed to be in this position to begin with. 

Say it Louder

"I've said it before and I'll say it again: barbecue may not be the road to world peace, but it's a start." -Anthony Bourdain

To us, BBQ is a way that we connect to people we've known forever, and those we haven't met. It's a riddle we've been trying to answer over the last 7 years and still haven't perfected (but you know we're trying). In March 2019, Nickel's Pit BBQ was recognized as a "Local Hero" by Edible Finger Lakes magazine for our commitment to sourcing locally whenever possible. We take a great amount of pride in serving the Finger Lakes on a plate. This expansion will allow us to continue emphasizing the connection between the farmer and the diner, the brewer or winemaker and the thirsty, and all of our guests with this incredible area. 

Ground Control to Major Tom

The sooner we can get our major equipment and interior ready for business, the faster we can get our perks in your hands. Of course, we know to always 'expect the unexpected' and not count chickens, but we are pros when it comes to adapting to adversity. We all hate the word "can't." So, our promise is simple: we will openly communicate any challenges with our project along the way. We will fulfill your perks whether or not we meet our goal, guaranteed.

If Ya Don't Know, Now Ya Know

You are not obligated to make a purchase but we would still love your help! Word of mouth and social media are the best ways for us to reach our dreams!

  • Please: Share, Repost, 'Gram, Chat, Tweet, Snap, WUPHF, Squawk, Whistle, Smoke Signal, and spread the word any way you can. ANYTHING HELPS!
  • Indiegogo really wants us to remind you to use the Indiegogo share tools! 

Our goal is to serve better, locally sourced BBQ, one community at a time, all while laughing and enjoying the ride.

story:
Summary

My name is Marianne Frisenvang and I have for the last 4 years had a close cooperation with a small cooperative producing sustainable handspund alpaca wool knitting yarn in an isolated village in the Marcapata region in Peru. 

On my trips to Peru I visit areas usually not accessible for tourists. It is for me the "real Peru" to walk with the alpaca breeder Maruja among a herd of 400 alpacas, to visit a local school class in Marcapata or to watch the skilled artisans in the workshop handspinning my yarn.

The artisans, alpaca breeders in the High Andes and I will invite tourists to visit the outstanding and beautiful parts of the Hidden Peru.

This Indigogo project will support me and my partners in Peru setting up the tours. First tourist  trip is planned to be ready in May 2020.

Travels to Hidden Peru will be outstanding experiences for exploreres, will be empowerment of the local population and will create extra income for people in the remote areas presently living under the extreme poverty line.

The backside of the fantastic Peru

When you as a tourist visit Peru there are lots of things to see. The country is so beautiful with breathtaking landscapes, fantastic cities and an amazing history. But only few visitors will even know that a big part of the Peruvians are struggling every single day to keep themselves alive and to create a better future for their children.

Climate changes have impacted the seasons: Winters with extreme cold temperatures and an extended rainy season with much larger quantities of rain make the already difficult living conditions even harsher. 

The population in the high Andes primarily consists of alpaca breeders, craftsmen and agricultural workers. All these professions are relevant to those areas, but often they do not provide enough income for the families to live comfortably. The women living in the mountains are skilled craftswomen and they weave, knit and spin quality yarns. But the customer base in the local areas is extremely small, very few tourists or non at all are visiting the remote villages so sales of the wonderfull crafts does hardly generate any income. As a result 50% of the families live below the general or extreme poverty line, almost half of the children under the age of 5 are permanently malnourished and a large part of the population is illiterate.

 

My Hidden Peru

My company Frisenvang has for the last 4 years had a close cooperation with a small cooperative producing sustainable hand spund alpaca wool knitting yarn in an isolated village in the Marcapata region. My company is a socio economic company with focus on supporting the local initiative in Marcapata (not building any profit to myself ).  My small Danish company is the only customer supporting the cooperative in the Andes Mountains.

The income the women receive from spinning yarn for Frisenvang has changed their lives and, in particular, it has been of great importance to the future of their children. Many families in the area live many hours walking distance from the nearest school, and as they previously could not afford to pay for the bus, their children rarely attended school. With increased income, the children can now go to school every day, which opens up a future with completely different opportunities compared to those their parents had.

Another major difference is their nutritional state. Previously their diet primarily consisted of a certain types of potatoes, which grow in the mountains, but it is now supplemented with meat and other foods.

Why will tours to Hidden Peru be a success?

Lots of agencies offer explorer trips typically with focus on hiking, rafting, climbing and home stays in Lake Titicaca. You can also visit workshops to see the skilled artisans produce woven and knitted textiles, but most of those places are very touristic.

The modern traveller wishes to do unique travels and this kind of organized tours with stays in small villages, attending crafts workshops and spending time with alpaca breeders and their animals is presently not available. 

The target group will be wide; people interested in visiting the unknown and authenthic Peru

I already have a list of app. 40 persons interested in visiting The Hidden Peru.

A trip to Hidden Peru will be truly unique

To keep the visits unique and special the aim is to travel with only small groups with max 6-8 persons pr. group. In this way the focus in the programme can be decided from group to group. There can be tours with focus on yarn production and craftsmanship and groups with a stronger focus on hiking and nature experiences.

Highlights of Hidden Perutour:

* Driving in the high Andes - an extremely beautifull trip in itself

* Lunch at altitude 4000 meters - the most delicate fried fish I have ever had

* Visit the women in the small workshop in Marcapata producing handspun yarn, take part  in     the production, for 1 full day 

* Enjoy relaxing hours at the hot Springs in Marcapata

* Homestay with families in Marcapata

* Visit at a local school

* Stay at a small local mountain ranch at altitude 4200

* 4W drive in the isolated mountains to visit alpaca breeders Marua, Valentino and their 3 sons

* Walk around a herd of 400 alpacas and hold a baby alpaca

* Hike the fantastic lakes in San Martin

Support of the UN sustainable development goals and impact on the population in the local areas 

The yarn production is the key income for the cooperative in Marcapata but I am constantly exploring new opportunities to add more businesses to the areas. 

The Hidden Peru trips will add extra income for the local areas. The cooperative and the alpaca breeders will be paid hourly during the visits. Homestay and meals are paid at good rates for the area. Restaurants and hot springs will have new customers and the local businesses and small craftsmen will be able to sell their products at better prices than selling to the neighbours.

At school visits we will aim at having one of the guests or myself giving a small introduction about a specific topic from the visiting country, this will add new knowledge. 

The production of Frisenvangyarn is done according to traditional methods which is organic and with less negative impact on the environment compared to most other yarn productions.

The Frisenvang yarn production and also the Hidden Peru trips will support several of the UN sustainable development goals.

Project budget

The objective of this Indiegogo project is to collect funds to do the final planning of project trips to The Hidden Peru.  I have been there several times and know which places worth visiting as a tourist and have the key contacts in place, so what is left is the detailed planning of the trips.

If this planning trip is not going to be executed, the funds collected from this Indigogo project will be transferred to the small community in Marcapata.

Timeline

Key milestones:

* July 2019 - Travel in Peru to set-up The Hidden Peru tours

* May 2020 - First The Hidden Peru Trips

The Aim is to execute 2-8 trips in 2020. For 2021 and the comming years the no. of trips can be increased. Trips can take place from May till September (to avoid the rain season where the remote areas can be difficult to vist).

Risk and challenges

A professional set-up will ensure smooth trips

To make sure the trips are planned professionally I have partnered up with an experienced travel agency to take care of booking of flights, payments and who will organize an add-on programme for those interested in seeing more of Peru after the trip to the Hidden Peru. Joining the trips will also be Ronald - member of the cooperative in Marcapata and my key contact in Peru and Martin - an experienced Peruvian guide and translator. Thus any possible questions about Peru, life in the Andes and the alpacas can be answered and this set-up will also ensure that the programme runs smoothly. We will also have a key contact at the travel association in Cusco who will be our support in unforeseen cases.

As the tours will be booked one by one and costs not committed until each group is fully booked there are no financial risk involved.

Your help means a lot

The families in Marcapata, alpaca bredders in San Martin and I will be extremely greatfull if you support the Hidden Peru project. We will be happy for any bagging amount but you can also help us spreading the word through social media. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
If you know Chase, you know how important it is to him to make Oak Cliff Lift a great place for members to train together. He has constantly re-arranged the gym or added equipment as able since opening in August 2016. 

Now, we are sharing new t-shirts and other items to raise funds for upgrading the gym with air conditioning. All the gym members will love it if we can get some AC installed!

Please pick a perk in this campaign and help us make Oak Cliff Lift an even better place to go for workouts. 

Items available: Mugs, Tri blend tee shirts (adult and youth sizes), Women's Tri Rocker Tanks

We need to get to our funding goal of $2,500. This will allow us to install a mini-split ductless AC/Heat unit! Seeing this project through completion and selling a bunch of t-shirts would mean BIG impact for Chase and the gym members. We won't be sweating just because it's hot, but because we're working hard! Knowing that a team of friends and family joined us in this effort to upgrade the gym will be a big deal! Thank you!

Your support will help this community gym continue to be a great place for locals to come for training and coaching with Chase. Any funds raised above our goal will be used on more equipment which is good because members are getting stronger and need more weights :). 

We train for strength. For feeling better and looking better. For taking care of our bodies and being more able and useful.

Please donate any amount you're able. We are so thankful for your support to get this project going!

We are looking to install the heating/cooling system by the end of February because it's still COLD!

Why Indiegogo? The gym and all the equipment has been bootstrapped so far and purchased as needed. We want to have the best equipment and environment possible for our members.  Now, we have a big and important project that needs your help! We are ready to ship t-shirts, tanks, and mugs to get some funds raised for installing AC & Heat! 

Please support my campaign to follow the progress and share with your friends.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot donate right now, can you help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign?

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help us reach our funding goal!

Thank you for the support!
story_txt:
If you know Chase, you know how important it is to him to make Oak Cliff Lift a great place for members to train together. He has constantly re-arranged the gym or added equipment as able since opening in August 2016. 
Now, we are sharing new t-shirts and other items to raise funds for upgrading the gym with air conditioning. All the gym members will love it if we can get some AC installed!
Please pick a perk in this campaign and help us make Oak Cliff Lift an even better place to go for workouts. 
Items available: Mugs, Tri blend tee shirts (adult and youth sizes), Women's Tri Rocker Tanks

We need to get to our funding goal of $2,500. This will allow us to install a mini-split ductless AC/Heat unit! Seeing this project through completion and selling a bunch of t-shirts would mean BIG impact for Chase and the gym members. We won't be sweating just because it's hot, but because we're working hard! Knowing that a team of friends and family joined us in this effort to upgrade the gym will be a big deal! Thank you!

Your support will help this community gym continue to be a great place for locals to come for training and coaching with Chase. Any funds raised above our goal will be used on more equipment which is good because members are getting stronger and need more weights :). 
We train for strength. For feeling better and looking better. For taking care of our bodies and being more able and useful.
Please donate any amount you're able. We are so thankful for your support to get this project going!We are looking to install the heating/cooling system by the end of February because it's still COLD!


Why Indiegogo? The gym and all the equipment has been bootstrapped so far and purchased as needed. We want to have the best equipment and environment possible for our members.  Now, we have a big and important project that needs your help! We are ready to ship t-shirts, tanks, and mugs to get some funds raised for installing AC & Heat! 
Please support my campaign to follow the progress and share with your friends.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you cannot donate right now, can you help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign?
Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help us reach our funding goal!
Thank you for the support!

story:
Dianne and Tamara love books. We really love books. We love books so much we opened a bookstore. Crazy? Nah! But we do need $10,000 to get our bricks and mortar store completely fixtured. Here's a bit about us:

A typical date is a trip to the used bookstore before or maybe after dinner, or after heading out to do some birding.  This is an old-married-couple-nerdy-conversation, which is basically all of our conversations really:

"Bird! Some kind of Hawk!"

"Awesome. Red Tailed? I don't know, I don't have the guidebook. Where's the guidebook?"

"Oh! There's a heron!" (Dianne takes many photographs of herons.)

 "It's cold, let's go get warm... where is the closest bookstore? We need a new guidebook." 

We know all the used book stores from Point Grey to Hope, and all along the Oregon Coast too! And Powell's Books. Ahhh Powell's. We dream of trips down the I5, and don't even care about the bumper to bumper traffic from Everett to Olympia, Powell's is at the end of that journey...

We built the store through a long year which unfortunately did not include a trip to Powell's Books. Just as Tamara started her self-employment program at the local college to learn how the heck to become a small business person, she was diagnosed with Lymphoma. Large B cell cancer death tumor of doom whatever whatever. Scary stuff. Our friend Robyn helped with the final drafting and editing of the business plan, which had to be submitted 3 days after the first chemo treatment. Dianne juggled her work in the floral industry, our other family obligations, and care for Tamara (as she ended up in hospital several times throughout treatment.) Family and friends helped in innumerable ways (our kids and grand-kids and  best-besties most especially) and everyone encouraged us towards wellness and to keep the bookstore dream alive. 

Well the cancer is gone, and by the good grace of having been born and continuing to live in Canada, the medical care has been excellent and we are not bankrupt. So we got to continue with the  work of creating our independent, community based bookstore! We are so grateful for this chance! We pinch ourselves every single day that this gets to be our lives: words, books, stories. So many amazing stories.

Donations of books come in regularly, and all the little generosities of everyday people  allowed us to open our doors. We mean it about the smiles and the hugs, particularly from our customers at the local markets this summer and fall.

So we're open and starting to sell books as people find us and we've booked our first readings with local writers. But our space does not have much electricity - we got some light fixtures put in and a few outlets, but we need more lights and more power. We also do not have a sign on the front of the store, which requires permitting from the city, working with the outer shell of the building to get some electrical out there,  as well as the design and creation of the sign. With a second bathroom, we can have many more people attending our events, so we can really become the vibrant literary hub we're dreaming of. And all these books need to get onto more shelves. We got shelves but we need more.

$10,000 is our request of you, fellow book lovers and believers in all things indie, who want to shop local and dig through stacks to find that one book, and then the next, who want to share their favourite book from childhood with their children, grandchildren, nieces and nephews, or their new or long time companion, who want to support local writers,  who want to walk into a place that feels and smells like home, and who just want a place in the world where things are alright and good and peaceful for a minute or an hour. Bookstores are all of these things. Western Sky Books hopes to be all of these things to all of you. 

We are loosely Oz themed, so everyone who donates will be thanked with their name being added to a brick on the yellow brick road which will weave through the store by the end of the campaign. We'll also offer $10 gift certificates to every donor of $100 or more.

We understand that not everyone can contribute money. We ask if you are in this situation, that you forward our links on to other folks through your networks. Let us know you did and if one of your folks contributes, we'll still add your name, to acknowledge your contribution. And all of you who brought us books, or who will in the future, your names will be added too,

We are learning as we go, and we understand this request is a big one. Tamara has managed projects in the non-profit and social housing sector for a long time, so you can be sure that every dollar will be accounted for and and spent wisely.  If we don't quite make goal, that's ok; we'll adjust our plans and make sure you all know what we  accomplish now and we will will plan for the future.

story:
To know me is to know that my 3 favorite things are cats, desserts & coffee. Put them all together and you get more than your average coffee shop; you get MeWow Cat Cafe. You can enjoy a cup of coffee, a delectable dessert in the company of our cats. More than a cafe is planned.  We will have a community room that is free to use for any educational purpose. We will offer after school tutoring,  pet care seminars, a fund raising platform for any group and space for all ages, needs or interests to gather for their cause,  With a background in teaching and leading teenagers, my passion is learning . 

Your contributions towards our $25,000 goal will make this happen. Our first priority is to secure & renovate a purrfect location in Bucks County, PA. Subsequent funds will be used in the care of the forever home of the cats. Each furry friend lives there until adopted. We are partnered with Bucks County SPCA and their reputation for their advocacy of animal rights precedes them. We are honored they believed in our adventure and will supply our cat residents.   We are also partnered with Kitty Junction another laudable animal rescue should the need arise for additional cats. We will update our campaign at every step to show our progress and commitment. You can show your support with our CATchy fun perks. Tattoos, catnip, tee shirts, gala event, OH MY! Check them out. If $$$ is short, you can help. SPREAD THE WORD. We appreciate that furry much!

story:
About Us :-)

My name is Turell and along with my wife Lynne we own and operate JoeGs Game Center. We named the Game Center JoeGs after our two sons JoVon (8yrs old) & Gianni (11yrs old). By introducing our next generation arcade to Lakeside Mall in Sterling Heights, MI,JoeGs Game Center is a unique spin on an old gaming concept
There may be hope for parents who have a hard time getting their kids out the house to go shopping at the mall and parents with love ones that are more introverted but love gaming. By mixing home console game play (that many are used to) with the fun of a social environment JoeGs is a game lovers dream.

Help us make our dream come true of renovating our location. We’ll be able to add more arcade games, VR gaming area, PC gaming stations and more TV's for our mini sports viewing area. We’re trying to create a super fun place where families can go without spending a fortune. For helping us reach our goal we put together some great perk packages specially designed for our gracious donors. Also, as an early supporter, you will get first access to our new arcade before we announce to the public.

Our Target

Our goal is to raise $70,000 or enough to start renovations and hire more employees.

What Are We Going To Do with The Funds?

Every $1 we raise will put us one step closer to fulfilling our dream

If we reach $40,000, we will have enough to purchase

·         Gaming Chairs

·         Add Retro Lighting

·         Virtual Reality Gaming Systems

·         Marketing Campaign & materials

·         Add PC gaming stations

·         Cover electrician cost to re-wire the arcade to accommodate the additional systems

If we raise $55,000

·         Gaming Chairs

·         Add Retro Lighting

·         Virtual Reality Gaming Systems

·         Marketing Campaign & materials

·         Add PC gaming stations

·         Cover electrician cost to re-wire the arcade to accommodate the additional systems

·         Renovate designated area for PC gaming and E-Sports

·         Include gaming headphones for all current systems

 

If we raise our $70,000 target

·         Gaming Chairs

·         Add Retro Lighting

·         Virtual Reality Gaming Systems

·         Marketing Campaign & materials

·         Add PC gaming stations

·         Cover electrician cost to re-wire the arcade to accommodate the additional systems

·         Renovate designated area for PC gaming and E-Sports

·         Include gaming headphones for all current systems

·         Add sports viewing area

·         Hire an additional 2-4 employees

REWARDING YOUR SUPPORT

For helping us reach our goal we put together some great perk packages specially designed for our gracious donors. Also, as an early supporter, you will get first access to our new arcade before we announce to the public.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't give to our campaign? No problem! Here's some ways you can still help:

  • Spread the word about our campaign! The more people who know, the better our chances of reaching our goal! Please share this campaign with your friends and family (especially those who love gaming).

  • Play a game with us! We're still open at our current location so there's time to play, party, and reminisce before the big move.

story:
Hi! We're Being Frank,
a collective of three creatives: Kirsten Townsend, Jo Theron and Shannon Davis . 'PIMP MY STREET KITCHEN' is our first passion project to turn three street vendors into branded businesses, using our design skills.

The 'PIMP MY STREET KITCHEN' project aims to transform three South African street food vendor trailers into branded, health and safety compliant food trailers, complete with fully-equipped, fully functional kitchens.

The greater goal of this initiative is not to simply afford three entrepreneurs branding and new trailer kitchens, but to up-skill each chef with the knowledge and business acumen to grow their businesses and inspire others to do the same.

In South Africa, informal businesses make up an important part of our economy. Most street food vendors are without branding. Being Frank understands the advantage of owning a brand and how this can help a business grow. We decided to partner with three female food trailer vendors: Ali, Busi and Johanna in Johannesburg, and created a unique visual identity for each business.

The brand identity and design needs to be realised in the real world through the print production and application of the artwork onto the exterior of each trailer.

The vendor’s poorly equipped makeshift operation needs to be replaced with a health and safety compliant food trailer, complete with a working, mobile kitchen - including refrigeration, access to water, deep fryers etc.


 

The greater goal of this initiative is not to simply afford three ladies branding and new trailer kitchens, but to up-skill them with knowledge and business acumen to grow their businesses and inspire others to do the same.

This involves both an entrepreneurial up-skill and kitchen maintenance and meal preparation up-skill. We understand our limits as designers / creatives - and we are by no means experts in these fields. We therefore want to challenge successful entrepreneurs and chefs to 'adopt-a-vendor' and pass on their valuable knowledge. Essentially, in the same vein that we, as Being Frank, have given of our time and skills to each chef, you too can share your knowledge and skills. Your reward will be watching three women, enriched by you, inspire countless others to do the same, making a difference to thousands. If you'd like to know more, please contact us at info@beingfrank.co 
Will you accept our challenge?

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Sharing is caring: Spread the word and share our project on social media
  • Word of mouth: Tell people about it, you might have an uncle in the printing business :)
  • Your voice: the more comments left on this campaign the more popular it becomes, so keep talking!
  • Bloggers & writers: Feel free to feature the PIMP MY STREET KITCHEN project on your blog.
  • Accept the "Greater Goal Challenge" and 'adopt-a-vendor' (see above)

 

Reghardt Bekker, Kris Biddle, Nikki Edwards, Alida van Niekerk, Bryony Dingle-Moss & Gavin Moss, Dana Biddle, Dominic & Carey White, Rosella & Neville Dingle, Wade Moonsamy, Paul Hinch, Peet Engelbrecht, Ané & Rudolph Coetzee, Tom Revington, Jeff & Kerryn Tyser, Kendall Leigh Nash, Juniper Moss, Samukele Belle, Chris Savides, Sarah Haylett-Petty, Wendy Dixon, Amy Phillips, Jonathan & Cheryl Davis, Caroline De Klee, Toni Hughes, Angus Maclaine, Rory MacRobert, Saskia Duckworth, Nicole Solarsh Glickman, Janet Chapman, Christopher Gough Palmer, Doug and Sandy Henwood, Gavin Harford, Katlego Baaitse, Kyla Steenveld, Dalene Steyn, Juliet Honey, Jineil Kandasamy, Gene Arundel, Jessica Steenekamp, Jessica Walsh, JS, Theunis Bekker, Christina Swanepoel, Monique Bissell, Peter Schmitt, Berengere Parouty, Cindy Townsend, Nicole Kerrigan, Victoria Isherwood, Nikki Meier, Solethu Maku, Malatsi Maredi, Jackie Biddle, NomadicGoat, Jess Wright Botha, Tess Davel, Nicola Bower, Nicola Taylor, Este du Plessis, Cara Bush, Jay & Lindsey Davis, Wayde Edwards, Hugo Malherbe, Rob & Wilma Smith, Becki Ferreira, Karin Brass, Limor Ashkenazy, Shirley & Frank Bartos, Catherine Bradley, Aniruddha Krishna, Nathalie Sinkvist, Taylor Allan, Lionel Ross, Ryan Scott Wynn, Wade Townsend, Maritz Verwey, Tarryn Hellyar, Craig McCartney, Rebecca Welby, Diane Franzsen, Devin Munz, Christian Mouton & Marc Allwright, David & Sue Howard, Victor Hugo, Ross Drakes, Andrew Ballentine, Susanne Ewenstein, Matthew Franzsen, Daniel McCauley, Jasper Varlen, Danie Boneschans

story:
Access to more than 50 attractions!

  • Save time and money  —  cheatpass makes sightseeing easy                    
  • Great value  —  Save up to 90%             
  • More choice  —  Over 50 NYC attractions to choose from                   
  • Unlimited  —  CheatBook never expire 
  • Fast track  —  Skip ticket lines at some of the busiest places

               

 

List of Hacked Attractions

              

 

How It Works 

The New York CheatBook grants access to over 50 New York City attractions and the book never expire!

You will also get a 10 - 20 minutes information session after they receive your book.

NYC licensed tour guides will be available online for any questions customers may have.

 

How To Use CheatBook

  • Use the tickets inside of CheatBook
  • Use the coins inside of CheatBook
  • Walk in with CheatBook 

 

Let's play a game 

Holding the Cheatbook and take photos with the attractions tag us on facebook or instagram.

You will be rewarded for cheating!

  • Cheat 10 places reward $5
  • Cheat 15 places reward $15
  • Cheat 20 places or more reward $25

 

Meet the Happy test run "Cheaters" 

              

 

Feedback From CheatBook Test Run

 

Our Advantages 

 

 

About Founder

Ricky Wang is the Brain of Cheatbook, a start up company that embraces the fun and beautiful of the New York lifestyle. As the brain and driving force behind CheatBook, Ricky brings some serious credentials to the table.

​He is an enthusiastic entrepreneur with loads of energy. Beside business, he is member of MENSA, the largest and oldest high IQ society in the world and also he is the gold medal winner of US open Martial art championship and also a star tour guide in New York.  

Ricky was inspired to form CheatBook by his love of travel, entertainment and gracious living.

 

The Impact

story:
• My name is Kelly Hilland and I am a entrepreneur.  My mission is to help small and medium size business obtain needed loans. I am a member of the Army Reserve and plan to retire in 2017. I deployed to IRAQ and Afghanistan.  I served my country because I love the united states of AMERICA.  I  joined the all volunteer forces in 1980 and have been serving my country ever since. As a Colonel and Finance Officer in the military, I always strive to take care of others under my responsibility.  As a new CEO and Financial Consultant I want to be able to help new businesses get to a level where they can be competitive for traditional bank loans. I want to help entrepreneurs who are working so hard to make their business work but need just a little help. With your contributions I can give a few entrepreneurs a glance of hope that with hard work and a little financial support they can obtain the american dream.
  • I am hoping to get to 100k and give 10 business owner 10k each toward their business.
  • COH Financial which is my business will not use any of the funds donated for personnel use.
  • I, Kelly Hilland will not use any of the funds donated for personnel use.
  • Even if I don't reach 100k, I will use whatever is donated toward a business that meets the criteria of: legal, legitimate and hard working.
  • I want to prove that all people need is someone who care about the success of their company.
  • This is a worthwhile effort for people to make a difference. Funds are raised for all sorts of things but why not join me in helping micro-entrepreneurs live their dream.  They will not only get a little funding but my guidance as well. Yes I will work and coach them for free until they are able to get a traditional bank loan or financing from non traditional banks.
  • As a officer in the Military, I took in oath to solemnly swear (or affirm) that I will support and defend the Constitution of the United States against all enemies, foreign and domestic, that I will bear true faith and allegiance to the same; that I take this obligation freely, without any mental reservations or purpose of evasion; and that I will well and faithfully discharge the duties of the office upon which I am about to enter; So help me God .
  • I honored this oath for 34 years and I can be trusted to do the right thing with your donation.
  • I cannot guarantee that all businesses that receive this financial help will succeed. However, I will put every effort into ensuring that I've done my best.  I will document every effort made toward making the business a success.

If you would like to help improve our society by support a new small business here is your opportunity to give back to the world.  I gave up 34 years of my life to make America safe so that many can live the American dream and I am not about to stop now.  Please join me! 

I currently volunteer with the public library and military officer association of america because I will never stop serving my community.
story_txt:
My name is Kelly Hilland and I am a entrepreneur.  My mission is to help small and medium size business obtain needed loans. I am a member of the Army Reserve and plan to retire in 2017. I deployed to IRAQ and Afghanistan.  I served my country because I love the united states of AMERICA.  I  joined the all volunteer forces in 1980 and have been serving my country ever since. As a Colonel and Finance Officer in the military, I always strive to take care of others under my responsibility.  As a new CEO and Financial Consultant I want to be able to help new businesses get to a level where they can be competitive for traditional bank loans. I want to help entrepreneurs who are working so hard to make their business work but need just a little help. With your contributions I can give a few entrepreneurs a glance of hope that with hard work and a little financial support they can obtain the american dream.
I am hoping to get to 100k and give 10 business owner 10k each toward their business.
COH Financial which is my business will not use any of the funds donated for personnel use.
I, Kelly Hilland will not use any of the funds donated for personnel use.
Even if I don't reach 100k, I will use whatever is donated toward a business that meets the criteria of: legal, legitimate and hard working.
I want to prove that all people need is someone who care about the success of their company.
This is a worthwhile effort for people to make a difference. Funds are raised for all sorts of things but why not join me in helping micro-entrepreneurs live their dream.  They will not only get a little funding but my guidance as well. Yes I will work and coach them for free until they are able to get a traditional bank loan or financing from non traditional banks.
As a officer in the Military, I took in oath to solemnly swear (or affirm) that I will support and defend the Constitution of the United States against all enemies, foreign and domestic, that I will bear true faith and allegiance to the same; that I take this obligation freely, without any mental reservations or purpose of evasion; and that I will well and faithfully discharge the duties of the office upon which I am about to enter; So help me God .
I honored this oath for 34 years and I can be trusted to do the right thing with your donation.
I cannot guarantee that all businesses that receive this financial help will succeed. However, I will put every effort into ensuring that I've done my best.  I will document every effort made toward making the business a success.

If you would like to help improve our society by support a new small business here is your opportunity to give back to the world.  I gave up 34 years of my life to make America safe so that many can live the American dream and I am not about to stop now.  Please join me! 
I currently volunteer with the public library and military officer association of america because I will never stop serving my community.
